On the outskirts of a small village is a cave. Inside this cave is a powerful dragon. This dragon has terrorized the village for years, always stealing livestock. Fearful of the day that the dragon would tire of cattle and sheep, the village leaders sent for the man who could potentially solve their problems, the well-known knight and dragon-slayer Sir Eric.

As Eric road up to the cave, he counted the gold coins that the village had given him, which was fifty if he agreed to do the deed, with a further hundred and fifty when the job was done and the dragon was dead.

"These villagers get more insolent every year," he muttered. "If it wern't for the fact that I swore an oath to not harm the defenseless I'd kill that Mayor for his little condition. Well, at least the pay will be well worth it."

Then he looked up from his counting and saw the cave and said, "Well here is my destination. Time to kill myself another dragon."

Eric then got off his horse, took out his sword and walked into the cave. When he entered the cave, everything became dark. He could hear the dripping of water coming from somewhere. He could feel the temperature of the cave start to warm up the further he went in, and he could hear the dragon breathing, heavily.

Suddenly, he saw it, the black dragon that the villagers had told him about. It seemed to be laying on something, its hoard Eric thought.

"I see the villagers asked you to come here," said a deep voice. "The question is what is it that they asked you to do?"

"They hired me to slay you, you foul beast," Eric said, raising his shield slightly.

"Foul Beast! You have no idea as to who is a foul beast human," the dragon said, getting up on its feet. "Your kind have slaughtered my kin for centuries, even when we do nothing to harm you. You just think that we are animals who deserve nothing more than to be killed on sight."

"Oh I have my reasons," Eric said, as he advanced towards the dragon. "It was your kind who burned my village and killed my family."

"So because of the actions of one dragon you think that all of them are evil," the dragon said, circling around. "I wonder if you'd feel that way if you were a dragon and a human had killed your mate and murdered your unborn children, like mine were. I've killed many of your type before, especially those who seem to think that glory is found through the killing of innocent creatures, just because they are not humans. However, in spite of this, I've never seen all humans as evil creatures that need to be killed, only some of them."

"If you think that you can talk me out of this, think again," Eric said. "I'm going to get good money for killing you."

"Well, since you seek a profit, perhaps you should get to work," the dragon said, with a chuckle.

"Oh it's not the profit that I do this for," Eric said with a laugh of his own. "It's the pleasure of wiping your kind out."

"Oh you're going to find this fight to be not as pleasurable, and more costly, than you think," the dragon said as it charged him.

Suddenly, the two of them were fighting, the dragon slashing with its claws and shooting fire from its mouth, and Eric hacking away with his sword and blocking with his shield, each seeking the weaknesses of the other. Eric had scored several good hits against the dragon, with many good cuts along its underside and limbs, but he'd taken injury as well, for his shield arm was broken, and he was clutching the side of his chest. However, Eric felt that he was the one who'd survive this fight.

Just then, the dragon swung its tail, slamming him against the cave wall, forcing him to drop his sword. Then, the dragon pinned him against the wall with its claw.

"Well, this is the most fun I've had in a while," the dragon said, panting heavily. "However, like with all things, it must end."

"Then go ahead and kill me," Eric said, struggling to get out of the dragon's grip.

"Oh I'm not going to kill you," the dragon said. "In fact, I plan to let you live, and experience life as a dragon."

At this, the dragon began to mutter something, and Eric felt himself being pulled out of his body.

"No," he said. "You can't do this to me."

"I can and I shall," the dragon said, still muttering its spell.

1113.content:
Eric's arms did not move. Instead, rather, something else moved. Not physical, but it felt otherworldly and almost purely telepathic.

Suddenly, there was naught but darkness...

Eric awoke, but only to the feeling of pressure upon his face in a way that he never experienced before. Something was different, he could sense it, and began to take in things one instance at a time as he slowly fluttered his eyes open. One detail that he noticed almost immediately was the still shining of steel above him.

It was... Eric's sword held in front of his eyes, only smaller than how he last recalled it... and it was being held by... Eric!

But, no, it was not him. It was his body, but how could Eric not be inside his own body? He started to piece it all together... and he began to remember.

In his slowly waking stasis, Eric tried to understand the situation as he watched his sword relinquish its aim from his head and as his human body seemed to walk off on its own. Eric broadened his eyes in surprise.

"What? Have you never seen yourself before?" he heard. It was Eric's voice! Yet, it seemed as if every syllable was thoroughly and unnaturally pressured on, giving an almost comic after-effect. His voice continued, "No, I'm not going to slay you like you would have done to me. I have morals, you know."

Eric began to understand the situation.

Eric tried to speak, saying, "You!" when he shocked himself. The voice that came out... it was the dragon's voice! He began to look around when all he saw were thick black scales across his body and serrated claws at the ends of his fingers. As Eric pulled his weight up, he looked at his human body only to see that it was below him and much smaller in stature. Eric bellowed, "You did this!?"

"Well, you cannot blame me for this. I never expected this to happen!" he heard his voice respond from his human body, "Besides, I never expected such an odd feeling within a human body. It feels... inadequate, as if you are constantly trying to make up for the lack of something. No wonder you desire to slay any form of intelligent life you encounter!"

With a burning rage, Eric heaved his hand onto a chunk of rock within the wall of the cave, ripping a boulder away from the rest of the structure.

As he was about send the massive stone towards the enemy that stole his body, he was halted with a logical statement, "Hold! Unless you wish to destroy your own body out of pure foolishness!" his voice punctured the wall of emotions. Eric set the boulder down onto the cave floor.

Eric's human body continued, "My name is Zartax. If you still view us as enemies, then you are unfortunately mistaken. We are much more alike than ever before!"

Eric watched as Zartax clutched the side of his human body with his limp shield-arm. It seems as if the injuries from the battle were still present.

"Now, I will go seek out what you humans call a 'healer'. Hmph. Typical that those like you seek out the aid of another instead of relying on your own experience. I guess it comes with the body." Zartax concluded as he began to walk towards the exit of the cave.

As he watched Zartax walk off, Eric looked at his new dragon body. He noticed the heavy lacerations across his arms and side. Also, he noticed that a few of the more fatal-looking wounds were bandaged over with some of the wrappings and medicinal ointments that Eric remembered taking earlier in his journey to the cave. Glancing over at the exiting Zartax, he noticed his human hands were largely stained with blood.

"But, why?" Eric solemnly asked after a short pause.

"Why? Call it a personal flaw, but I believe that everyone deserves a second chance." Zartax glanced at the sword he was carrying as he responded, "Even you. A week from now, I will come back here after I correctly repurpose the spell I used that led to our body switch. Then you can make the decision. For now, I recommend that you look for the springs on the eastern side of this mountain to heal those wounds you gave yourself."

And with that, Zartax walked out into the blinding daylight outside of the cave.

"Wait, what decision? And after a whole week!?" Eric cried out after him, but no response was received this time.

Eric looked behind himself. The wings were folded at his sides and his spiked tail was flicking around absent-mindedly. He saw the sword wounds again. I have to find those springs...

The voice came from behind, slowly, cooly, "Oh, I most certainly have." "Gwa, get away from me," Eric said, pushing the dragon away and stumbling forward on unfamiliar legs.

The dragon only looked at him in a sly manner. "You know what the difference between me and you is?" He was still using that horrible voice, as if he-- Eric froze. He knew that voice, he himself had used it many times...on women. Eric quickly did a mental check...something was definitely not where it was supposed to be.

"The difference between me and you is simple: I am a healthy adult male, and you..." the dragon said, giving Eric a onceover that gave him the creeps. "...are a healthy adult female."

Though Eric had already guessed it, the dragon speaking his predicament out loud gave it a chilling reality, as if he had spoken it into existence right there. The dragon continued to watch Eric critically, holding eye contact for a bit too long here and there.

Eric thought that pregnancy was a bother as a male. As a female, it was a wholly different story. Each day, he would feel more and more miserable, and each day, some different part of his body would be tender, or sore, or a combination of both. One day, a deer would be the nectar of the god's, the next, it would be nauseating. He simply didn't know how women (and any female for that matter) did it.

But somehow, his new body had known what to do, and after several traumatic hours, Eric had sat looking at a pile of watermelon-sized eggs, their leathery appearance mottled with dark spots. Though he knew that he'd only done some of the work, he still felt a sense of pride at what he'd managed to accomplish, for in his book, laying eggs successfully is a big accomplishment for one who hadn't had such anatomy for more than about a week.

The eggs sat next to each other, the little dragons quietly developing in their shells. Eric spent his time eating, for eating helped the nausea and boredom, and it also kept his mind from any maternal bonding that his body impressed upon him. He wanted to take care of the baby dragons, not love them.

But when the fateful day arrived, and the tiny figures began cracking their protective shells, Eric couldn't help but love them as he watched them perform the amazing feat of hatching. Eric noticed that their eyes were closed, apparently sealed with some sort of mucus. As each one hatched, they began to squeal pitifully for their mother, which soon reminded Eric that HE was supposed to fulfill that role. As their squeals filled the air, the euphoric maternal feelings retreated, replaced with a sense of duty to protect and nurture, but what task to do first, Eric didn't know. He knew that whatever task he picked, his instincts would guide him, but he didn't know in what order to do them in.

He made his best guess, and went for it.

His long and narrow body was that of a Serpent, like one of those who tempted Eve in the garden of Eden. His wings were like those of a demon he'd seen in woodcuttings, and his claws and teeth were like those of a lion he'd heard about, only far larger. As for his scales, they were as black as those of the dragon who had cursed him. The only good thing about his transformation was the fact that he was still male, as Esmerda had told him that he could of been turned into a female dragon.

At the moment, he was unhappy. He and Esmerda had been in another argument, one in which he was told to watch over his younger siblings, who were created in one of two ways, either by Esmerda having sex with another dragon, or by a process similar to how he'd been turned into a dragon, in which the soul of a dying dragon was removed from its body and placed into an unfertilized egg to be reborn. However, he wanted nothing to do with the caring and raising of dragons, especially considering what they did to him and others. However, Esmerda had one major advantage, she had his human body. On more than one occasion she had threatened to either tear it to pieces, or roast it, or just plain eat it, unless he did as she asked. This time she had actually put it in her mouth and was about to swallow it when Eric had reluctantly given in. After that, she had spat the body out and hid it, like she always did, with a smirk on her face.

Of course, there were times that she was nice to him, like when he had a fever when he was starting to develop his fire lungs and he was having trouble using them or the time he'd broken one of his legs in a bad fall and torn the skin on his wings when he was just starting to fly, and a few other times. But by and large, he hated Esmerda for what she did to him. He wanted to kill her, but if he did that, his human body would remain hidden for all eternity.

"I can't live my life like this," he thought. He looked down and saw a large pointed sword-like rock. "If I jump off this cliff and don't use my wings, that rock will spear me and I'll be dead." Then, he shook his head and said to himself, "No, that's suicide, and God punishes Suicides."

114311211212111.content:
After taking a few steps deeper into the forest Lord Silvermore changes back to his human form.

"Son you should change to human form as well, the space between the trees are getting too narrow and we're too easily tracked" said Lord Silvermore.

Eric lowers himself to the ground so that Annabella has a easier time climbing of his back. Once she gets off and moves further away he also changes to his human form.

"Stay on guard son this is the Forest of the Fay and it's extremely dangerous to outsiders " said Lord Silvermore.

"Forest of the Fay? I've never heard of that before. What makes it more dangerous than any other forest?" asked Eric.

"The story goes that the forest in inhabited by all kinds of forest spirits and elves that really they don't like intruders, many people have disappeared after entering the forest and the few that do get out are half out of their minds". said Lord Silvermore.

Their group continues to wander in the forest without finding a exit, everything looks the same and the trees branches are so dense that almost no light shines through, Eric didn't even know how much time has passed since they entered the forest, although it felt like hours. The forest was also unnaturally quiet and Eric kept feeling strange vibrations in the air.

"Is anyone else feeling that?" asked Eric

"Feeling what?" asked Annabella

"Those vibrations" replied Eric

"Yes I feel them two, as dragons we are more sensitive to magic, the very air seems to thrum with it. This wandering around is getting us nowhere lets change back to dragon form and try to fly out." said Lord Silvermore.

Eric then tries to change back to dragon form but found that he couldn't.

"I can't change back" said Eric

Annabella tries one of her spells but it also fails and Lord Silvermore gets a troubled look on his face

"Whatever's blocking our magic must be really strong. I've never heard of anything strong enough to keep a dragon from using magic." Said Annabella

Eric suddenly sees a small white light flying between the trees toward them, it stops a few feet from them then just hovers in the air before them, a few times in would quickly fly at their faces before turning around and retreating again before it starts hovering again.

"What is that thing?" asked Eric.

"A sprite I think" replied Annabella.

"Is it dangerous?" asked Eric.

"No, they are mischievous pranksters but not malicious." replied Annabella.

"What do you think it wants?" asked Eric.

"It could be trying to show us the way out of the forest." said Lord Silvermore.

"Or she could be distracting you so we can move into position." said a unknown voice behind them.

Eric twists around quickly and sees four Elven rangers standing behind them with their bows drawn. Three were male and one was female, with long hair that hanged to their shoulders the female had white blond hair and bright blue eyes, two of the Males had brown hair and had identical facial features so Eric realized that they are twins while the last elf had black hair with glowing yellow eyes like that of a Hawk . They all wore leather armor with bracers on their forearms and long leather boots with forest green leggings and a shirt under their armor and a green cloak with a white oak on it, over their shoulder was a quiver with white feathered arrows and swords were tied to their belts. The black haired elf also had a silver circlet with a glowing emerald in its center on his head, Eric realized that he must be the leader of the band. They were pale and frail looking but Eric knew it was a deception, he heard many stories of the elves and their fast reflexes.

"How did they manage to sneak up on us?" thought Eric

The sprite then flied past Eric's shoulder and stopped at eye level in front of the black-haired elf, "Well done Brenda" Said the elf leader.

"Who are you and what do you want?" asked Lord Silvermore

The black-haired elf gestured to himself "I'm known as Hawkeyes among the Fay"

"I'm Lilith" answered the woman

"And we're Elvenar and Findor" answered the two brothers at the same time.

"And we are here to punish you" said Hawkeyes

"Punish us, for what?" asked Annabella

"You are guilty of trespassing in the Forest of the Fay, The penalty has always been death" said Hawkeyes

"We had no intention of violating your realm, if you show us the way out we'll..." said Lord Silvermore

Before Lord Silvermore could finish his sentence Eric drew his sword and charged at Hawkeyes. He wanted to wound him while his attention was focused elsewhere and hopefully scare the other elves away before they decided to kill their group.
114311211212111.title: They get ambushed by fairies

1143112112121111.content:
"WAIT" called Lord Silvermore but Eric ignored him

Even though Eric couldn't change into dragon form some of his abilities as a dragon he kept as a Human, he was stronger, faster and more resilient than a Human. He knew the elves would be expecting him to have human level abilities so he hoped to catch them by surprise.

The elves quickly moved to the his left and right except for their leader who just stood his ground, what surprised Eric is that the leader didn't seem concerned about him charging at him, he didn't reach for his sword or even draw a arrow and he lowered his bow to his side.

"What's the elf thinking isn't he going to defend himself?" thought Eric, he considered stopping the attack but quickly reconsidered it.

"If its a trick they'll kill us all, I have to finish what I started!" thought Eric.

Unfortunately Eric underestimated the elven leader's speed. As he stabbed at the elf's belly the elf twisted aside at the last possible moment and Eric's sword passed through empty air. Eric's speed carried him past the elf and before he could stop and turn to face him he received a hard kick in the back which sent him flying headfirst into a nearby tree.

If Eric was still human the impact would have knocked him out but since he was a dragon it only stunned and disoriented him. He staggered back then went down on one knee and waited for his vision to stop spinning and the ringing in his ears to end. Once his vision cleared he looked up and saw Hawkeye standing in front of him with a arrow aimed at his head. The other elves had arrows aimed at his companions.

"WAIT" called Annabella.

"Why should we?" asked Hawkeye.

"You can't just execute us" said Annabella.

"Oh, and why not?" asked Lilith.

"Because I'm Princess Annabella, daughter of the king of Firamore and his heir." said Annabella.

That announcement caught the elves by suprise they stirred and murmured amoung themselves and Hawkeye raised a eyebrow.

"A bold claim, but how can we be sure its the truth" said Hawkeye.

"I have a Firamore royal family signet ring" said Annabella.

"Let me see that" said Hawkeye. He holds out his hand and Annabella removes a gold ring from her finger and places it in his palm, he pinches it between two fingers and holds it up to the light so that he can better see the face of the ring, which has the Firamore royal family's crest carved into it. Hawkeye stares at the ring with a thoughtful expression when Lilith walks closer.

"They could have stolen it" Lilith pointed out.

"Possibly but if its the truth we can't just kill them, it would cause a war between Firamore and the Fey" said Hawkeye.

"So what do we do?" asked one of the brothers.

"We'll take them to the King of the Fey, he will decide what to do with them. Disarm them and bind their hands we go to the Capital" said Hawkeye.

"BRENDA!" called Hawkeye.

The sprite which had been hiding behind Hawkeyes since Eric charged at them flies around him before stopping at eye level.

"Fly ahead of us and let the king know that we're bringing visitors" said Hawkeye.

The sprite then flies off between the trees while the elves tie Eric and Lord Silvermore's hands and take their swords. Once they're done they form into a defensible formation around the group. Eric and Lord Silvermore stand on either side of the princess so they can defend her with their bodies if the elves turn hostile. the two elven brothers stand on either side of the group with their swords drawn and ready while Lilith takes a position further back with her bow aimed at their backs. Hawkeye hung his bow across his back and took the forward position, he kept his sword in its scabbard but placed his hand on the hilt so he can draw it quickly if he needed to. He then turns his head and looks at Eric.

"If you try to escape we'll kill you, MARCH!" said Hawkeye.

The elves then lead Eric and his group deeper into the forest.
1143112112121111.title: Eric loses again

choices: The elves are his enemies too
11431121121211111.content:
As the elves were leading Eric and his companions deeper into the forest he kept trying to think of a way for them to escape, but he couldn't think of a plan that would work.

"Even if we could escape the elves, we would never find a way out of the forest." thought Eric. The thought of wandering through the dark forest for months without finding the way out worried Eric. Despite everything looking the same for Eric the elves never hesitated or seemed to lose there way.

After some time Eric began to see multicolored lights hanging from the tree branches and he also began to hear voices ahead. When Lilith saw what Eric was looking at she moved closer.

"Those lights mean we are close to our capital." said Lilith.

As the walked in between two trees Eric saw the elven city.

Before them was a grove with three trees that were as big as mountains standing close together in the center. On the ground leading up to the trees were several open fields were elven horses were running freely. There was also many smaller fruit trees with many elves tending to them and picking the fruit growing on them. Before them was a path leading to the center with beautiful statues on either side. A wooden wall surrounded the three center trees and at the end of the path was a gate with the same oak symbol that was on Hawkeye's cloak.
A walkway big enough for Eric and Lord Silvermore to walk side by side in dragon form spiraled around the trunk of the biggest tree. The walkway and the buildings in the tree seemed to have been grown from the tree as if the were a part of it.

"You should be honored humans, you're the first of your kind to see this in over a century" said Hawkeyes.

"This is amazing, I've read about the architecture of the elves but I never thought I would see it for myself!" said Annabella.

As they walked down the path towards the gate the elves and spirits stopped what they were doing to stare at them.

Once they reached the gate a guard on the top called out. "Halt, state your name and purpose!"

"Hawkeyes and his patrol, we bring important prisoners for the king." answered Hawkeyes.

The guard nodded his head.

"The king is expecting you, make your way to the great hall." said the guard.

"OPEN THE GATE!" shouted the guard.

As they climbed higher up the tree Eric saw another kind of spirit. At first Eric thought it was a female elf but when she turned to them Eric saw that her skin was pale green and she had leaves instead of hair on her head. When she saw them her form blurred. When it cleared Eric saw that she was covered in bark like a tree and her arms had grown longer and her fingers ended with very sharp branchlike claws. As they walked by Eric saw nothing but hate and fury in her eyes.

"She's a dryad, the self-appointed guardians of nature." said Hawkeyes after he saw what Eric was looking at.

The tree-city was so high that they eventually climbed above the height of the other trees and Eric could see that the sun was just beginning to set below the horizon.

"We were in the forest for an entire day." thought Eric.

At the top of the tree was two huge doors that lead into the trunk of the tree. Inside was a long hall that ended at a wooden throne that seemed to have grown out of the far wall. On either side of the path stood two rows of Elven guards in full armor armed with a spear and tower shield, and behind them stood several dryads in their battle-forms. To the right of the throne rested a large green scaled dragon and to the left of the throne stood one male and on female druid. The female wore a green robe and carried a staff in her right hand. The male also had a staff but he wore nothing but a pair of leggings and a wolf pelt, on his chest Eric saw strange tatoos and around his neck was a necklace of wolf's teeth. Compared to the other elves he looked wild and savage.

Once they were a few feet from the throne Hawkeyes and the twins went down on one knee and bowed their heads to the king, Lilith moved forward and forced Eric and the others to their knees before doing the same herself. The king sat up straight and looked at Hawkeyes.

"Why do you bring these humans before me son?" asked the king.

"We found them wandering near one of the ward stones and she claims to be the princess of Firamore, she carried a Firamore signet ring so I thought it best to bring them to you." answered Hawkeyes.

"Very well, I'll handle our guests, you may go." said the king.

The patrol rose to their feet and turned to leave before the king called out.

"Hawkeyes, I haven't finished with you yet so wait outside the hall for me to call you." said the king.

Hawkeyes turned his head and nodded to the king before he resumed walking back to the entrance.

"Why did you trespass on our land princess?" asked the king.

"We were fleeing Magimore for my uncle's kingdom when we were driven into the forest." answered Annabella.

"Why were you fleeing your home?" asked the king.

"Our enemies were getting closer and we thought it best to relocate to someplace more defensible." answered Annabella.

"Who are your enemies?" asked the king.

"Irzac the black knight" answered Annabella.

The two druids reacted with surprise and a look of anger appeared on the king's face.

"You are enemies with the black knight? asked the king.

"Yes" answered Annabella.
11431121121211111.title: They're taken to the capital

choices: They reach the edge of the forest without incident
They are attacked along the way
114311211212111111.content:
"Then we have something in common, human." said the king.

"You've had trouble with him as well?" asked Annabella.

"He desires the magic in our forest to increase his own power and that of the sorcerers who serve him but we drove him off many times." said the king.

The green-scaled dragon lifted its head and whispered something to the king.

"Envy tells me that you two are shape shifted dragons. Why do you follow the enemy of your race, are you her slaves?" asked the king.

"No your majesty, we work with her of our own free will as allies. I have been training her knights for many years." answered Lord Silvermore.

"You would train those that kill your kind?" asked the king.

"I try to show them that we're not the bloodthirsty beasts that they think we are." answered Lord Silvermore.

"And have you had success." asked the king.

"I have your majesty, many of the knights under her command no longer kill innocent dragons, the princess has also been a good friend and has tried to change the old ways." answered Lord Silvermore.

"Where were you going before my patrol found you?" asked the king.

"To my uncle's kingdom, your majesty." answered Annabella

"I wouldn't recommend that. Irzac's army is busy closing in on the city of Sanctuary.Your mother and father have fled to the city and Irzac intends to capture it, I believe he knows that you would flee to the city and wants to set a trap for you there." said the king.

"All the more reason to hurry, we might be able to make a difference there." said Eric

"You are determined to do this despite the risks?" said the king.

"Yes" replied Eric.

"I can't say that I approve of this, but it isn't my decision to make. What I can do is help you reach the city safely." said the king.

"HAWKEYES!" called the king. Hawkeyes came back in and walked to the throne before kneeling next to Eric.

"You called your majesty." said Hawkeyes.

"These people will be leaving for the city of Sanctuary, and you will guide them to it safely." said the king.

"I beg your pardon?" said Hawkeyes.

"You heard me, last I checked your ears were still working." said the king.

"You know that I have certain... Views, about their kind." said Hawkeyes.

"I do, and that is why you must go with them. Your desire to protect the forest is admirable but your fanaticism is starting to rival the dryads. Not all humans are like the ones who wronged you. It's time you learned that." said the king.

"But what if I cause a diplomatic incident?" asked Hawkeyes.

"Then I will be VERY Disappointed." threatened the king.

The king then turned back to Princess Annabella."It's almost dark and the forest gets dangerous at night even for my people, so you will leave tomorrow at dawn. A servant will show you to your quarters and I will bring you a meal if your hungry." said the king.

The next morning a elven servant wakes Eric and escorts him and the others to the main gates at the base of the tree-city where Hawkeyes was waiting. "It's about time, do humans always sleep this late?" asked Hawkeyes. He had exchanged his cloak with the oak symbol for a hooded one that he had closed around himself to hide his armor and weapons. the hood was raised to hide his face and a scarf was tied over his lower face so only his eyes were visible.

"Good morning to you too. I thought elves were supposed to be good mannered." replied Eric.

"I'm not here to make friends. I'm here to complete a mission." said Hawkeyes.

"That's good because with that attitude you won't make any but I have to ask, what's with the cloak and dagger look?" said Eric.

"My people are as welcome in your lands as humans are in mine. So I don't want to draw attention to our group." said Hawkeyes

"If you don't want to draw attention then you might want to rethink that look." said Eric.

"Why?" asked Hawkeyes.

"Because you look like a bandit." said Eric.

"Better a bandit than a lone elf wandering the country side. Let's go we have a long journey ahead of us." said Hawkeyes.

"WAIT!" called someone. Eric turned to the sound to see the same elven druidess from their audience with the king the previous night running towards them from the city.

"I thought I might have been too late. My king asked me to present you with these tokens." said the druidess.

She opened a pouch to reveal three large acorns with the same oak symbol that Eric saw on the gate of the city. A gold chain was tied through the acorn so that they can be hung from the neck.

"Err, thanks... what is it?" asked Eric.

"Acorns from the Mother of the Forest." said the druidess

"What is the Mother of the Forest." asked Lord Silvermore.

"The Mother of the Forest is the largest tree in the Forest. It is believed that it was once a normal tree but it continued to absorb magic until it became intelligent. Since then it has been connected to the fate of the forest. When the Mother is sickly so is the forest, when its flourishing so is the forest. We believe that if the mother ever dies so will the forest and everything in it. The acorns are only given to the greatest friends of the fay or to people touched by destiny. If you encounter elves or spirits they will know you are a friend and must not be harmed. While you wear it no mage will be able to scry your location. It will shield you from the effects of dark magic so no one will be able to influence your mind or curse you and it will also boost the power of your magic." explained the druidess.

"Please thank your king for me. He honors us with such priceless gifts." said Annabella.

"Yes he does, you must remember that as well as the trust that he places in you. Don't disappoint him." said the druidess.

"Let's go, we have wasted enough time already." said Hawkeyes.

Hawkeyes then takes the lead and walks away from the city and deeper into the forest.
114311211212111111.title: The elves are his enemies too

1143112112121111111.content:
Up ahead Eric sees bright light shining from in between the trees as he walks between them he looks around and see wide open plains around him. The sun was just beginning to set. Eric isn't claustrophobic but he was so glad to be out of the confining forest and in open space again.

"Finally, I thought we would never get out." said Eric.

"Most intruders don't get out alive. So count yourselves lucky. The sun is beginning to set we should spend this time trying to find shelter. We can continue with the journey tomorrow." said Hawkeyes.

Eric's group soon found shelter at an abandoned farm. The building was still in good condition but all the food had been cleared out. Whoever lived there left recently and in a big hurry. They were at the moment all sitting in front of a campfire outside the building waiting for the supper that Eric had caught to finish.

"We should discuss what we're going to do tomorrow." said Hawkeyes.

"What is there to discuss, we can turn into dragon form and fly to Sanctuary. We can be there in a few hours" replied Eric.

"No, that wouldn't be wise. Irzac's patrols are all over the countryside. We also believe that Irzac is somewhere in the area. If we're spotted we'd soon have the entire army closing on our position. Irzac also have many mages in his army and while those acorn necklaces hides you from their scrying. It won't be able to protect you when you take dragon form.

"Wait! before we decide anything. What's the condition of the kingdom?" asked Annabella.

"Not good. Your uncle has pulled back all his forces to Sanctuary so Irzac's men have free reign in the region. They have been burning fields and villages since then. Your uncle has evacuated all his people and had them escorted to Sanctuary so his guards can better protect them so any person we encounter could be one of Irzac's men. They also gathered up anything that they can use in wartime: food, horses and weapons. So supplies will be difficult to find." answered Hawkeyes.

"So what are our options?" asked Annabella

Our best chance is to sneak through the area and for that reason I think we should avoid the roads." said Hawkeyes.

"How long would that take?" asked Annabella.

"Four days maybe a bit longer." replied Hawkeyes.

"Sanctuary might not have that kind of time. If we used the roads we could cut that time in half." said Annabella

"Yes, but it would also be more likely that we would run into Irzac's patrols." replied Hawkeyes.
1143112112121111111.title: They reach the edge of the forest without incident

11431121121211111111.content:
"I realize it's a risk but we'll have to take it. What's the point of going to Sanctuary if it's already captured by the time we get there." said Annabella.

Hawkeyes thinks the plan through for a few more minutes before he speaks again.

"Very well. I see your point we'll have to try but in order for the plan to work you'll have to follow these conditions fully." said Hawkeyes.

"What conditions?" asked Eric.

"We have to avoid any travelers on the road because anyone of them could be Irzac's men. And if we are discovered we'll have to kill everyone who saw us without exception. Even if someone drops his weapons and surrenders, we'll have to kill him. We can't take the risk that he would go to Irzac and tell him our location." said Hawkeyes.

"I don't like that second one." said Eric.

"I know, but it's necessary if we are too succeed. If its too much trouble for you then we'll have to go through the countryside. Because everyone except Irzac's men has been evacuated we won't be able to talk our way out of a fight. Irzac's men will arrest or execute anyone that they find on the roads. Because they will assume that anyone they find will be a spy, soldier or ally of the kingdom" said Hawkeyes.

"All right, I agree with the conditions but I don't like it at all." said Eric. Annabella and Lord Silvermore also grudgingly agrees to the conditions

"Good, I believe dinner is ready. Let's finish eating then you three should get some rest. I'll keep watch." said Hawkeyes.

The next morning they take one last look through the farmhouse for anything useful. Annabella found a old and worn hooded cloak but it fit her reasonably well so she took it so that she can hide her face from any travelers that they might find on the road. As they walked they saw no sign of any travelers but everywhere was signs of the war. Many field were burned or burning, houses were torn down and ransacked and they even came across a recent battlefield. The bodies had simply been left where they fell and crows and other scavengers were already picking through the area. Hawkeyes was kneeling on the ground and inspecting the ground and the bodies.

"From the looks of it your soldiers were escorting wagons full of supplies through the area when Irzac's men found them, princess." said Hawkeyes.

"I'm not seeing any wagons now." said Annabella.

"No that's because after Irzac's men killed the guards they took them somewhere." replied Hawkeyes.

He pointed to a section of the ground where Eric saw deep grooves in the ground as if something heavy dragged through them. They led away from the massacre and deeper into the countryside.

"Could it be more of the princess's men. Maybe some survived and took it to safety." said Eric.

"No, look at the tracks surrounding the grooves. They match the boots of Irzac's men, not the guards. If they are moving the wagons instead of destroying them then they must have a army camp nearby. We need to be extra careful as the area will be full of patrols." said Hawkeyes.

"Then we should leave the area quickly." said Lord Silvermore.

"No, you three go ahead. I'm going to follow the tracks back to their camp." said Hawkeyes.

"Don't be foolish. Why would you want to do that?" replied Lord Silvermore.

"We need to find out what kind of forces Irzac has in the area, How many men he has and how well equipped they are. I also want to see if I can't sabotage their army. It might buy Sanctuary a few more hours and that time could mean the difference between victory and defeat." said Hawkeyes.

"Then we should go with you." said Lord Silvermore.

"No, If I'm discovered they'll just think I'm a lone elf causing trouble, not worth pursuing in wartime but if they see you then they will have their entire army looking for us. Don't worry about me. I can take care of myself and this isn't the first time I've caused mischief for humans." said Hawkeyes.

"How will you find us again?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"A few miles ahead is a village called Forest Springs, wait for me there. If I haven't arrived there by noon assume that I've been captured and continue on without me." answered Hawkeyes.

"All right, we'll meet you there. Good luck." said Lord Silvermore.

Eric, Annabella and Lord Silvermore continue to follow the road. They found several patrols in the area but thanks to Eric and Lord Silvermore's draconic senses they always had an early warning and was able to hide from the patrols. after another hour of walking they finally reach the village of Forest Springs.
11431121121211111111.title: They travel using the roads

choices: They manage to get away without being found
114311211212111111111.content:
In front of them stood the village of Forest Springs, there was no sign of any people or animals and looked completely abandoned.

"Stay alert, if anyone wanted to ambush us this would be the perfect place." said Lord Silvermore.

They advanced into the village until they reached the center square where the village hosted gatherings. Several gallows was built in front of them so this was were the village also executed the occasional criminal. Al around them were larger, better decorated manors and in front of them a very large building. Eric guessed that it was where the village elders met.

"Spread out and look for anything we can use. Food, Bedding or horses and bring them to the center. But be careful." said Lord Silvermore.

Eric realized that nobles had a tendency to hoard more than they needed and that they valued the expensive but less useful items, which they always took with them when they had to evacuate. So he walked to one of the larger manors, hoping to find supplies that the resident noble would have had to abandon when he evacuated. Eric's intuition was correct and he found lots of useful supplies in the manor, which he brought out and placed in the center near the gallows where Lord Silvermore and Annabella were placing the supplies they had found as well. In the manor that Eric had chosen he found more camping supplies than food so Eric guessed that the noble took up hunting as a hobby. After a few hours of searching they had more supplies than they could carry so they abandoned the search and began sorting through the supplies so that they could decide what they were going to take with them.

"Do you need me for anything else?" asked Eric.

"Not at the moment. Why?" replied Lord Silvermore.

"I would like to explore the village a bit more before we leave." said Eric.

"Go, but don't wander too far and stay alert." said Lord Silvermore.

Eric then returned to the manor that he had searched earlier but he explored the manor this time instead of looking for items to help them. Despite the fact that the resident noble took many expensive items with him, there were still many in the manor that he left behind. On the second floor Eric found a room that he hadn't explored yet. Display cases were on either side of him all along the walls and the heads of many animals and dangerous monsters were mounted on the walls. Several of the cases were empty but others had priceless weapons in them. Beside the cases were several beautiful suits of armor. Eric walked over to the mounted head of a Red scaled dragon.

"I doubt the noble had the spine to hunt any of these monsters." thought Eric.

Nobles never took up monster hunting but always desired the trophies after a successful hunt. Eric actually made more money selling his trophies than he did for the hunt itself. Eric never understood why nobles would brag about a trophy that they didn't earn themselves. Eric then saw a finely crafted spear resting on a rack near the mounted head. He picked it up and examined it up close. The blade and haft of the spear was made of metal and looked like silver. Despite the fact that the entire spear was metal it was extremely light. Beautiful images of trees and animals was carved on the blade and the haft of the spear. It reminded Eric of the spears that the royal guards of the elven king wielded.

"This should be on the battlefield, not resting in some noble's treasure hoard." thought Eric.

As Eric examined the carvings up close he saw through the reflection a black armored solder stalking towards him with his sword raised. Eric twisted around and the soldier swung his sword at him. Eric dodged the blow, then stabbed the man through the chest with the spear. The man went to his knees then fell to the side and Eric withdrew the spear. At that moment Eric heard more fighting outside and rushed out of the manor. When Eric came outside he saw his 'father' standing in front of the princess fighting three soldiers at the same time while Annabella threw spells at any soldier that tried to flank him. At that moment a horseman ran into the square, turned his steed and charged at Eric with his lance lowered. Eric threw the spear at the rider and struck him in the chest knocking him from his horse. Eric then drew his sword and rushed to Lord Silvermore's aid. Together Eric and Lord Silvermore defeated the soldiers easily. but the moment the last soldier fell, four horsemen ran into the square and charged at them. Eric and Lord Silvermore readied themselves but before the horsemen reached them a arrow struck one and knocked him from his horse. Everyone turned to look and Eric saw Hawkeyes standing at the one of the entrances to the square. Even as they looked at him he loosed another arrow that struck a horseman in the head.

The remaining horsemen turned to charge at Hawkeyes and Eric took advantage of their distraction. He charged at one of the horses and struck its side with his shoulder, knocking it over and causing its rider to fall on the ground. Eric then finished off the rider with a quick stab of his sword. The remaining rider tried to stab Eric with his lance but he dodged the blow, then broke the rider's lance with a slash from his sword before jumping up to the rider's level and slashing him in the chest with his sword. Eric landed on the other side of the horse and the rider fell to the ground beside him.

At that moment a single man in black robes walked into the square. Hawkeyes fired a arrow at him but with a flick of his wrist the arrow changed direction midair and struck a wall. The man then raised his other hand and a ball of energy left his palm and struck Hawkeyes in the chest, sending him flying back first into a wall. Eric and Silvermore charged at the sorcerer at the same time, hoping to reach him before he could cast another spell. But the sorcerer made another flicking motion with his left wrist which sent Lord Silvermore flying sideways. The sorcerer then raised his right hand and threw a energy ball at Eric. The moment the ball struck him Eric felt extreme pressure around him, as if a giant invisible hand closed around him. He couldn't move no matter how much he struggled.

"HEY, WHY DON"T YOU PICK ON SOMEONE YOUR OWN SIZE!" yelled Annabella.

"Do you think you can best me, whelp." answered the sorcerer.

The two mages then advanced towards each other. The sorcerer raised a hand and a fireball flew towards Annabella. Annabella raised a hand and a blast of icy air struck the fireball, extinguishing it. She then lifted her right hand over head and a spear made of ice appeared in her hand, which she then threw at the sorcerer. He waved with his hand and the earth in front of him rose and formed a solid wall, the spear struck and shattered against the wall before the wall exploded outward, sending rocks flying towards Annabella. She raised her left arm and a magic barrier appeared in front of her, the rocks hit the barrier but left Annabella unharmed, she then pointed a finger at the sorcerer and a red beam flew from it and struck him in the chest. The man looked at his body and saw that he was disintegrating, before he turned to dust the man pointed towards the sky with a finger and launched a red orb as bright as the sun into the sky.

The moment the sorcerer died, the pressure surrounding Eric disappeared and he was able to move again. He and the others then rushed towards Annabella.

"Are you all right?" asked Eric.

"I'm fine." replied Annabella.

"We need to leave now, more soldiers will be arriving soon." said Hawkeyes.

Eric, Annabella and Silvermore rushed to the supplies that they had gathered while Hawkeyes ran to fetch some of the soldiers horses. After a moment's consideration Eric also retrieved the spear that he found in the manor from one of the horsemen's bodies.

"It served me well, it would be a shame to leave it here for Irzac's men to find." thought Eric.

Once they secured their supplies to the horses they mounted them and ran as fast as they could out of the village. They were barely a few miles from the village when they heard someone sound a war horn in the village.
114311211212111111111.title: The village is a ambush

1143112112121111111111.content:
Eric and the others were on the road leading to Sanctuary running as fast as they can without killing their horses. The road led through a forest and on either side of them were tall trees. Eric could hear the drumming of hooves behind them and knew that more horsemen were close behind them. As Eric passed between two large trees, a javelin buried itself in the trunk on his right. Eric twisted around and saw several horsemen gaining on them. As they got closer they prepared to throw more javelins.

"THIS WAY!" called Lord Silvermore.

Lord Silvermore guided his horse off the road and into the forest, the others turned and followed him. Once they were in the forest Hawkeyes twisted around and began to fire arrows at the pursuing soldiers, holding on to his horse with just his legs. The trunk of a fallen tree was lying on the ground before them but their horses easily jumped over it. Eric's horse was the last to jump other and the moment he was on the other side Annabella twisted around and pointed at the fallen trunk and it caught fire and a large wall of fire appeared over it. The fire scared the soldier's horses, who reared and tossed their riders from their saddles.

"GOOD THINKING!" called Eric.

They managed to avoid further patrols but the area was swarming with them. When it started getting dark Hawkeyes spoke up.

"We shouldn't wander around after dark, we could walk right into a patrol without noticing. I know a place where we can lay low until the patrols pass the area." said Hawkeyes.

"Sounds good, lead on." said Lord Silvermore.

Hawkeyes led them to a secluded glade in the forest. The glade was so overgrown that is would be nearly impossible for anyone to find it unless they knew exactly where it was. There was only one well hidden entrance, the rest of the glade was completely surrounded by thick growth.

"Nice hiding spot, How did you know about this place?" said Eric.

"The rangers have several such safe havens scattered all across the kingdoms. How do you think we can strike at a target then disappear before our enemy can retaliate?" replied Hawkeyes.

That night they didn't start a fire as they were worried that the glow might reveal their location so they ate from the food supplies that they had received from the village. Since their meal consisted of only dried salted meat and some uncooked vegetables, it wasn't a very appealing meal but they ate it without complaint. After their meal Hawkeyes shared with them what he found out at the enemy camp.

"He has a army of about two thousand men at the camp but that isn't the main force." said Hawkeyes.

"How many more are coming?" asked Annabella.

"I don't know, but according to the reports in the command tent. After Firamore and the surrounding villages surrendered he had his men conscript every man in the area. He keeps their families hostage and threatens to execute them if they refuse to fight or flee without orders from their commanders. These men were just given a weapon, shield and armor and told to march here. These men have almost no training but they will fight to the last man unless their commanders orders otherwise." replied Hawkeyes.

"That's going to complicate things." said Lord Silvermore.

"It gets worse, his men have told Princess Annabella's family that they captured her and that they are going to execute her if they don't surrender Sanctuary. They expect an answer once their army arrives so we must reach Sanctuary before them as I suspect that they will surrender if we don't tell them otherwise. Fortunately we have horses now so unless we're unlucky we should reach Sanctuary by midday tomorrow" said Hawkeyes.

"Were you able to delay Irzac's army?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"I was, I sabotaged the wheels of their wagons so that they would break when they are heavily loaded and when they start moving. I also released their horses from their pens so it will take them a time to find them and even then I doubt they will find them all. It might buy Sanctuary a few more hours." answered Hawkeyes.

They tried to sleep but everyone was too nervous to sleep. Both the day's events and the reports from Hawkeyes had them troubled. After a while they got up again and began talking again in the hopes that it would calm them.

"Hawkeyes, I've been curious about something since we left the forest." said Eric.

"Then ask." replied Hawkeyes.

"I was wondering why the king would send a prince to escort us through the countryside. It seems too dangerous a mission for a prince." said Eric.

"Firstly I'm not a prince, The king is my foster father, he adopted me after my father was killed." replied Hawkeyes.

"I see, does the king have any children of his own?" asked Eric.

Hawkeyes shook his head.

"Then I still think its dangerous to send the heir to the elven throne on such a mission." said Eric.

"The elven kings don't have heirs. If the king leaves the throne, the leaders of all the elven clans in the forest comes together and choose a new king from their ranks. At most I might be chosen represent my clan and maybe I might be chosen as the new king but there is no guarantee and I don't want the position anyway." said Hawkeyes.

"How did your father die?" asked Eric.

"I don't want to talk about it." replied Hawkeyes.

"As you wish." said Eric.

"It's late. We should try to get some sleep. I'll keep watch." said Lord Silvermore.

They got up before the sun had fully risen and continued their journey. They managed to avoid more of Irzac's men and their horses helped them reach the city faster. It was almost noon when Hawkeyes pointed at a hill in front of them.

"Sanctuary should be just beyond that hill, princess." said Hawkeyes.

Annabella increased her pace so that she could reach the hill faster and see the condition of the city.
1143112112121111111111.title: Another patrol finds them

choices: They have one more ally to recruit
They have a spy to interogate
11431121121211111111111.content:
As they reached the top of the hill they saw Sanctuary. In front of them was a large mountain range and Sanctuary was built up right against the bottom of a cliff. A fifty foot wall surrounded the city and Eric saw several towers with siege engines along the outer wall. A inner wall surrounded the citadel and some building that looked like armories and barracks. Leading up to the outer wall was flat plains where many fields and farmhouses were built. The farms were abandoned
but Eric saw many soldiers patrolling the walls. Eric saw two huge doors leading into the mountain range behind the city.

"Sanctuary was once a dwarven mining outpost but they abandoned it when the minerals dried up. Humans then moved in and staked a claim. The dwarven king first treated them like squatters but gave them the deed to the outpost and sent five of his best engineers to help with the fortifications after humans rode to the dwarves aid. Those doors leads into the mountains and directly to the dwarven realms but the dwarven king had them sealed when relations between the two races began to fall apart." explained Hawkeyes, after he saw what Eric was looking at.

"They built this place to last." said Eric.

"The city has never fallen to a invader. Hopefully it will keep it's record. Here's where we part princess" said Hawkeyes.

"Excuse me?" said Annabella.

"My mission was to escort you safely to Sanctuary. That mission is now complete, so I should return to my king and wait for more orders. Once I enter the city, the defenders won't let me leave again until the siege is over." said Hawkeyes.

"We need all the help we can get if the city is to remain free." said Annabella.

"That wasn't my orders." said Hawkeyes.

"Your king ordered you to help us. Perhaps that included the siege as well. You know the odds as you saw Irzac's camp, we need everyone we can get. Your people already helped us. If the city falls to Irzac, do you think he will forgive that? Your king will understand." said Annabella.

Hawkeyes thinks it through for a few minutes before he answers the princess.

"Very well, I'll stay until the siege is over. But that is all I can promise. I'll tell my king that I was stranded in the city until the siege was over." said Hawkyes.

"Thank you." replied Annabella.

"Come, we shouldn't keep your family waiting any longer." said Hawkeyes.

They carefully make their way down the hill and rode up to one of the sealed gates.

"Halt! The city is closed because of the ongoing war. Only people with official business is allowed in." said one of the guardsmen.

Princess Annabella lowered her hood so that the guards can see her face.

"Princess Annabella! How did you ... ? Nevermind, this isn't the right time to ask. Your family will want to see you immediately." said the guardsman.

The guards opened the gates and Eric sees two guards waiting for them on the other side. One of the men's armor was better decorated and of better quality than the other guardsmen so Eric guessed that he must be a officer of some kind.

"Greetings princess, I'm Captain Roland of the city guard. We're glad to see that you managed to escape from Irzac. The people were deeply distressed when they heard you had been captured and your family has been worried sick about you." said the officer.

"Thank you captain but I wasn't captured. Irzac has been spreading the lie in the hopes that he can take the city unopposed." said Annabella.

"Well now that your back, he'll get a fight he won't forget. Come your family will want to see you. You can leave your horses with my men. One of them will take the horses to the stables." replied Captain Roland.

They dismounted and the captain led them through the city towards the palace. As they walked through the city Eric saw that the people were desolate and afraid but their mood brightened when they saw the princess. The princess was loved by her people and many hoped for a brighter future when she takes the throne so when they heard that she had been captured they lost hope.

The captain guided them through the palace and into the war room where a table with maps of the surrounding area was placed. Several men was standing around the table arguing. Two had crowns on their heads so Eric suspected they were Princess Annabella's father and uncle. Another was dressed as a knight and Eric recognized him as Sir Richard, one of the most bloodthirsty and fanatical of the dragon slayers while the other was a older man in blue robes with a long white beard and staff. As they entered the room the men looked up and one of the kings rushed toward Annabella and embraced her.

"Daughter, thank goodness your safe. How did you escape?" asked the king.

"I didn't. Irzac's men never found us." replied Annabella.

"Then where have you been? We've been expecting you days ago." asked her father.

"We were ... delayed." replied Annabella. She then told her father everything that happened to them from their encounter with the elves up until their arrival at Sanctuary. Once she finished her tale her father looked at the others.

"You have my thanks for keeping my daughter safe. My family's fortunes has dwindled recently but if there's anything you want. Ask, and I shall grant it if its within my power." said Annabella's father.

"We don't require anything, Your majesty." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Very well, let me introduce you to my brother. King Jarrod of Sanctuary." said the king.

King Jerrod nodded his head at them. "Thank you, for coming to my city's aid and for helping my family." said King Jerrod.

"This is Sir Richard, my chief military advisor. And the man in robes is Grand master Zorthar, the headmaster of the local mages school and my magical advisor." said Annabella's father.

"Can we expect the elves assistance in this battle?" asked King Jerrod.

"Sadly no, my people take time to muster and we're not skilled in direct battles like this siege. We're better as skirmishers and guerilla fighters." said Hawkeyes.

"That's unfortunate. We could have used the help. This news you bring me about the mass conscription is most troubling. I'll now be forced to take up arms against my own enslaved subjects. Apart from the numbers this gives Irzac. It will also demoralize our soldiers as they will be fighting friends or family. Fortunately your sabotage of their main camp has bought us some time." said Annabella's father.

"What's the condition of our forces?" asked Lord Silvermore

"Well enough, We withdrew all our soldiers into the city and we have received many new recruits. Grand Master Zorthar has also volunteered his better trained students as battle mages. Your wife has also arrived in the city has offered her magical knowledge and she's one of the most talented sorceresses I have ever seen. We also have enough supplies to last several months as we secured as much as we could before we evacuated the countryside." replied King Jerrod.

"Since we're talking about the war effort. I have a matter to bring before you, your majesty" said Captain Roland.
11431121121211111111111.title: Hawkeyes stays with them

114311211212111111111111.content:
"Then speak and I'll listen." said King Jerrod.

"Yesterday my men responded to a bar fight at one of the less 'reputable' establishments in the city. They solved the matter quite easily but my men encountered a mercenary that was 'less' cooperative." said Captain Roland.

"With all due respect 'captain', what does a bar brawl have to do with our war with Irzac?" asked Sir Robert.

"I'll get to that soon sir. Anyway, this mercenary didn't take part in the brawl but my men were under orders to arrest everyone until we could clear up what happened and who was responsible. They told him to come with them but he refused saying that he hadn't finished his drink yet. When they tried to force him, he fought back. He didn't use any weapons but he beat back ten men that day. Once he was done defending himself he finished his drink then dropped his weapons and said that he was ready to leave now." said Captain Roland.

"A single mercenary beat back ten guards? Clearly my guards need more training." said King Jerrod.

"In their defense, sire. The mercenary was a 'dragon-kin' so its understandable that they had difficulties." said Captain Roland.

"A dragon-man? Here?" said Eric.

"There's no need to be surprised, they go where there is money and a war is good money for them. A few of the guards joked and said that we should hire him and point him at Irzac's men. But I think that's a good idea." said Captain Roland.

"You can't be serious." said Eric.

"Why not?" asked Captain Roland.

"For all we know. Irzac hired him to spy on us." said Eric.

"If he's a spy. Then he's the most incompetent spy I've ever seen. He hasn't been trying to get into any military buildings and he made quite a scene that day. I think we can trust him." said Captain Roland.

"I have to agree with Eric. You cannot trust mercenaries even in the best of times. And definitely not one of those 'demons'." said Sir Robert.

"Actually, dragon-kin mercenaries are the most honorable ones you can find. Once they accept a contract, they never turn on their employer. Even if a better offer is made by their enemy they'll turn it down and finish the contract. Just don't lie to them about the nature of their enemy. If you do make him an offer, tell him about Irzac's dragon. He might refuse the contract but if you lie to him and he finds out. Then he will turn on you." said Lord Silvermore.

"Do you believe we can trust him?" asked King Jerrod.

"I do, your Majesty." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Then bring him to me." said king Jerrod.

"Yes, sire." said the captain who then rushed out of the room.

As a dragon slayer Eric had heard of the dragon-kin. A few hundred years ago there was a brutal war between humans and dragons. At first the two sides were evenly matched but once the humans discovered how to create dragonslayer weapons the war started to turn in their favor. The dragons struggled to match the human's numbers and combined with weapons that could pierce a dragon's scales made it difficult for dragonkind to keep up. Eventually a great wyrm named 'Shadow Stalker' began experimenting with captured humans, he tried to create a super soldier that could defend dragonkind from the dragonslayers. After several failed attempts he succeeded in creating a artifact that could combine his blood with the human form and the first dragon-kin was born.

These creatures had the features of a dragon. Like a scaly hide, sharp claws, wings, a dragon snout filled with sharp teeth and a heavy tail. But their form was humanoid so they could use weapons and wear armor. 'Shadow Stalker' found that the transformation had stripped them of all human memories except their knowledge of fighting and magic if they had the training. It also made them fanatically loyal to dragonkind. He then sent the dragon-kin against the slayers. The slayers found that their weapons were less effective against the dragon-kin as they were part human. And the dragon-kin knowledge of their enemies tactics and training made them dangerous opponents. Eventually a peace treaty was signed by the two races and the war ended. Two conditions was that human kind would destroy all dragonslayer weapons as well as the plans to make more. Despite this promise a few dragonslayer weapons were hidden and these weapons are still be used today, while the dragons would destroy the dragon-kin artifact and end the spell that kept the dragon-kin in their service. They freed the Dragon-kin but they were unable to restore their memories so the dragons cut ties with the dragon-kin.

Although dragons and humans adapted to the peace quite easily the dragon-kin struggled as they were bred only for war and knew nothing else. They either became reaving bandits to satisfy their bloodlust or they sold themselves out as mercenaries in order to satisfy their craving for battle. The elves took pity on them and taught them basic skills like agriculture and building and soon dragon-kin villages began to appear in isolated areas like jungles, swamps and mountain ranges. Although the Dragon-kin today are more peaceful than their ancestors they continued their traditions and many young dragon-kin left their villages and became mercenaries. Dragon-kin respected both the elves and the dragons but there was a great deal of tension between humans and dragon-kin. Humans treated the Dragon-kin like beasts while the Dragon-kin refused to forgive mankind for the atrocities they did during the war and for breaking the tenets of the peace treaty. Dragon-kin would normally attack dragonslayers and as a result the slayers hated the dragon-kin almost as much as they hated dragons.

After several minutes passed. the guards returned with the Dragon-kin. He was covered in sky blue scales and was quite a brute. He was far broader than the guards and over a foot taller. he had a dragon's head and serpentine neck and his jaws was full of daggerlike teeth. He had two long straight horns at the back of his head and a single frill that started at his neck and went all the way to about three quarters down his tail. He also had two draconic wings on his back. He walked on two dragonlike legs with three toes and had two humanlike hands with five fingers. His fingers and toes ended with sharp claws. A single thick metal plate was on the top of his head with a metallic spike at the front of the plate near the tip of his snout. The plate had two leather straps that tied around his lower jaw. The straps were flexible enough so he could still bite or speak if needed. He wore a breastplate over the front of his chest. His back was left bare though so nothing would obstruct his wings. He had a leather belt around his waist with large metal plate attached below the buckle that acted as a loincloth. it also had a chain mail skirt that ended just above his knees and went completely around his body. A gap was left as the back so that his tail can pass through unobstructed.

His hands was in shackles and he carried no weapons but Eric knew that even unarmed he was still a dangerous opponent. As he walked past, his 'father' got a shocked look on his face, but he concealed it so quickly that Eric didn't think anyone else saw it. His 'father' obviously recognized the dragon-kin and was startled when he saw him. When he was in front of Annabella's uncle he looked the king in the face.

"Kidnapping someone and having them dragged in chains before you isn't the best way to start a negotiation, human" said the dragon-kin.

"And attacking a possible employer's men isn't the best way to earn his trust." replied King Jerrod.

"I told them I just wanted to finish my drink. Are you going to kill me for that?" said the dragon-kin.

"No, I have a deal for you." answered King Jerrod.

"Then let's have a 'civil' discussion." said the dragon-kin. He held out his shackled hands.

"Captain!, please remove his shackles." said the king. The captain stepped forward and unlocked his shackles. Once it was free the dragon-kin rubbed at a spot where the metal chaffed his scales.

"Thank you. Now, I'll save you some time. I assume you want to hire me to fight against Irzac and his dragon." said the dragon-kin.

"Yes. Will that be a problem?" asked the king.

"Not if the price is right." said the dragon-kin.

"I can offer you 150 gold." said the king.

"You can hire a common thug for that money. Do I look like a common thug to you?" replied the dragon-kin.

"200 gold." said the king.

"Call me when your ready to make a REAL offer." said the dragon-kin. He then turned around and began leaving the room.

"300 gold!" called the king. The dragon-kin stopped and turned back to the king.

"NOW we're getting somewhere." replied the dragon-kin.

"Do you agree?" said the king.

"No, you still need to sweeten the deal a bit more." replied the dragon-kin.

"I don't have time for games, mercenary. JUST TELL ME WHAT YOU WANT!" yelled the king.

"You will pay me 300 gold. half now, half once the job is complete. you will also pay me 20 gold for every enemy officer I kill." said the dragon-kin.

"Fine, but you better be worth every coin. You can stay in the guard barracks while you work for me." said the king.

"That won't be necessary. I have a room at the 'Harper's Rest'. It's a tavern near the gates." replied the dragon-kin.

"Fine, but I'll expect you at the front gates once the alarm is sounded." said the king.

"Of course. I'm a professional." replied the dragon-kin.

"What's your name? dragon-kin." asked the king.

"Tempest" replied the dragon-kin.

"Very well, Tempest. the captain will return your weapons to you when you leave. You can go." said the king.

Tempest bowed his head to the king, then turned and left the room.
114311211212111111111111.title: They have one more ally to recruit

choices: The next morning the attack begins
1143112112121111111111111.content:
After the audience with the dragon-kin, Annabella's father invited them to a meal. Before the meeting they looked for Esmerda. At first Lord Silvermore was angry that she revealed herself and that she volunteered to join the battle. But she assured him that their young was save. She had hidden Eric's 'siblings' high in the mountains above the city and told Laxton and Vanity to watch over their siblings. If the city fell then they would lead the children away.

While they waited for the food Annabella's father told them about what happened at his kingdom and his journey to Sanctuary. Once they finished the meal Hawkeyes left to inspect the condition of the city's archers while a guard took Lord Silvermore, Eric and Esmerda to their accommodations. It was a large house close to the city walls. Most of the townspeople found shelter closer to the inner walls. The king of Sanctuary used the empty buildings to house his soldiers so that they can reach the walls faster if the alarm is sounded.

Irzac's army arrived just as the sun was beginning to set. He said that if the royal family surrendered then he will be merciful to the townspeople but the kings refused. Irzac then ordered his men to set camp and begin building siege engines. His army was far larger than Eric had expected.

Eric tried to sleep but he wasn't able to relax with Irzac and his men so close. Eric heard a noise in the hallway so he got up and peeked out through a small gap in the door. He saw Lord Silvermore put on a hooded cloak and sneak out the house. Eric became suspicious and decided to follow him. Lord Silvermore walked through the streets avoiding anyone until he reached a tavern near the city walls.

"I didn't know he drinks." thought Eric.

Eric looked at the sign above the door. It had a picture of a harp on it with the words 'Harper's Rest' written below the picture. Eric hesitated at the door.

"If I go in 'father' will see me." thought Eric.

Eric looked around and saw a drunken guardsman staggering back to the barracks. Eric closed his eyes and altered the illusion that hid his dragon form so that he'll look like the guardsman. He then inspected himself in his reflection to make sure the spell worked correctly. As Eric entered the tavern he saw that there were very few people still in the tavern. It was very late so most everyone had gone home. The barman was preparing to close the tavern when he saw Eric.

"George? I though you said you were going to go back to the barracks?" said the barman.

"I just want to clear my head for a while. I'll just sit here until you close." said Eric.

"As you wish. Would you like another drink?" asked the barman.

"No thanks." said Eric.

Eric saw that his 'father' sitting at a table in a dark corner of the tavern and across from him sat Tempest. Eric made his way to there and sat at a table close to theirs so that he can listen to their conversation. After a few words he noticed that they were speaking in Draconic. Even though he was uninterested his 'mother' had taught him draconic so he didn't have any problem understanding them.

"I don't know how you can live among humans. They often don't keep their word, Their knights constantly try to kill dragons and their drinks are terrible." said Tempest.

"A kingdom isn't made great by its choice of liquor." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Perhaps not, But it does make it more bearable. You didn't come here to talk about drinks. Why did you seek me out, old friend?" said Tempest.

"I want to know why you're here. The REAL reason. A enforcer doesn't just show up without a good reason." said Lord Silvermore.

"I'm hurt. Don't you trust me?" replied Tempest.

"Not really." said Lord Silvermore.

"Good. So you do listen to my advise occasionally. You're right, I'm not here looking for mercenary work." said Tempest.

"You're here for Irzac?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Yes." replied Tempest.

"Does this mean the council has declared him a renegade?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No. The council doesn't know I'm here. And I would like to keep it that way." replied Tempest.

"Won't you get in trouble for that?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No, Enforcers are allowed to act independently if you find a renegade." replied Tempest.

"Why the deception though? Why didn't you tell the king what you really are?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Because then Irzac's spies might find out. He'll call off the attack and strike elsewhere and I might not know when or where. I need to catch him in the act if I'm going to bring him to trial." replied Tempest.

"I hope you have a plan to help us win because it isn't looking good at the moment." said Lord Silvermore.

"I don't have a plan. But I do have something that can help, Follow me." replied Tempest.

They then stood up and walked out of the tavern. After a few seconds Eric also got up and walked to the door. Eric peeked out the door and saw Tempest and Lord Silvermore walking around the tavern and into a alley. Eric started to follow them but when he went around the corner something grabbed him by the neck and slammed him backfirst into the wall. Once his vision cleared he saw that it was Tempest that was holding him.

"Who are you? Why are you following us?" asked Tempest.

"I'm George of the city...." Eric replied but Tempest dug his claws into Eric's neck as he tightened his grip.

"I can sense the illusion hiding you and I've never seen George turn down a drink. I'll ask you one last time. WHO ARE YOU!" replied Tempest.

Eric realized that he had to reveal himself so he ended the illusion that hid his human form.

"Eric?" asked Lord Silvermore.

Tempest released his grip on Eric's neck.

"You shouldn't eavesdrop on a enforcer, kid. It will get you killed." said Tempest.

"What is a enforcer?" asked Eric.

"I'm sure you have questions. But we can't talk here. Follow me." replied Tempest.

Tempest led them around to the back of the tavern. There was a row of doors at the back. Tempest walked the the third door and unlocked it. Once they entered Tempest lighted some candles. The room was small with only a bed, a small writing desk and a small table with two chairs.

"Do you know the origins of the dragon-kin?" asked Tempest.

"Yes." answered Eric.

"Good, After the peace treaty between dragons and humans was signed there was still a lot of tension between the races. Dragonslayers continued to hunt dragons and dragons retaliated by burning villages and cities. The High Dragon Lord at that time grew concerned as he believed that if things escalated then there would be another war. He believed a force was needed that would keep the peace by any means necessary. The problem he had was that humans would never allow dragons to watch them nor would dragons allow humans to do the same. He looked at the dragon-kin as we were still struggling to find a purpose and we were a neutral race. He found the wisest and most skilled of the dragon-kin and from them he created the enforcers. The two races wasn't happy about it but they gave their consent. The enforcers have watched since then, Hunting overzealous dragonslayers and renegade dragons. The enforcers answers to no one except the High Dragon Lord." explained Tempest.

"What is the High Dragon Lord? I've never heard of that before." asked Eric.

"The short version is that he's the king of the dragons. He doesn't really rule over dragons though. He helps to settle disputes between rival dragon clans and in the rare case where something affects the entire dragon race then he represents the dragons or if there is war, lead them into battle." answered Tempest.

"You said you had something that can help us in the battle." said Lord Silvermore.
