"Yes, I did." replied Tempest. He walked to his bed and pulled a wooden crate from under the bed. The crate had a strange symbol on it.

"That's the sign of the dwarven miner's guild. Where did you get that?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"A former employer. After I finished a job for him he couldn't honor our agreement so I took that as compensation." answered Tempest.

"I hope you didn't steal it." said Lord Silvermore.

"Of course not. He was more than happy to give it to me. Once I stopped holding him by the throat over the edge of a three story building." replied Tempest.

Tempest opened the crate and Eric saw three egg shaped metal objects inside.

"What is it?" asked Eric.

"A Dwarven invention. They use it to open chambers and clear cave-ins. I'm not sure how it works but I know that it explodes once it comes in contact with fire. You light the fuse, throw them, then get to cover. We should be able to destroy Irzac's siege towers with these." answered Tempest.

"That will be useful." replied Eric.

"You two should get some rest. I suspect Irzac will attack at dawn and you should be well rested. It will be a long battle." said Tempest.

Eric and Silvermore then returned to their rooms.
1143112112121111111111111.title: Lord Silvermore sneaks out later

11431121121211111111111111.content:
Eric wakes to the sound of a war horn being blown. He rushes to the main door where his 'parents' are waiting. they leave together and make their way to the main gate. Once they reach the main gate they find that Tempest and Hawkeyes are already there, trying to organize the defenders.

In Tempest's right hand he carried a large hammer. Humans would have had to use both hands to wield the weapon but Tempest only needed one hand. In his left hand he carried a tower shield. He also had a cone shaped tail weapon strapped to the tip of his tail, it had two axe blades on its sides. This allowed him to use his tail as an axe.

"Hawkeyes! Tell the men to get those towers firing!" called Tempest.

"They're already working on it, lizard!" yelled Hawkeyes.

"Tell them to work faster." said Tempest.

Shortly after Eric arrived the rest of the officers joined them at the gates. Roland arrived with the city guard while Robert came with the other knights. Grand master Zorthar arrived with Princess Annabella and the rest of the mages.

"Princess? What are you doing here? You should be with the rest of the royal family at the castle." said Tempest.

"I can defend myself." answered Annabella.

"I'm sure you can. But Irzac is after you. So you are in bigger danger than us. You shouldn't be on the front lines." said Tempest.

"I'm not going to cower in a castle while men fight and die to protect me. I will fight with you whether you like it or not." said Annabella.

"Fine, then take your positions." replied Tempest.

Esmerda and Princess Annabella went to the back ranks with the other mages while Eric, Lord Silvermore, Robert and Roland joined Tempest on the walls.

"What's the situation?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Irzac's spies have been busy. They sabotaged the war machines in the towers. Hawkeyes is trying to fix them now. Irzac has a big army but he didn't have a lot of time to build siege towers or ladders so if we can keep most of his men off the walls we might win." answered Tempest.

Tempest took one of the dwarven devices and waited, once the closest siege tower reached the walls and opened the platform at the top, Tempest ignited the fuse and threw the device into the tower. A few seconds later it exploded, sending debris flying in every direction. Their victory was short lived as a second siege tower docked to the walls on the opposite side of the gatehouse and began to release soldiers onto the walls.

"Get them! Don't let them take that section of the wall!" called Lord Silvermore.

As Eric rushed at the section with the rest of the defenders, a shadow passed over him and Eric looked up to see a large boulder flying towards him. Eric didn't have time to dodge the boulder so he braced for the impact but before it can strike him the boulder shattered in midair as if it had struck a wall. The pieces didn't hit any of defenders and fell either on the ground or struck the enemy soldiers. Eric realized that it was the mages that just saved them from the missiles. Eric nodded his head in thanks at Annabella and she nodded in turn.

At first the battle was going well for the defenders. Despite the size of Irzac's army he had difficulty getting his men on the walls. Defenders waited at the top of any ladders that the attackers placed on the walls and didn't allow his soldiers to get a foothold on the walls. The missiles from his siege weapons kept being deflected by the mages and Irzac's battering ram couldn't get through the gates as the mages were using their magic to reinforce the gates.

Later in the day Eric heard a explosion in the distance and heard the sound of chains being pulled back.

"They're opening one of the side gates! We need to stop them before we're overrun. Eric come with me!" called Tempest.

Eric and Tempest left the battle and ran to the side gates. Behind the gates was a large square with a incomplete cathedral in the center. The building was still in the early stages of construction but the front of it was in better condition. The towers and wall of the cathedral's front was high but unstable. Several heavy wooden beams was placed against the wall to keep them from falling over if there is heavy wind.

Eric saw several men wearing the armor of the city guard standing by the gates. The men turned and looked at Eric and Tempest.

"KILL THEM!!" called the leader.

The men then drew their swords and charged at them. Eric and Tempest quickly killed the men. Once the last man fell Eric charged at their leader hoping to kill him quickly. As he charged at him an invisible force took hold of Eric and immobilized him.

"Not again." thought Eric.

Before the sorcerer could finish him off a hammer flew through the air and struck the sorcerer in the chest. As the man struggled to regain his balance a shadow passed over him and Tempest landed in front of him. He slashed the man through the face with his claws then twisted and struck the man in the chest with his tail weapon. Once the man died the force holding Eric vanished.

"Eric! Stop standing around and get that gate closed!" called Tempest.

Eric rushed to the gates and inspected it. The wooden doors had been blown of their hinges so there was no way to close them. The chains that was used to raise and lower the metal gate was also broken.

"They sabotaged the gates!! I can't seal it!" called Eric.

At that moment Captain Roland arrived with a few dozen spear men.

"Captain! have your men take up defensive positions at the gates. They'll have to hold them while we seal the gates." said Tempest.

As the men hurried to the gates Tempest took a quick look through the square and his eyes fell on the cathedral. He called the captain who then rushed to his side.

"Why are there wooden beams in front of the cathedral?" asked Tempest.

"There was a accident a few months ago. A strong wind blew it over. We placed them there so that it won't happen again." answered Roland.

"So the walls are unstable?" asked Tempest.

"Very." replied Roland.

"Good, Hold this." said Tempest. He shoved his shield into Roland's arms, who then staggered under it's weight. Tempest then took a two handed grip on his hammer and advanced on the closest beam.

Eric took a position near the front of the formation. He sheathed his sword and pulled out the spear he used at Forest Springs. He also salvaged a shield from one of the dead soldiers. A moment later several black armored knights rode through the gate. One knight tried to stab Eric with a lance but Eric dodged the blow, then stabbed the knight through the side. Before Eric could recover another knight drove his lance into Eric's shield. The shield blocked the lance but the force of the impact drove Eric back. The knight let go of his lance and began to draw a mace but Eric killed him before he could draw his weapon. Eric dropped the now useless shield which still had the lance buried in it. He knew that he wouldn't last long against knights on open ground without a shield so he withdrew behind the other defenders while he tried to find another shield.

Tempest had broken two of the beams and was working on the third one. He also used magic to summon a strong wind from the mountains behind the city. The remaining beams groaned and cracked from the pressure but still held their position. As Tempest struck the beam it split in two and the remaining beams shattered from the pressure and the building then began to lean outward.

"RUN!!!" called Tempest.

The defenders scattered to either side of the square. Irzac's men advanced but when they saw the cathedral they quickly ran back under the gates. The cathedral fell on the gates and a large dust cloud covered the square. Eric coughed then looked at the gate. A large pile of rubble was in front of the entrance. The pile almost touched the top of the city walls. It would take a team of men several days to clear the rubble. Eric was confident that Irzac's men won't be using this entrance anytime soon. At that moment a voice called out in Eric's head.

"Eric!" called Esmerda.

"Mother?" replied Eric.

"Yes, Get back here now. Irzac's mages are blasting the gates. We can't ... hold them any longer." said Esmerda wearily.

"The main gates are about to fall!" called Eric.

Eric and the others ran back to the main gates. Once they arrived at the gates they looked at the situation. The last remaining tower continued to release soldiers onto the walls. They didn't try to advance, instead they fortified the section and waited for reinforcements. Because of the confined space on the walls the defenders couldn't charge at them at the same time and were struggling to defeat the soldiers. The mages were exhausted and could barely stay on their feet. Tempest and Eric ran to the Esmerda.

"End the spell holding the gates, there's no use exhausting yourselves further on a spell that is going to fail anyway." said Tempest.

As the mages ended the spell Tempest looked at the siege tower.

"We can't fight a battle to two fronts. Do you think you can destroy the tower?" asked Tempest.

Esmerda pointed her staff at the tower and fireball flew from the tip and into the siege tower. Once it made contact with the walls it exploded sending men and debris flying. The enemy soldiers close to the tower was knocked off their feet and the defenders took advantage and pressed their attack. Once the remaining enemy soldiers were defeated, Lord Silvermore sent the defenders to the courtyard before the gates, They just finished taking defensive positions when another blast struck the gate. The blast broke the wooden doors and Irzac's soldiers began to march into the city. Shouting war cries, the two armies charged at each other.
11431121121211111111111111.title: The next morning the attack begins

114311211212111111111111111.content:
Eric dodged the blow from a enemy soldier before finishing him. He then took stock of the situation. The defenders were able to hold the gates at first but the numbers in Irzac's army began to push them back. Eventually they were driven out of the courtyard and into the city streets, where the defenders became scattered and disorganized. At the moment only Lord Silvermore, Tempest and a few city guard was with Eric. The rest of the officers and defenders was scattered all over the city. Eric worried about Princess Annabella's safety as she was in the most danger.

In the fighting they all received wounds. Lord Silvermore had a cut above his right eye but the blow luckily missed his eye, He also had a stab wound in the side where a soldier stabbed him with a dagger. Eric was wounded in the shoulder where a soldier cut him with a axe, The soldier tried to strike him in the head but Eric saw the blow coming and deflected it with his sword and it struck his shoulder instead. Tempest had several stab wounds in his wings where soldiers with spears stabbed him and a crossbow bolt in his shoulder, He also had a cut on his back where a soldier slashed him with a sword.

As they ran through the streets they came across another group of defenders led by Captain Roland, busy fighting against a large group of Irzac's men. Eric and the others rushed to their aid and drove of the enemy soldiers.

"Thanks for the help, It's good to see a friendly face." said Roland.

"Have you seen any other defenders?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No, You are the first." replied Roland.

"Not even Princess Annabella?" asked Eric.

"I hoped she was with you." said Roland.

"We can't defend the city like this. Tempest! Can you fly around the city and look for the other defenders? Tell them to meet us at the inner walls." asked Lord Silvermore.

"I'll try. But I'm not sure if I'll be able to with these tattered wings." replied Tempest

Tempest jumped into the air and flapped his wings to rise to a balcony of a two story house next to them. Once he grabbed the railings he leapt back and flapped twice to rise above the roofs of the houses in the street.

The rest of them continued running through the streets toward the inner wall, assisting any defenders that they find along the way. A short while later they reached one of the gates leading into the inner city. Annabella's uncle and father was standing on the wall.

"What's the situation?" asked Annabella's father.

"Irzac's men have breached the walls. Our forces are scattered around the city, I've asked Tempest to tell them to regroup here." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Where's Annabella?" asked Annabella's father.

"Somewhere in the city, don't worry she was with the other mages the last time I saw her, they will protect her." replied Lord Silvermore.

The king nodded but he still seemed concerned. Eric stood close to the doors with his 'father', ready to close them if the sentries spots any of Irzac's men. Unlike the doors in the outer walls, these weren't reinforced so they wouldn't last long if they are attacked. A short while later the groups of defender began to rush into the courtyard. Robert arrived with a few wounded knights, the remaining city guard arrived with Hawkeyes. The last to arrive was princess Annabella and the remaining mages. Annabella was covered in blood and appeared dazed but Eric didn't see any wounds on her.

"Are you hurt?" asked Eric.

"What? No, this isn't my blood." replied Annabella.

At that moment a shadow passed over them and Tempest landed heavily on the ground beside them.

"Are you alright?" asked Eric.

"The flying has aggravated the wounds on my wings. I won't be able to fly again until my wounds have healed." replied Tempest.

"Are these men the only ones left?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"They're the only ones who can reach us. There are others, but they are trapped behind enemy lines and won't be able to get here safely. I told them to find someplace defensible and wait for the tide of battle to turn." answered Tempest.

Eric and Lord Silvermore then closed the gates and waited for Irzac's men to arrive while Princess Annabella and the remaining mages started healing the wounded. A short while later Eric heard marching in the streets and one of the sentries warned them that Irzac's army is approaching. A strong blast suddenly hits the doors, breaking them, and sending splinters flying. Out of the smoke emerges a single black armored knight. His army marches close behind but they keep their distance from the defenders. The knight walks to the center of the open ground between the armies and holds his arms out to either side as if challenging the defenders.

"Princess, that's quite the welcome you gave me back there. Is that anyway to treat your former lover?" said Irzac.

"Begone fiend, you will get nothing more from me!" replied Annabella.

"Is that so? I don't think you realize that I've already won. You're defenses have fallen to me." said Irzac.

"The defenses have fallen to 'YOU'. Ha, that's funny since you've been staring at the back-end of your army this entire time." said Tempest.

"Watch your tongue, abomination!" said Irzac.

"Or what? You'll sic your army on me? We all know your too much of a coward to fight your own battles." replied Tempest.

"None of you would be able to best me!" said Irzac.

"Is that so? Then prove it. Prove that you're a man that can fight his own battles, not a hatchling that hides behind his mother." replied Tempest.

"ENOUGH!!! I will make you suffer for your words after this! If you are so eager to die by my sword then I shall grant your request. Which one of you would like the honor of being slain by my sword?" said Irzac.
114311211212111111111111111.title: The battle goes poorly

1143112112121111111111111111.content:
Tempest walks forward into the center of the open ground and stands opposite of Irzac.

"I accept your challenge, fiend!" said Tempest.

"I'm going to enjoy this." said Irzac.

"Don't be so sure of that." replied Tempest.

They then began circling each other, waiting for an opening in their opponent's defenses. As they circled each other Tempest stepped on a large piece of wood from the destroyed gate. It causes him to lose his balance for a split second, Irzac notices this and charges at him. As Irzac stabs at him Tempest knocks his sword out of his hand with his shield, then jabs his hammer into Irzac's belly, knocking the wind out of him and causing him to lean forward. Tempest then spins the hammer in his hands and hits Irzac under his chin, causing his to fly backwards and land on his back on the ground. Tempest advances towards Irzac and raises his hammer to strike at him, Irzac sees the blow coming and rolls away from it. The hammer hits the paving stone of the square and cracks the stone, before Tempest can strike again Irzac grabs his sword and stabs at Tempest's leg, hitting him just under his knee, Tempest hisses in pain and jumps back, pulling the sword out of his leg and Irzac uses the time to get back on his feet.

Eric disliked having to watch another person duel. He wanted to help Tempest but his sense of honor wouldn't allow him to interrupt a duel and he didn't think that Tempest would have welcomed the help. Irzac's sorcerers didn't have honor though and tried to assist their master with spells or curses, but every time they tried Annabella and the other mages deflected or dispelled the magic. Eventually Irzac lost his patience and as Tempest rushes at him again, Irzac knocks him back with a blast of magic.

"Ohh, Irzac wants to play rough. Ok then." said Tempest.

A hurricane force wind suddenly starts blowing from the mountains. The wind flies towards Tempest and starts circling around him, lifting him a few feet of the ground. Tempest then send the blast at Irzac, sending him flying backwards. Eric also feels a strange tingling sensation and the hair on the people around him starts standing on end. Lightning starts moving up Tempest's right arm towards his hammer. Once his hammer bursts into sparks, he leaps into the air and strikes at Irzac's shield, breaking it in two. Before Irzac can recover, Tempest kicks him in the chest, knocking off his feet and causing him to fall on his back.

"NO!! I WILL NOT BE BEATEN BY A HALF BREED!!!" yelled Irzac.

A blast of force strikes Tempest, knocking him back and forcing Eric to shield his eyes with his arm. When Eric lowers his arm, he sees that in Irzac's place stands a massive black and crimson dragon. This dragon was far larger than Eric in his dragon form, about as large as Silvermore. It lunged forward, hoping to catch it's opponent off guard but Tempest sees him coming and knocks his head back with a shield bash, then raises his hammer to strike it's head. Irzac pulls his head back and the hammer strikes the ground. Irzac raises his head and a rumbling sound came for his chest. Realizing the danger, Tempest raises his shield and a second later a large stream of fire flies from Irzac's mouth and hits Tempest. Irzac keeps the blast on him for a full minute before he closes his mouth and looks down at his opponent. Kneeling in the center of a blackened circle was Tempest. His shield was glowing red from the heat and his armor and scales was black with soot but he appeared unharmed, Tempest raised himself to his feet again and Irzac growled with annoyance when he saw his opponent was still alive.

Despite their differences in size and strength both combatants had trouble beating the other. Tempest's hammer was able to bypass Irzac's scales but Tempest had trouble reaching the vital areas like Irzac's head. Tempest's shield was able to take the hits from Irzac. There was deep scratches in the shield because of Irzac's claws but the shield held and where the force from the blow would break a human's arm, Tempest's arm was able to take the hit. But Eric could see that Tempest was getting weaker with each blow and Eric didn't know how long he would be able to continue before he made a fatal mistake. Irzac spat a fireball at Tempest, which he deflected with his shield but the attack was just a distraction. The moment the fireball struck the shield, Irzac lunged forward and closed his jaws on Tempest's shield. Tempest tried to keep his grip on the shield and struck at Irzac's neck but Irzac jumped back and pulled the shield out of Tempest's grip. Irzac then shook his head and tossed the shield across the courtyard, then crouched to pounce on Tempest. Tempest didn't wait for Irzac though, the moment Irzac's feet left the ground, Tempest rushed forward and rolled underneath Irzac. When Irzac landed, Tempest was close to his back legs, Tempest then jumped to the side and struck at Irzac's knee. Irzac shrieked in pain and fell on his side and the moment Tempest touched the ground again, he took a two handed grip on his hammer and jumped forward to deliver a deathblow to Irzac's head. Irzac flaps his wings as he struggles to get back on his feet and one of the wings hits Tempest in the chest, sending him flying backwards, the moment Tempest's feet touched the ground, he dug his claws into the ground to slow his backwards flight. Irzac got to his feet and flew into the air, he hovered above the courtyard giving everyone a venomous look.

"You will suffer for the pain you have caused me and for denying me what is rightfully mine! YOU WILL ALL SUFFER!!!" yelled Irzac.

He then turned in the air and flew away from the city.

"GET HIM!!" called one of Irzac's commanders. Irzac's entire army then rushed forward. Eric and the remaining defenders also charged, hoping to reach Tempest before he's overwhelmed. Tempest didn't seem concerned about the army rushing at him, he walked to his shield, picked it up, then turned to face the enemy army.

Eric lost count how many soldiers died by his sword that day. Without Irzac the defenders fought on with renewed hope while Irzac's army was demoralized and disorganized. Since Annabella and the other mages didn't have to worry about fortifying gates or deflecting missiles, They focused their power into offensive spells which caused chaos in Irzac's ranks. Overhead Hawkeyes and the other archers continued to rain arrows on the enemy. Later in the battle Eric heard a call of retreat. At first Eric was concerned as he believed that the defenders was overwhelmed, but then he saw that it was Irzac's men that was retreating. Beside him the other defenders raised their weapons above their heads and cheered when they saw their enemy retreat.

"I can't believe it. We've won." thought Eric.

Eric then raised his own sword and joined the defenders in their victory cheer.
1143112112121111111111111111.title: Tempest accepts the challenge

choices: A enforcer arrived at the city
11431121121211111111111111111.content:
Eric wakes up just as the sun started to shine through the window. He rises from bed and walks to the balcony connected to his room in the castle and looks out over the city. The city's reconstruction was progressing well, the rubble from the destroyed cathedral had been removed and the cathedral was being rebuilt. King Jerrod had the prisoners from the battle divided, the ones that were forced to work for Irzac was put to work repairing the damage to the city while the ones who joined him willingly was either imprisoned or executed. They had to keep the working prisoners under constant guard as Irzac still held their families hostage and they tried to escape every chance they got.

After the battle the king payed Tempest his fee and offered him a extended contract but Tempest turned it down, saying that he already had something else planned but that he might return in a few weeks. The others thought that he had another contract but Eric and Lord Silvermore knew that he actually returned to the Dragon Council to deliver a report about Irzac's actions. The elven king also sent a druid to sign a alliance between their two races. Hawkeyes was appointed the elven representative and the king sent a few rangers to assist the human soldiers. The elves' knowledge of the wild allowed them to outmaneuver the enemy soldiers. The main elven army fought independently and continued to harass Irzac's forces. Irzac's army retreated into the countryside where they raided the weaker areas to sustain themselves. They stayed in the area for the first week, then retreated back to Irzac's fortress and Firamore. The royal family was concerned that they were rallying for another attack but the attack never came. The royal family sent out spies to find where Irzac went after the battle but they were unable to find him.

Since things were calming down the people returned to their homes, villages and farms. Eric and Lord Silvermore was given separate rooms in the castle. Esmerda left the city and flew to the mountains behind the city where she could watch over the city but still keep her children safe. They were careful since the dragon slayers always had a big presence in Sanctuary. Lord Silvermore officially began Eric's training. During the day Lord Silvermore would train Eric in physical combat and during the evening Eric would fly to his 'mother' and she would teach him magic and dragon-lore. Lord Silvermore also taught Eric how to fight better in dragon form. On those days Lord Silvermore would teach him the entire day since they had to travel far to avoid detection.

Princess Annabella also trained with Eric. They learned how to combine their strengths and Esmerda would teach Princess Annabella more magic. When Eric trained his dragon form, Princess Annabella would ride with him as Lord Silvermore said that she had to grow accustomed to fighting from his back and Eric had to get used to a rider so that he didn't throw her off his back with a complicated maneuver. A week ago, their spies reported that a large force of Irzac's soldiers left the fortress but the spies were unable to find out where they went. Not even the elves were able to find their trail. King Jerrod had watchtowers built around his borders and made a complicated signaling system so that the watchtowers could report if they saw the enemy. King Jerrod only put his most loyal men at the watchtowers and made sure that only they knew the signals as they were concerned that Irzac's spies could send false signals.

Normally Eric would already have started his training for the day but Lord Silvermore decided to give him the day off. Captain Roland offered to show Eric and Princess Annabella the wonders of the city as neither of them had been to Sanctuary before and they didn't have the time to do so before. Someone suddenly knocks on the door of Eric's room.

"Enter!" called Eric.

Captain Roland opened the door and stepped into the room.

"Captain Roland? I'm not late for our outing am I?" asked Eric.

"No, but I'm afraid we'll have to cancel our plans. King Jerrod has called an emergency council." replied Roland.

As they walked to the throne room Eric wondered what it could be about. Did they find Irzac's troops? Or was there something worse? As they walked into the throne room Eric saw that the entire royal family, their chief advisors, Hawkeyes and Lord Silvermore was already there waiting for them.

"Eric! I hope you slept well." said King Jerrod.

"I did. thank you your majesty." replied Eric.

"I'm glad. I'm sorry that I'm disrupting your plans for the day but I've received some troubling news." said King Jerrod.
11431121121211111111111111111.title: A month passes

114311211212111111111111111111.content:
"My guards tell me that a enforcer has arrived at the city and that he requests a audience with me." said King Jerrod.

"A enforcer? Did he say why he wanted to see you?" asked Robert.

"No, but it has to be about Irzac. I only hope he isn't here to punish us for the battle." replied King Jerrod.

"Punish us? but we only defended ourselves." said Robert.

"Who know what lies Irzac has told them. I only hope this enforcer is willing to listen to reason." said King Jerrod.

"If he isn't, then we will 'take care' of him." said Robert.

"Don't be foolish, Every king signs a agreement that if someone refuses punishment then the enforcers can conscript their aid to destroy the criminal and the city if need be. If we harm him then all the kings and dragons will turn against us. If there is a punishment then we must hope it isn't too high." said King Jerrod.

They then waited for the enforcer to arrive. When he did arrive everyone except Eric and Lord Silvermore was shocked when they saw that the enforcer was actually Tempest. He wore the same armor and weapons from before but Eric saw that his shield and breastplate was modified with a crest. The crest had a human knight kneeling on the ground, his sword was planted edge first into the ground and his head was bowed. Opposite him was a dragon with his head almost on the ground, his front half was lowered in a draconic version of a bow. In the background behind the two figures was a single draconic eye watching over them. Eric suspected that this was the crest of the enforcers. Tempest walked to the throne and lowered his head, but didn't bow as people did in front of a king.

"Tempest! Well met again. It sounds like you've been promoted since we last spoke, Congratulations." said King Jerrod.

"Actually I deceived you before. I've always been a enforcer." said Tempest.

"I see. Would you mind telling me why the deception was necessary?" asked King Jerrod.

"Because I needed to catch Irzac breaking the rules. If I told you what I was, then Irzac might have learned of it from his spies." replied Tempest.

"Why reveal yourself now though?" asked King Jerrod.

"Because I bring a official message from the dragon council." replied Tempest.

"What of Irzac? Will he be punished for his actions?" asked Eric.

"Sadly no, He has found a loophole. If he was acting independently then he would have been punished for breaking the peace treaty. But he is also a warlord and as a warlord he has the right to declare war on a rival." said Tempest.

"So the council will do nothing." said Eric.

"I didn't say that. The High dragon lord understands his reasoning but he also said that it will cause difficulty for all dragons. So if he is going to use that excuse then he must remain a warlord. He is forbidden from taking dragon form unless attacked by another dragon. So at least he can't incinerate your entire army the next time you confront him." said Tempest.

"What of my kingdom? Will it be returned to me?" asked Annabella's father.

"That is a dispute between you and Irzac. The council will not get involved." replied Tempest.

"It's a improvement. But not as good as we hoped." said King Jerrod.

"There's more. The dragon clans living in the area are concerned that the dragon slayers will punish them for Irzac's actions, so I've been assigned to the area to give them peace of mind and to insure that doesn't happen." said Tempest.

"Very well then. Is there anything else?" asked King Jerrod.

"Just one. You've been wondering where Irzac's army has disappeared to?" replied Tempest.

"Yes, do you know where they are?" asked King Jerrod.

"I do. They have besieged Arcania." said Tempest.

Eric had heard of Arcania. The country was about 70% Jungle with the remaining part a desert. Most cities built in such uninhabitable areas would be small and poor but Arcania was one of the most prosperous cities in the kingdoms because of two reasons. One was the high skill of their wizards and learning from the Arcanian academy was the greatest honor a future wizard could hope for. As a result it was extremely expensive to enroll in the academy. The second was that the city was built upon the ruins of another great civilization. Very little is known about this civilization but their technology and magical knowledge was greater than anyone else. The Arcanians continue to study these ruins and have learn more about magic and craftsmanship than anyone else because of it. Artifacts made it Arcania is then sold to other kingdoms for a high price.

This has led to great rivalry between the Arcanians and the Dragon-kin and nowhere else are Dragon-kin more unwelcome than in Arcania. This civilization used a old dialect of draconic in their writing and the walls of these ruins are full of dragon sculptures and the crypts of the ruins are full of skeletons that resemble Dragon-kin. As a result the Dragon-kin believes that these people had strong ties to dragons and that the first dragon-kin was created there. As a result the Dragon-kin believe that the knowledge in these ruins belong to dragons and their descendants and that the Arcanians were stealing their inheritance. Several dragon-kin tribes lived in the Arcanian jungles and went to extreme lengths to protect the outlying ruins from raiders.

"Arcania? Why would they attack there?" asked Annabella's father.

"Because you dealt him a stinging defeat when he last attacked here. He'll want to build up his strength again. Arcania has the best mages in the world, if he enslaves them, then they can do a lot of damage and the Arcanians also has the most powerful relics in the world stored in their vaults." replied Tempest.

"There won't be a better chance than now to retake Firamore." said Annabella's father.

"With all due respect, your majesty, You're throne can wait. The Arcanians don't have that luxury." said Hawkeyes.

"This isn't about my throne! But the suffering of my people! If we can free their families then Irzac will lose his hold on them." said Annabella's father.

"Irzac has planned for that possibility. If his people tell him that Firamore has fallen then he will withhold that information until the siege of Arcania has ended, then execute the surviving conscripted as they will be of no further use to him. This will make the families angry at you and could cause public order problems. If you want to save your people then we'll have to strike at both places at once. Irzac knows you don't have the forces to do that." said Tempest.

"Then what do we do?" asked Annabella's father.

"During the dragon war, The ruins which Arcania is built on was ruled by a dragon lord. This dragon lord was quite paranoid and had a escape route built by his slaves that leads right from the vaults of the castle to the bottom of the cliffs behind it. We enforcers know of the route and how to get through. I can lead a small team through the route and then wait at the other side for your signal. On top of the castle is a large scrying mirror that the Arcanians use to broadcast events. Once you capture Firamore we can take control of the mirror and use it to send a message to Irzac's forces. This will cause them to revolt right there and it might give the Arcanians the edge they need to break the siege." said Tempest.

"During the revolt, many people will be killed." said King Jerrod.

"No doubt, but if we wait until after the battle, They will all be killed." replied Tempest.

"What about the Arcanians? Those conscripted men are their enemies. They may imprison or kill then afterwards." asked King Jerrod.

"That's why a member of the royal family should come with me. So that they can negotiate with the Arcanians afterwards." replied Tempest.

"Neither me nor my brother will be able to go, as we have to lead the army and its too dangerous to send my wife with you." said Annabella's father.

"I will go." said Annabella.

"It's too dangerous, daughter." said her father.

"I can handle myself. I thought I already proved that during the siege." said Annabella.

"I'll go with them too. I'm good at stealth, so I might be able to help." said Hawkeyes.

"I'll march with the army." said Lord Silvermore.

"What about you Sir Eric?" asked Annabella's father.
114311211212111111111111111111.title: A enforcer arrived at the city

1143112112121111111111111111112.content:
"I am Princess Annabella's bodyguard. Where she goes I go." replied Eric.

"I'm glad. I dislike sending her in such danger. Please keep her safe." said Annabella's father.

"Then it's decided. My brother and I will take our armies and strike at Firamore, while you three will travel to Arcania and use the secret entrance to enter the besieged city. Once we liberate Firamore you will broadcast our victory to Irzac's army. When they rebel you will help the Arcanians to defeat Irzac's remaining loyalists. Can we expect elven help in retaking Firamore?" said King Jerrod.

"I'll send a message to my king. and ask him to meet your forces close to Firamore." replied Hawkeyes.

"Good that will improve our chances in retaking Firamore. If Arcania has fallen by the time you get there or we fail to recapture Firamore. Abandon the mission, don't try to assist the Arcanians as that will only cause your capture or death." said King Jerrod.

"I understand." said Tempest.

After the meeting the two kings and Lord Silvermore remained to discuss battle plans for the siege of Firamore. While Eric, Annabella, Hawkeyes and Tempest left to get supplies for the journey. When they were away from the other people they discussed how they would reach Arcania. They would leave the city on horseback as if they were going to ride to Arcania but when they were far enough from the city, Eric would take dragon form and he will carry Annabella and Hawkeyes while Tempest will fly beside him.

They gathered the supplies and left the city shortly thereafter.

After half an hour's riding Tempest told them to stop.

"That's far enough, we'll strap the supplies to Eric, then we can set off." said Tempest.

As the others packed the supplies Eric wondered what he was going to do with his spear. He wanted to bring it with him but hadn't considered how he was going transport it. He couldn't wield it while in dragon form and he can't carry it in his mouth the entire trip.

"Princess? can you please carry my spear for me? I won't be able to while in dragon form and that way you can protect yourself if your magic fails you." asked Eric.

"Of course." replied Annabella and took the spear from him.

Once she moved further away Eric turned to dragon form and the others tied the bags to his back with rope.

"If secrecy wasn't necessary I would have suggested that you use a saddle, Eric. But it would have been difficult to explain to the others what the gigantic saddle was for. I only hope the supplies doesn't fall off. we'll have to check regularly." said Tempest.

Hawkeyes tied a message to a hawk that he brought with him and sent it flying to the elven realms. Annabella and Hawkeyes then climbed on Eric's back and Eric raised his wings and took flight.

"Hawkeyes! Loosen your grip, your crushing me." said Annabella.

"Sorry, I'm not used to this." replied Hawkeyes.

"That's what the spikes are for." said Eric.

"Tempest! can you tell us what the political situation is in Arcania? Can we expect any trouble from the Dragon-kin Tribes?" asked Eric.

"That depends on which tribe we run into. Some will attack on sight and try to rob us after we're dead, others will at least give us the chance to hand over our valuables, if we refuse then they'll kill us and take it anyway." replied Tempest.

"Not the friendliest bunch are they? at least you're with us, hopefully you can talk them down." said Eric.

"I'd prefer we avoid them completely." replied Tempest.

"Why? aren't you happy to return to your homeland and your people?" asked Annabella.

"No, I would have been happy never to return." replied Tempest.

"Why would you want that? I don't understand." said Annabella.

"I wasn't always an enforcer. When I was younger I ... did some thing I'm not proud of ... This opens up so old wounds I thought were healed long ago." said Tempest.

"I'm sorry to ask but is your past going to cause us trouble?" asked Annabella.

"I don't think so. I doubt anyone will recognize me. It happened a long time ago." replied Tempest.

They fell silent after that but Eric couldn't help but wonder what could have happened that caused Tempest to go into self-imposed exile.
1143112112121111111111111111112.title: Eric goes to Arcania

11431121121211111111111111111121.content:
They made excellent progress during the day. Tempest used his magic to create a small tail wind that sped Eric up considerably. As a result they had already reached the Arcanian jungles close to the end of the day. Even though Eric was used to flying and was very fit, he never flew so far with such a heavy load so when the sun was beginning to set he was completely exhausted.

"Eric! We should land and let you rest for the night." said Tempest.

"I'm not eager to land in another forested area. The last time I did that it didn't go so well." replied Eric.

"You mean the one where you made friends with the elves and saved Sanctuary?" asked Tempest.

"I suppose when you say it like that, it doesn't sound so bad." replied Eric.

"There is a village not far from here. It isn't large and it's more of a glorified logging camp but it is prosperous, we can rest there until morning." said Tempest.

"Are you expecting me to land right in the middle of the village looking like this?" asked Eric.

"Of course not. Land on the road and we'll remove the supplies from your back. If we all help we should be able to carry it all to the village." said Tempest.

"Just don't run into any trees before we get there." said Hawkeyes. Annabella burst out laughing after that which caused Eric to growl with annoyance.

"Mock me again and you can walk the rest of the way to Arcania, Hawkeyes." said Eric. Once they landed and removed the supplies Eric turned back to human form and picked up his portion of the load. Half and hour later they saw the village, as Tempest had said, it was quite small with only a few houses, a warehouse, a sawmill and a inn. As they walked deeper into the village they didn't see a single person in the village. there was also no light shining in any of the buildings.

"I thought you said it was prosperous." said Eric.

"It was. Something is wrong here. take a look around but be careful, I don't like this at all." said Tempest.

They split up and began to check the houses for people. Eric stopped in front of a house and called out for someone. When no one answered he carefully opened the door and stepped into the house. The inside looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks and was full of dust and spiderwebs. The dining table had plates of food that had long been spoiled on it as if someone had prepared the household dinner and had been interrupted before they could start. A large streak of dried blood covered the floor but Eric didn't see a body anywhere.

"This is very strange." thought Eric.

He continued to explore the house but didn't find anyone in the house. The door to the bedroom was broken down and Eric saw a large pool of dried blood on the floor of the room. After a while Eric left the house and met the others in the center of the village.

"Anything?" asked Eric.

"Not a single person living or dead. But there appears to be signs of a struggle." said Hawkeyes.

"Could Irzac's men be behind this?" asked Eric.

"Maybe, but I doubt it. They would have stolen anything useful but nothing has been touched." said Tempest.
11431121121211111111111111111121.title: They find a abandoned village

114311211212111111111111111111211.content:
"Wait, there's someone there. Let's ask him." said Annabella.

Eric turned around and saw a man in leather armor standing with his back to them staring at a wall. The man's armor was covered in dirt, mud and blood and he had a club in his hand. Eric suspected that he might be with the local militia.

"What kind of soldier would report for duty with such a filthy uniform? And what commander would allow a soldier to look like that?" thought Eric.

Annabella walked towards the man and called out to him.

"Excuse me soldier, could you tell ..." started Annabella.

"Princess!! Get away from him!!" called Tempest. As the man turned around Annabella screamed and staggered back. While the man looked normal from behind, from the front no one could mistake him for a human. All skin was gone from his face leaving only a grinning skull. The thing shrieked then began limping towards Annabella. Eric rushed forward and stepped in front of Annabella.

"Princess! Stay behind me!" yelled Eric. The skeleton swung his club at Eric but it moved so sluggishly Eric easily dodged the blow, then knocked it's head off with his sword.

"That was easier that I thought it would be." said Eric as he turned back to the Princess.

"ERIC! behind you!" called Annabella.

Eric turned around to see the now headless skeleton swing his club at him again. Eric jumped back to avoid the blow.

"What the ... !!!" yelled Eric. Even as he spoke he saw the skull fly through the air and reconnect with it's body. It raised it's head and let loose a long shriek. Eric heard a moan and saw more of the 'things' stagger into the square from all directions. Hawkeyes fired a arrow at one of them, knocking it's head off but it continued to advance towards them. Realizing that his bow is useless against them he put it away and drew his sword.

"Cover me!" called Annabella and began to mutter a spell. The others quickly joined Eric and formed a triangle around Annabella.

Tempest struck one of the skeletons with his hammer causing the entire thing to fall apart but as Tempest turned to face his next enemy Eric saw the bones slowly beginning to reattach to each other. As the first skeleton struck at Eric with his club again, he cut upward with his sword and severed it's arm. It didn't stop it though as it grabbed Eric by the throat with it's other hand and began to strangle him. Eric tried to free himself from it's grip but it was stronger than he thought so he slashed at it's spine causing the thing to fall to the ground. Eric then raised a foot and stomped on it's head, breaking the skull into small pieces Eric knew that it would reassemble itself but that it would take some time.

"Princess! What ever you're doing. Hurry! We can't hold out much longer!" yelled Eric. Eric just finished yelling when a force of bright light flew from Annabella and passed through her companions. When it struck the skeletons though they began to fall apart. Annabella started getting faint and would have fallen to the ground if Eric didn't catch her. He eyes the bodies suspiciously, fearful that they would begin reassembling again but they remained still.

"You can let me go now, Eric. I just needed a moment. That spell took a lot of power." said Annabella. Eric released her and she rose up again.

"What were those things?" asked Eric.

"Undead. I've heard of them but never actually saw one before." replied Tempest.

"How can such an unnatural thing exist?" asked Hawkeyes.

"They are created with one of two ways. The first one is if someone did something truly evil, then he's soul can be cursed to never find rest. The second method is for a necromancer to force a dead body back to life and bind it to his will." replied Tempest.

"I thought necromancy was wiped out decades ago?" said Annabella.

"Sadly no. Several large cults do still exist in the more isolated lands." said Tempest.

"Why destroy and raise this village though?" asked Eric.

"Maybe they were testing their knowledge, maybe they were feeling malicious or maybe it was a trap for anyone who came to Arcania's aid."

"Do you think they're working with Irzac?" asked Annabella.

"I wouldn't be surprised if they were." replied Tempest.

"I'd rather not rest here. Who knows what else might be lurking in the area." said Hawkeyes.

"I agree, I'll carry the supplies until we find a safer place to make camp." replied Eric. Eric then turned back into dragon form and once the supplies were secured they left the cursed village and traveled deeper into the jungle.
114311211212111111111111111111211.title: The village is cursed

1143112112121111111111111111112111.content:
Eric was currently sitting near the campfire struggling to stay awake. After they left the village they wander into the jungle for a few miles until they were sure they were far enough from the cursed town. Annabella placed wards around the camp so that they will be warned if any undead wandered into the area. Once the camp was secure they removed the supplies from Eric's back so that he could take human form and rest comfortably. Despite being tired from the day's events Eric struggled to relax. He just started falling asleep when a spear flew over his head and struck a tree at the edge of camp. They jumped to their feet and was just about to reach for their weapons when a voice called out.

"I wouldn't do that if I were you!" said the man. Eric slowly turned towards the voice and saw several red scaled dragon-kin standing at the edge of camp. They wore no clothing at all except for a leather loincloth and a few bone trinkets around their necks or on their wrists.

"Who are you?" asked Eric.

"That isn't important. What is important is that you are trespassing on my tribe's territory without paying tribute." said the leader.

"Is that anyway to treat a long lost cousin?" asked Tempest.

"You smell like the outsiders. don't expect us to treat you any better 'cousin'." replied the leader.

"I am a enforcer and you WILL leave us be!" threatened Tempest.

"I will do nothing of the sort. The enforcers have no authority here. You look familiar. Have we met before?" asked the leader.

"I doubt that." replied Tempest.

"What tribe are you outsider?" asked the leader.

"I have no tribe." replied Tempest.

"Every dragon-kin has a tribe, even the enforcers. If you don't tell me then I'll have ... Wait ... It can't be." said the leader. He came closer and inspected Tempest's face.

"Draukir? Draukir Stormlord?" asked the leader.

"I'm afraid your mistaking me for someone else." replied Tempest.

"There's no mistake. Did you really think my tribe would forget what you did? I have to admit I thought you died on that mountain with the others of your tribe. I thought my chief was paranoid when he put a bounty on a dead man's head and yet here you are alive and well. You embarrassed me on that mountain. It would have been better for you if you finished me off that day." said the leader.

"That's not a mistake I'll make again. You know how dangerous I am. Let us go and forget you ever saw me and I won't have to kill you." threatened Tempest.

"I can't do that. My chief agreed to name the person who found you his heir." replied the leader.

"What about us? We found him as well!" called one of the other dragon-kin. As the leader turned to the dragon-kin, Tempest grabbed the leader's head and twisted it, breaking his neck. The other dragon-kin cried out in alarm and tried to jab Tempest with their spears but he blocked the one with his shield and broke the other with his hammer. Eric drew his sword and attacked as they were closing in on Tempest. In a few moment they killed all but one of the dragon-kin. Annabella tried to hit him with a spell but he dodged it, then gave her a backhand blow to the face which caused her to fall to the ground. As he raised his spear to impale her Eric stabbed him through the back.

"What was that about!" yelled Eric.

"Just some old enemies." answered Tempest.

"Is that all you have to say for yourself! You almost got the princess killed!" yelled Eric.

"Eric, I'm all right. You can relax." said Annabella.

"Eric, I'm sorry but I can't change what happened. I know you want answers but I don't feel comfortable talking about it. Please understand that." said Tempest.

"Fine, but you better not have anymore old enemies around!" said Eric. They took the bodies away from camp and Annabella incinerated them before they returned to camp and tried to get some rest.
1143112112121111111111111111112111.title: They're discovered by wild dragon-kin

11431121121211111111111111111121111.content:
The next two days went without incident so Eric was able to recover from the flight. Despite his best efforts Eric was unable to find out more from Tempest about his past. At noon on the second day Eric saw Arcania. It was built on a flat part of a mountain. A large blue dome of magic surrounded the city so Eric was unable to see more of the city. The dome blocked any projectiles fired at the city but Eric saw that cracks was beginning to appear in the dome so Eric realized that it won't be able to hold much longer. Eric also saw Irzac's army and was shocked when he saw how many he still had. The only reason Arcania hadn't fallen yet was because the dome stopped anyone from entering the city. Eric quickly dropped to the ground before anyone could see him and landed on a tall hill from which they could study the siege.

"I hope that dome isn't covering the secret entrance." said Eric.

"It isn't. I can see where the entrance is supposed to be hidden." said Tempest. He pointed to the base of the mountain to the right of the city. They then removed the last of the supplies from Eric so that he can take human form again.

Tempest then removed a mirror from his bags and after muttering a incantation Annabella's father appeared in the mirror.

"Your majesty, we have arrived at Arcania. Have you captured Firamore yet?" asked Tempest.

"The walls have been breached and the hostages secured but there are still small pockets of Irzac's men fighting. We should have complete control once you reach the mirror." replied the king.

"Very well. I'll contact you when we reach the mirror." said Tempest. He then ended the spell and the king disappeared again.

"Hawkeyes, stay here and watch the supplies. We'll start moving towards the secret entrance. If the barrier breaks report it to us." said Tempest.

"How do I do that?" asked Hawkeyes.

"Use this." said Tempest. He handed a polished stone to Hawkeyes which had a strange symbol carved into it's face.

"What is it?" asked Hawkeyes.

"It's a broadcast stone. Press the symbol on it's face then speak to the stone. We'll be able to hear from our side." said Tempest. He held up an identical stone before returning it to his pocket.

Hawkeyes nodded his head while the others began to carefully walk towards the side of the mountain. They stayed close to the trees to keep them from being seen. A short while later they arrived at the base of the cliff.

"Look for a stone with a dragon symbol carved into it." said Tempest. They split up and a few minutes later Eric found the stone that Tempest described. He pressed the stone and a rock wall moved sideways revealing a cave entrance. "The cave will be filled with traps so be careful where you step." said Tempest.

"Maybe they're not working anymore." said Eric. As he said that he stepped forward and felt the ground sink under him. Tempest grabbed his shoulder and pulled him back and a spear struck the wall where Eric was standing a second ago.

"I think they're still working." said Tempest.

They carefully went through the different trap rooms. The first one had tiles with draconic symbols on the floor. Tempest warned them to only step on the tiles with the symbol for 'knowledge' on it. The second one relied on a dragon's sight as the floor was fragile in several places but a complicated path of solid tiles led to the doors. To a normal person the tiles looked identical but a dragon could clearly see which were fragile and which were not. If someone stepped on the wrong one the floor would break and they would fall into a pit of spikes. After they were finished with the second one Tempest told them that it was the last one but as they advanced they came across a arch with glowing symbols on it.

"Wait. This wasn't in the records." said Tempest.

"What does it say?" asked Eric.

"Only by besting your fear may you pass." said Tempest. He carefully waved his hand past the arch but nothing happened.

"Hmm, maybe it's a trick." said Tempest. They passed under the arch and entered the room. Torches were placed along the wall and Eric saw large doors at the other side of the room. Eric was shocked when he saw a dragon that looks exactly like him step out of the shadows and stop a few feet in front of him. While across from Annabella a middle aged version of Annabella appeared. She had a black dress with a long black staff in her hand with a jagged crown on her head. In front of Tempest appeared a larger blue scaled dragon-kin with a sword in each hand.

"Draakesh?" asked Tempest.

"Hello son. You didn't think you could bury me away forever did you?" said the dragon-kin.

"What are you?" asked Annabella.

"I am queen Annabella and you will all bow to me or I will destroy you." said her double.

"I think these are illusions of whatever we fear the most." said Eric.

"We should fight each other's fears then so that they have no power over us." suggested Tempest.

"No! we know our own fears. we might need that knowledge to beat them." called Annabella.
11431121121211111111111111111121111.title: Arcania hasn't fallen

choices: The barrier broke while they were in the caves
114311211212111111111111111111211111.content:
Eric raises his sword and steps towards his double.

"Ha,ha,ha!! Do you really think you can best me in that pitiful form." said his double.

"I've bested many dragons before. You will be no different." said Eric.

"Your unappreciative of mother's gifts. You were prey once but she gave you the chance to be one of the dominant species." said the double.

"This is no gift but a curse." replied Eric.

"Why do you resist me? You know you will become like me eventually. Set down your sword and embrace me. You'll enjoy mother's gifts then. I promise." said his double.

"NEVER!!!" yelled Eric and charged at the dragon. Eric slashed at the dragon's foreleg but it reared up and Eric missed. Eric rolled away just in time before the dragon slammed his legs down into the ground where Eric had been standing. Eric jumped forward and cut at it's legs but his sword was unable to cut through the dragon's scales. Whatever this thing was it's scales was far harder that any dragon Eric had ever fought before.

"You'll never beat me! Because unlike you, I'm not afraid of using mother's gifts." said the double.

"I'll have to use my knowledge of a dragon's weakness if I'm to best this thing." thought Eric. He knew that the scales at the inner part of it's front legs was weaker that the outward facing part and that a single strike to the back of it's head, close to it's neck would pierce it's skull and kill it. As the dragon prepared to jump at Eric again. Eric rushed between it's legs and stabbed at the back part of it's right foreleg. The blow should have penetrated the scales but the moment his sword connected his arm bounced back as if he tried to stab through a stone wall. The dragon then reared up and Eric heard it inhale before a fireball exploded next to him, sending him flying. Eric rolled on the ground before he rose to his feet.

"That was supposed to hurt it." thought Eric. Suddenly Eric recalled what his double said about 'his mother's gifts'.

"Maybe I'm supposed to fight it in dragon form." thought Eric. Eric then stabbed his sword into the ground and with explosive force turned into his dragon form.

"Ahhh. The weakling figured it out. But I'm afraid it's too late for that now." said his double. It tackled Eric and the two began rolling on the floor each trying to get on top and get a grip on the other's neck. Eric hoped that the others were far enough from them otherwise they might soon be crushed. His double clawed Eric in the face leaving him with three scars close to his right eye. The double tried to claw him again but Eric dodged it then slapped his double through the face with his tail. Eric then closed his jaws around it's neck before it could recover. It roared it pain and thrashed trying to break free but Eric bit down harder then twisted it's neck until it broke. Eric released his opponent and it fell to the ground dead. The body then began to fade until it disappeared completely.

Eric then thought to check how the others were doing. At that moment Annabella fired a blast of magic at the queen but it missed by miles.

"Ha! Is that the best you can do?" mocked the queen. What the queen didn't see though was that the blast turned around and was racing back towards her from behind. It hit her in the back and knocked her forward. The queen flailed her arms to regain her balance. Once she was within reach Annabella grabbed the queen and stabbed her under the chin with Eric's spear.

Tempest seemed to be struggling though. He was bleeding from several wounds while his opponent was unharmed. Eric also saw that Tempest appeared to be holding back.

Draakesh swung his sword at Tempest but he manages to ducks under the blow. Draakesh then kicks Tempest in the face before he could recover which caused him to flail backwards trying to regain his balance, Draakesh then strikes Tempest's hammer which knocks his arm to the side before delivering a second strike which broke Tempest's hammer apart.

"I've got to help him!" thought Eric. He rushed forward and prepared to pounce on Draakesh but when he was a few feet away Eric suddenly ran into a magic barrier which knocked him back. Eric skid to a stop before shaking his head to clear his vision. Eric swung a paw at the barrier but he might as well have tried to break down a mountain with nothing but his claws.

"Princess!! Help me get this barrier down!!" called Eric. Annabella joined Eric and begun throwing spells at the barrier but nothing was able to get through.

Eric watched as Tempest tried to claw his opponent but he dodged it then struck Tempest with the pommel of his sword in the chest. As Tempest was knocked backwards Draakesh gave a roundhouse kick to his shield which knocked it out of his hand before he stabbed Tempest in the chest.

"TEMPEST!!!" called Eric.

"Just as weak as I remembered!" said Draakesh. He then kicks Tempest back. Tempest rolls once before he lands on his feet again while placing his left hand on his wound to stop the bleeding.

"I can't believe I ever considered you a worthy heir. Time to join the rest of your tribe, son." said Draakesh.

Tempest seemed to snap at that moment. He rose to his full height then roared with rage and a large sword appeared in his hand.

"What is THAT?" thought Eric.

"You really think you can wield that, welp?" said Draakesh.

Draakesh then charged at him and swung his sword but Tempest bent backwards under the blade. He then swept Draakesh's feet out from under him with his sword causing his opponent to fall on his back. Draakesh rolled to the side then quickly got to his feet. Tempest charged at him and Draakesh crossed his swords to block a blow but Tempest gave a uppercut with the sword which knocked both of Draakesh's weapons into the air. Tempest then slashed him three times before stabbing him right through the chest. As Tempest began to withdraw the sword Draakesh grabbed the blade of the sword to keep him from pulling it out.

"There's ... the son I knew ... and loved." said Draakesh. Tempest then tore the sword out of his opponent's body before he faded to nothing. With his opponent dead the barrier surrounding them disappeared and Eric and Annabella rushed to his side. With his battle rage subsiding Tempest gave the sword a remorseful look before he made it disappear again.

"Are you alright?" asked Annabella.

"I'm fine. My armor stopped the worst of it." replied Tempest.

"I'll heal it for you." said Annabella.

"No! Save your strength. We might need it later." said Tempest.

"How did you summon that sword and what..." asked Eric.

"Not now! I know you must have a lot of questions but I'll answer them later." interrupted Tempest.

"I'll hold you to that promise." replied Eric

They then rushed to the doors that led into the city.
114311211212111111111111111111211111.title: They face their own fears

1143112112121111111111111111112111111.content:
Eric carefully opened the doors and was amazed at what he saw. Before him was a room filled with all manner of treasures. Numerous golden statues were in the room, gems the size of his head glowed in chests filled with gold and numerous magic artifacts. Eric knew more than a few dragons would be green with envy if they saw the wealth in the room. Tempest took a quick look through the room before he spoke up.

"Go check the doors for guards. I'll join you shortly." said Tempest.

When the others ran ahead Tempest quickly grabbed a black tome from the treasure hold and hid it in his bags before the others could see what he did. He then placed an identical black tome in its place then ran to join the others.

"Looks clear!" said Eric after he peeked through the door.

"This way!" said Tempest. He led them to a staircase and they began to climb. When they reached the top they ran through a archway and found themselves at the top of the castle on a large balcony. Behind them the scrying mirror was mounted high on the wall and before them by the railings was a middle aged man in white robes overlooking the city. Eric also saw that the cracks in the magic barrier had gotten bigger and Eric didn't think the cities defenses would last much longer. Tempest then began to advance on the man.

"Excuse me sir, could you please ... " began Tempest. The moment the man turned around to face him Tempest kicked him between the legs before knocking him out with a blow to the face.

"Was that really necessary?" asked Annabella.

"Maybe not, but it was fun though." replied Tempest. At that moment a boulder from one of Irzac's catapults hit the barrier, causing it to shatter before the boulder continued on and fell somewhere in the city. Once the barrier broke Eric heard a cheer from Irzac's army before the siege towers began to move forward.

"We need to hurry!" said Tempest. He ran to the mirror and muttered the same spell as before and the king again appeared in the mirror.

"The mirror is ours! Broadcast your message, your majesty!" called Tempest.

"PEOPLE OF FIRAMORE!!!" called the king.

The fighting stopped for an instant as everyone focused on the mirror.

"I stand before you to tell you your oppression has ended. Firamore has been liberated and your families are free. Throw down your shackles and destroy your oppressors. FOR FIRAMORE!!!!" called the king.

There was a moment of complete silence on the battlefield before chaos broke out as Irzac's began fighting each other. The Arcanians however were still uncertain and resumed attacking both sides.

"Princess! You need to talk the Arcanians down or they'll kill everyone. Eric! come with me. We need to save as many as we can." said Tempest.

"Tempest! use this!" said Annabella. She threw Eric's spear to him and Tempest caught it out of the air. Tempest and Eric then ran to the railings and jumped over it and fell to the ground. When they were close to the ground Tempest opened his wings to reduce his speed while Eric cast a spell to do the same. Once they landed they ran as fast as they could to the walls. Tempest reached the walls first and rushed up the stairs leading to the top. Once he reached the top he pushed a startled Arcanian out of the way before he jumped off the walls and landed outside the city. Eric followed him a few seconds later. Since they were uncertain who was fighting for Irzac and who was fighting against him they avoided getting between the common soldiers but instead focused on fighting Irzac's remaining officers.

Eric dispatched the enemy in front of him then saw Irzac standing on a hill still shouting orders to his soldiers. Irzac then looked down and a look of anger appeared on his face when he saw Eric.

"You again!! I'll make you pay for undermining my plans!!" yelled Irzac. He took a step towards Eric but a soldier ran up to him shouting.

"Sir! Sir! Our forces are in disarray! We must retreat or we'll be captured!" said the soldier. Irzac seemed to hesitate, torn between retribution and self-preservation. In the end self-preservation won out and Irzac reluctantly called a retreat. Before he left he gave one last venomous look at Eric.

"You may have won this battle but I will be back! I swear it!" said Irzac before he turned around and skulked away into the jungle.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111.title: They safe the city

choices: Eric asks him about the stolen relic
11431121121211111111111111111121111111.content:
Eric currently sat close to the campfire trying to get warm. They spent most of the day arguing with the ruler of Arcania. Despite the fact that Irzac had conscripted the soldiers into his army the Arcanians still wanted to punish them for their crimes. Negotiations was especially difficult when they discovered that the middle aged man Tempest knocked out was in fact the ruler of Arcania. After a long time an agreement was reached. The conscripted would all be released but Firamore would compensate Arcania for the damage their people caused to the kingdom. Once the agreement was reached Annabella contacted her father to arrange safe transport for their people. Her father sent a battalion to Arcania to escort the people safely back to their homes. Her father also let her know that he's about to take the army and march on Irzac's stronghold to wipe him out once and for all. Tempest convinced him to wait a few days for them to return as he was afraid that if they pushed him in a corner like that then he might ignore the high dragon lord's command and attack their army as a dragon. Tempest suspected that Irzac would wait until he's further away from Arcania, then take dragon form and fly back to his stronghold as fast as he can, leaving his army to find it's own way back. They planned to travel day and night to reach the army in time but Annabella insisted that they rest tonight as everyone except Hawkeyes was tired from the day's events. They built a small camp and Hawkeyes went hunting as everyone was tired to old provisions and wanted something fresh. Half and hour later he returned with a young buck and while the meat was cooking they told him what happened in the caves under Arcania.

"That sounds like a nasty experience. I'm glad I missed it." said Hawkeyes.

"It was. But it was also quite enlightening." replied Annabella.

Tempest was clearly still troubled by what he saw in the caves. He just stared at the flames and didn't say a word.

"Tempest, I know you don't want to talk about your past but it's clearly still troubling you. Maybe you'll feel better once you talk about it." said Eric.

"You won't stop asking until I tell you, will you? I suppose you've earned the right . Do you know the origins of the dragon-kin race?" said Tempest.

"I know Shadow-stalker created your race to fight humans." said Eric.

"Then you only know part of it. It is true that he created the first dragon-kin but he wasn't the only dragon to succeed. There were six powerful dragons with complete mastery over the elements: Fire, water, air, earth, light and darkness. when Shadow-stalker created the dragon-kin the others grew jealous and created dragon-kin in their own image. The first one of each bloodline was given a weapon that gave them power over their master's element. To keep others from using the weapons against them they locked it's inner powers away so that only a descendant of their bloodline could unlock it. To anyone else it's just a normal weapon. Because the dragon lords placed so much of their essence into the weapons, they gained a will of their own and since the dragon lords weren't the nicest dragons around, the weapons corrupted the ones who unlocked their full power." said Tempest.

After the war the original bloodlines began to fade as the dragon-kin began intermingling with each other until all but one of the bloodlines were wiped out. As you may have figured out by now my real name is Draukir of the stormlord tribe and my tribe could trace our line back to one of the founders. My father was Draakesh, the chief of the tribe and he was once a good man that wanted to reunite the tribes and stop our infighting. When a dragon-kin comes of age he must leave his village and not return until he has made a name for himself or until he brought back something valuable to the tribe. Since I was his only son he put a great deal of pressure on me to excel during this rite. Only the strongest of the tribe is chosen to lead so I had no guarantee that they would choose me to lead when my father died or retired. I made my why to a Arcanian tavern to rest and consider what to do when I overheard a scholar bragging about finding the secrets of the Stormlords. He was trying to hire guards for an expedition to some ruins. I figured that if I brought back something of our history to the tribe then it would prove my worth to them. So I waited until he left then found him and 'persuaded' him to part with the information. After some difficulty I reached the vault which was protected by a blood seal that only a Stormlord could open. I broke the seal and found the sword you saw me wield hidden there and returned it to my tribe. My father was amazed at the gift and told me it's called ' The Eye of the Hurricane ' and that it was wielded by the first Stormlord.

My father took the sword for himself and announced that he was going to unite all tribes under Stormlord rule.

"Was that when the sword corrupted him?" asked Annabella.

"No, The corruption started slowly. At first he gained allies through diplomacy but as he went on his methods became more extreme until his plans started including blackmail, threats, kidnapping and conquest. At first I was eager to help him and earned the nickname ' herald of the storm ' from our enemies but as time went on I began to lose faith in him. When I discovered that he planned to use the sword's power to turn all dragon-kin into Stormlords and bind them to his will with the same spell the dragon lords used to control us during the war I decided that he had gone to far. I went to the mountain where he gathered our tribe and argued with him. Eventually he grew so angry he banished me from his sight. I left the mountain and planned to get as far away from that mess as a could when I realized that I caused all that and that it was my responsibility to fix so I returned to the mountain to stop the ritual at any cost.

My father anticipated opposition so he had his loyalist tribes place their greatest champions at the site to keep anyone from intervening while he and my tribe cast the ritual.

"Why would they help him if he planned to enslave them?" asked Eric.

"Because he deceived them. He told them the ritual would turn them to their original founder status and that they would rule the others of the same bloodline alongside my father." replied Tempest.

After battling my way past the guards I confronted my father at the summit. He told me he was disappointed with how weak I've become and that I was willing to work against my own tribe. We fought and when the battle started to turn against him he pleaded with me to stop. He told me that if the ritual is interrupted then the backlash would kill my tribe since they were connected to the ritual as well. I told him there was no other way and ran him through which killed my tribe as well. After retrieving the sword I took it back to the ruins where I found it. I planned to lock it back in the vault before killing myself so that someone can't use my blood to retrieve the sword again when your father stopped me.

"Lord Silvermore was there?" asked Eric.

"Yes, News of my father's madness had spread and he intended to stop him. Lord Silvermore told me there might be another way to hide the sword and took me to your mother. She told me that the sword bound itself to me the same way your sword is bound to your body. She taught me how to lock it inside me. She believed that it's influence would be greatly weakened while hidden like that but to be certain she cast wards on me to protect me from any dark thoughts that might slip through. After that your father introduced me to the High dragon lord and told him my story. He agreed to take me into the enforcers and conceal my identity from the others to protect me." replied Tempest.

"You did the right thing." said Annabella.

"I know." said Tempest.

"Then why does this still bother you?" asked Annabella.

"Because that entire mess was my fault!! If I didn't bring the sword back or if I saw what it was doing to my father sooner then none of that would have happened!!" said Tempest.

"You had no way of knowing what it would have done." said Eric.

"Doesn't make it right though. Look I know your trying to make me feel better but can we please change the subject." replied Tempest.

"As you wish." said Eric.
11431121121211111111111111111121111111.title: Tempest tells them his past

114311211212111111111111111111211111111.content:
"Since you don't want to talk about your past then maybe we can talk about the item you stole in Arcania." said Eric.

"Uhh ... I don't know what you mean." said Tempest.

"I saw you put something in your bags and although I couldn't see what it was I know what I saw." said Eric.

"Ohh that! Would you believe it was just a few gold and jewel trinkets? You know how much dragons like shiny things." replied Tempest.

"Actually since becoming a dragon I've learned that it's not the case. Although dragons like beauty they aren't nearly as greedy as the knights and priests let people know." said Eric.

"Kid! I think that's the first time I heard you say something positive about dragons." replied Tempest.

"Don't expect it to become a habit though." said Eric. Since becoming a dragon Eric had learned that many of the old stories were completely false or exaggerated. There were exceptions but most dragons were more like people than the devils and beasts that the stories made them appear. Even with that revelation Eric was reluctant to give up his hatred as it gave him strength and purpose when he previously had none.

"Eric, I know we haven't had the most open cooperation but you must trust me. I keep my secrets for a reason. Knowledge can be very dangerous." said Tempest.

"Perhaps but ignorance can be just as dangerous if not more." said Eric.

"You're not going to drop this?" asked Tempest.

"No" replied Eric.

"Then I see no reason to keep up the deception." said Tempest. He dug through his bags before he pulled out a black leather tome and placed it in front of him. The book had a picture of a bull's skull engraved on the cover. There was also writing on the cover in a language that Eric didn't recognize. Annabella gasped when she saw the book.

"I didn't think you were a bookworm." said Eric.

"That's no normal book, Eric." said Annabella.
