"This is the spell book of the first necromancer." answered Tempest.

"Why would you take something so dangerous? What are you planning?" asked Annabella.

"This is the reason Irzac invaded Arcania." replied Tempest.

"I think its time you tell us the full story." said Hawkeyes.

"A few months ago I was tracking necromancer activity when I heard that their leader was about to meet someone very important. I spied on the meeting and was surprised to see that they were meeting with Irzac. I didn't think even he was crazy enough to strike a deal with the necromancers but he agreed to retrieve the tome for them. In exchange they would use the tome to raise a army of the dead for him to conquer the kingdoms with. I knew that the council wouldn't do anything without proof so I began to hatch a plan to undermine the alliance. I knew that the leaders of the enforcers desired to retrieve the tome for safekeeping but we've been unable to do so before. So I went to them and told them that Irzac planned to invade Arcania and that I would use the distraction to find the tome. I lied to them and told them that I needed your help if my plan was to work so they gave me permission to tell you about Irzac's invasion. Otherwise I would have been unable to warn you about Irzac." explained Tempest.

"Why would they help him and what do they want with the tome?" asked Eric.

"They are not helping him. You forget that he has permission to declare war as a warlord. As a result they didn't think its any of our business to interfere. They just want to keep the tome safe. If you're concerned that they plan on using it then you have nothing to fear. The necromancers placed a curse on the tome. If any non human tries to use it the curse will draw their soul out of their body and bind it to the tome. That's why they will feel safer if the tome is with them. We can't use the tome but the Arcanians can and nothing is more dangerous to the dragon human peace treaty that that tome." replied Tempest.

"Why do they fear it so much and why not tell us?" asked Annabella.

"Humans don't have the energy needed to raise a dead dragon to unlife but that tome amplifies the power of anyone using it. Even a novice would be able to raise a army with the tome but the biggest danger is that they can bind dead dragons to their will. Can you imagine the damage that an army of undead dragons could do? not to mention the damage it would do to our reputation with humans. I didn't tell anyone because I didn't want to risk this information reaching the necromancers. Anyone who has this book is in grave danger but if the necromancers don't know where its disappeared to then it will be safe. They still think its in Arcania by the time they realize it isn't then it will be long gone. I was also afraid that your father might insist on keeping the tome safe in his kingdom, which the enforcers would never accept. This book must stay out of human hands. We're the only ones who can hold it without being tempted to use it." replied Tempest.

"You should have told us. If the Arcanians realize we stole it then they could declare war." said Annabella.

"I placed a duplicate in its place. No one will know the difference unless they use it. The Arcanians need evidence if they want to accuse you of the crime. By the time they realize, there will be none that can link your kingdom to the theft." replied Tempest.

"I don't like that you kept this from us but I do understand our reasons for doing so. I just hope you know what you're doing." said Eric.

"Of course. Now let's change this gloomy subject. We've dealt a serious blow to Irzac today. One that I doubt he'll recover from. I don't think you'll have anymore trouble from him." said Tempest.

Eric wasn't as convinced. Irzac was still at large and Eric didn't think that they've heard the last of him yet.
114311211212111111111111111111211111111.title: Eric asks him about the stolen relic

choices: Lord Silvermore receives a message from Tempest
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
Eric woke just as the sun was beginning to shine through his window at Lord Silvermore's manor in Firamore. He had been staying there for the last six months with his father. After Annabella decided to return to Firamore. Lord Silvermore decided to buy it so that he and Eric could stay close in case she needed their help.

"I wonder what disaster is going to strike us today." thought Eric.

After returning from Arcania they set off with the army towards Irzac's fortress but found it completely abandoned. Annabella's father left a garrison there in case he returned but he had completely vanished. They placed wanted posters all over the kingdoms but Tempest didn't think that it would help. As a dragon Irzac was able to appear as anyone he wished so pictures of him wouldn't help and if things got too hot for him then he would simply retreat to dragon lands since he was still welcome there. With most of his army killed or captured Irzac realized that he could no longer strike as he wished and so retreated into the shadows where he undermined and sabotaged the kingdoms. The first trouble came from Arcania when a convoy of relics was attacked and ransacked. Bodies of men wearing the armor of Firamore was found at the site and the Arcanians blamed them for the massacre. Despite the king's best efforts the Arcanians cut all relations with Firamore until they returned what was stolen. The second trouble came when a longtime trade partner of Firamore suddenly increased the taxes for all goods exported to Firamore. This made it difficult for Firamore to recover economically and caused unrest among the merchant class. The next problem came when a sacred grove of the elves were cut down for timber. The workers responsible showed a document which showed that their guild was granted permission to cut there by the Firamore Royal family. The action almost pushed the elves to declare war on them. The Elven king tried to calm them since he didn't believe Firamore was responsible but he was unable to convince them and he had no choice but to end the alliance and recall Hawkeyes back to the elven realms. Trouble also arose when several prominent dragons were found murdered without provocation. Weapons and shields of several knightly orders from Firamore and Sanctuary was found at the site. Tempest figured that the orders were being framed for the crime and sent requests to the enforcer head fortress for more men and resources to investigate but all requests were ignored. He later became so desperate that he decided to travel to the fortress himself and find out what was happening. They heard nothing else from him until 2 weeks ago when Lord Silvermore received a message from him stating that he was concerned about corruption in the enforcer ranks and that he might have to go dark for a while but that he would contact them when it was safe again.

Eric was certain that Irzac's agents were responsible for these troubles and they spent most of their time trying to uncover these agents before they could do anymore damage. Eric just got up when someone knocked on the door to his room.

"Come in!" called Eric. The door opened and Lord Silvermore stepped through the door.

"Morning son, Did you sleep well?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Well enough." replied Eric.

"Good, you'll need your strength. Princess Annabella's father asked to see us. He said it's urgent." said Lord Silvermore. They left the manor and walked towards the castle. Once they arrived they went to the throne room where the king greeted his guests. Princess Annabella was already there standing beside her father.

"Thank you for coming. I thought it best that we're all present for this." said the king.

"What is wrong, your majesty?" asked Eric.

"A group of enforcers have arrived at the city and their leader has requested a audience with me." replied the king.

"Did they say why?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No, but the fact that they arrived in such numbers worries me. Their leader also wasn't very diplomatic. It sounded more like a demand than a request." replied the king.

"We shouldn't keep him waiting any longer then." said Annabella. They signaled the guard at the door to open the door and a white scaled dragon-kin with ice blue eyes entered the room. He was dressed in armor similar to what Tempest used to wear and carried a large halberd in his right hand. Once the enforcer was closer to the throne the king called out.

"Greetings enforcer! I am King Edward of Firamore. What brings you to my city?" said the king.

"Greetings your majesty! I am called Frostbite" replied the dragon-kin.

"What brings you to my city, Frostbite?" asked the king.

"Have you heard anything from Tempest, your majesty?" asked Frostbite.

"No, not since he left for the enforcer fortress. Why do you ...." replied the king.

"If you hear anything from him. You will contact me or my fellow enforcers immediately and if he comes to you then you must arrest him." interrupted Frostbite.

"I see. May I ask why?" asked the king.

"That is none of your concern!" said Frostbite.

"Things might be different wherever you're from, so I'll explain it to you. I wear the crown and if you expect me to arrest someone then you WILL tell me what crime he's being accused with!!" replied the king. Frostbite remained silent for a moment and Eric could tell that the king's response angered him and that he was trying to calm down before he resumed speaking.

"Tempest has been declared a rogue and is wanted for murder and high treason." said Frostbite.

"What! That's impossible! There has to be a mistake." said Lord Silvermore.

"There's no mistake. He broke into the vault, stole a precious relic and killed two enforcers during his escape. We know of your friendship with him and will be watching you all very closely. Any attempt to hide him from us will be considered an act of war against the enforcers! Good day." said Frostbite. He then turned and left the throne room.

"I think things got a lot more complicated for us now." said the king.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: Six months later

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Do you think Tempest is capable of this?" asked the king.

"No! There's no way Tempest would do this without good reason. Something about this whole thing seems off." replied Lord Silvermore.

"I know you and Tempest are friends. But I can't place my people in such danger for one man. If we see Tempest then we'll have to hand him over." said the king.

"That would be a death sentence. Frostbite doesn't look like he's interested in getting to the truth. He'll just execute him and call it a day." said Eric.

"If I don't then my people will suffer because of it. I'm sorry but that's my final word on the matter." replied the king. They discussed the matter for a moment more before the king gave them permission to leave. As they left the throne room a teenage boy walked up to Lord Silvermore.

"Excuse me, sir! Are you Lord Silvermore?" asked the boy.

"I am. What do you want?" said Lord Silvermore.

"I have a message I'm supposed to deliver to you, sir." said the boy.

"I don't have time for that now! Deliver it to my manor. I'll get to it later." replied Lord Silvermore.

"I'm sorry, sir. But I was told to deliver it into your hands only. It's from a Mr David Estress ..." said the boy.

"Give me that!!!" interrupted Lord Silvermore. He snatched the letter from the boy and handed him a few coins in payment.

"What was that about?" asked Eric.

"Mr David Estress is a alias of Tempest. We agreed that if he was ever in trouble then he would contact me under that name." replied Lord Silvermore.

"That doesn't sound like a dragon-kin name." said Eric.

"It's not supposed to sound like one. Tempest has on occasion used illusions to make himself appear human. When he does that he normally buys property under a fake name which he can then use as a safe house. The letter should mention a town's name. Then we just need to search for any property owned by David Estress at that town." said Lord Silvermore. They opened the letter and began reading.

Sorry old friend but I'm afraid we'll have to cancel our reunion because of the bad weather. Winter seems to have come early and I'm currently trapped at Forest Springs because of it. If you ever find yourself here be sure to look up the silverware. Kind Regards Mr D. Estress.

"What does he mean by 'silverware'? " asked Eric.

"No idea. I guess I'll find out when I get there." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Should we tell the royal family?" asked Eric.

"No! The king will have to tell the enforcers which would mean Tempest's death. I'll not do anything until I get a better idea of what's going on." said Lord Silvermore.

"Then I'm coming with you." said Eric.

"No, it's to dangerous. If the enforcers find out we're helping Tempest they will force the kingdoms to hunt us down as well. I can't ask you to put yourself in such danger." replied Lord Silvermore.

"I'm volunteering. Tempest is my friend as well and I want to help clear his name." said Eric.

"Fine get your things and tell no one where we're going." replied Lord Silvermore.

They rode into Forest Springs 2 days later. They decided to travel by horse to avoid suspicion. After the war the people returned to the village and the town had grown since the last time Eric was there.

"So what now?" asked Eric.

"Let's find the local tavern and ask around." said Lord Silvermore.

They made their way through town until they saw the sign for the tavern. They tied their horses to the post outside and made their into the tavern. Since it was midday there weren't many people inside yet since they were out working and mostly came in the early evenings when they finished work. The staff was preparing the tavern for the evening rush by cleaning the unoccupied tables and preparing the evening meal. The innkeeper looked up and gestured for them to come closer.

"Welcome sir, Might I interest you in a drink for the long road or do you and your son want to rent a room for the night?" asked the innkeeper.

"I came for some information actually." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Ahh, A very expensive commodity that." said the innkeeper. Lord Silvermore placed a few gold coins on the counter.

"What do you want to know?" asked the innkeeper.

"Has a blue scaled dragon-kin been through here lately?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No. There hasn't been any dragon-kin through here." replied the innkeeper.

"I see. What of a Mr David Estress?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No. Haven't seen him in years." replied the innkeeper.

"What did he do the last time he was here?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Ahh, that's a problem. It was a long time ago and my memory isn't what it used to be." said the innkeeper. Lord Silvermore placed a few more coins on the counter.

"Now I remember. He bought the Forest Springs mine then left a few weeks after. said the innkeeper.

"Can you tell me about the mine?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"A sad story. The mine used to be owned by the local lord and was very prosperous. But a cave-in killed a large number of miners working there. The ghosts of those miners couldn't find rest and began to haunt the mine. The lord had no choice but to shut it down. He sold it to Mister Estress at a greatly discounted price. We tried to warn him but he went through with the deal anyway. He hired a dragon-kin mercenary to clear out the mine but he must have failed because the mine never reopened." replied the innkeeper.

"Where is the mine?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"A short distance out of town. Follow the dirt road through the north of town into the forest and it will lead you there. I hope you're not planning to go there. You'll find nothing but your own deaths there. replied the innkeeper.

"Let us worry about that. One last question. Did the mine produce silver?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Yes! How did you know that?" asked the innkeeper.

"Lucky guess. Thank you for your time." said Lord Silvermore. They got up and went outside to their horses.

"You think he's desperate enough to hide in a haunted mine?" asked Eric.

"I think it hasn't been haunted in a long time." replied Lord Silvermore.

"Why keep it closed then?" asked Eric.

"Because no one will be stupid enough to look for him in a haunted mine." replied Lord Silvermore.

"No one except us you mean?" asked Eric.

"It isn't to late yet. You can return to Firamore if you want." replied Lord Silvermore.

"No! I promised to help and I meant it. I'm not comfortable fighting undead again. I still have nightmares about that cursed town in Arcania." said Eric.

"Don't worry. I'm sure it's been cleared out years ago." said Lord Silvermore.

"What if it isn't?" asked Eric.

"Then I know a few tricks that should prove useful." said Lord Silvermore.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: Lord Silvermore receives a message from Tempest

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
A few minutes later they arrive at the Forest Springs Mine. The entrance was covered in cobwebs and scattered around the area were old rusted tools. A old sign was placed near the entrance. Eric guided his horse to the sign and began reading it aloud.

"Due to the extreme risk of additional cave-ins the Lord of Forest Springs have declared the mine unfit for operation. Enter at own Risk." read Eric.

"Then we must be careful." said Lord Silvermore.

They dismounted and carefully entered the mine. The torches had long been extinguished but as they walked into the mine the torches all burst into flame again. As the torches came to life Eric heard a evil laugh echo through the mine. Eric jumped and placed his hand on the hilt of his sword.

"Still think the mine's been cleared?" asked Eric.

They carefully advanced and as they walked deeper into the mine Eric began to hear the sound of picks striking stone. As they came closer to a turn in the shaft the sound became louder. As Eric walked around the corner something caught on his leg and a skeleton jumped from the supports and began to move in front of him. Eric pulled out his sword and was about to strike the skeleton when he saw it was hanging on a rope connected to the supports. Eric looked down and saw a rope stretching across the shaft before moving up the support beam to the top. Eric kicked the rope and the skeleton moved again.

"It's just a trick." said Eric. They continued on and found some gears constantly knocking a piece of metal against a stone that made the sound Eric mistook for picks earlier.

After a while the tunnel ended at a large cavern with a glow shining from it. As they entered the room a voice called out.

"What took you so long?" asked Tempest. As Eric advanced he saw Tempest sitting in front of a campfire. He wore a cloak with a hood that was big enough to hide his features. Eric could see that he no longer wore the armor with the enforcer emblem and was bare chested under the cloak His great sword was resting against a pile of crates next to him while it's scabbard was in his left hand. After they returned to the army. Tempest visited the armory to find a replacement weapon. None of the warhammers could match the craftsmanship of the dwarven hammer he lost at Arcania so he settled on a finely made great sword that was similar in length to The Eye Of The Hurricane.

"A fake haunted mine. You really out did yourself. Was it ever haunted?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"No, A rogue mage caused the accident and set the tricks you saw. He planned to buy it cheap then make a killing selling the silver but I beat him to it. After I found him I made him a deal. Leave town and never return then I'll let him keep his head. He found the deal more than reasonable." replied Tempest.

"I'm sure he did. Can you please tell us what is going on? The enforcers say that you stole a relic and that you murdered two of them." said Lord Silvermore.

"That's not the way I remembered it." said Tempest.

"Then tell us what did happen." said Lord Silvermore.

"After I arrived at the Enforcer Headquarters I began to investigate why they weren't responding to my requests for aid. I discovered that all the murdered dragons were supporters of the High dragon lord and that they fought to keep the peace between humans and dragons. I also found a list of names of several knights and in which order they belonged. I don't know knights as well as you so I'm hoping you'll take a look at it. I also overheard some enforcers talking but was unable to discover their identities. They were planning to hand the Tome of the First Necromancer to Irzac. I convinced two other enforcers of the danger and we set off to retrieve the Tome for safekeeping. After we retrieved the Tome the corrupt enforcers showed up. The other two volunteered to keep them back while I run with the tome. I've been on the run ever since." said Tempest.

"How did you convince them to help you?" asked Eric.

"I've been friends with them for a long time. They too encountered difficulties and were suspicious of our superiors and the order." replied Tempest.

Suddenly they heard the same evil laugh echo through the tunnels as when they first entered the mine.

"Do you have anyone waiting outside for you?" asked Tempest.

"No." replied Eric.

"Then prepare yourself. We're about to have some uninvited guests." said Tempest.

They drew their weapons and a few minutes later Frostbite and five other enforcers entered the cavern.

"I knew following you two would bear fruit. How have you been, Tempest?" said Frostbite.

"Frostbite! You are being deceived by your superiors. Tempest did not commit the crimes he's being accused off!" said Lord Silvermore.

"For what it's worth. I believe you. But I'm afraid that won't save you." said Frostbite.

"Tell me Frostbite. What is an enforcer's loyalty worth these days?" asked Tempest.

"You think I'm doing this for money? Dragons and dragon-kin are being wiped out by humans and what does the Dragon lord do? He protects human kind and keeps us from defending ourselves. Irzac is willing to fight for our survival so we follow him willingly." replied Frostbite.

"Irzac doesn't care about dragons or dragon-kin! He's killed them so he can gain more power or have you forgotten about Azurite and Granite? They gave their lives to keep this book out of his hands!" said Tempest.

"They and the murdered dragons are traitors who sold out their own race to the humans. Don't make the same mistake they did." said Frostbite.

"You are the only traitor here!" answered Tempest.

"Give me the book and I'll spare you and your friends." said Frostbite.

"Come and take it. If you can." said Tempest.

"So be it! KILL THEM!!" yelled Frostbite.

The other enforcers drew their weapons and charged at their group while Frostbite stayed behind and watched. Eric dodged the blow from the enforcer in front of him then struck at him with his sword. The enforcer raised his shield and blocked his strike before bashing his sword out of his hand. Eric rolled backwards then held out his hand towards his sword. It then disappeared and reappeared back in his hand. Lord Silvermore had told him that since his sword is a part of his body then it can never really be removed. So he taught Eric how to recall the sword to him if he's ever disarmed. The move caught the enforcer by surprise and Eric was able to slip past his guard and stab him through the chest. Eric then threw his sword at another enforcer who's back was turned to him. As the enforcer went down on one knee Lord Silvermore beheaded him. They then advanced toward Tempest who was dueling the other three enforcers. One was directly in front of Tempest while the other two were trying to get around him to strike at his left and right flank. Eric charged at the one to the left but he heard him and turned to face him. He swung an axe at Eric's head and Eric ducked under the blow. They dueled for a few minutes before Eric finished him by stabbing his knee then slashing his throat. As Eric finished him he saw the other two fall to Tempest and Lord Silvermore as well.

"Must I do EVERYTHING myself!!" yelled Frostbite. He then drew his halberd and stepped forward.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: It isn't haunted

choices: They try to sneak in by themselves
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
Eric was about to take a step towards Frostbite when Tempest blocked him with his sword.

"He's Mine." said Tempest. Tempest steps forward and spins his sword by his side before taking a battle ready stance. The two then charge at each other. As they close on each other Frostbite swings his weapon at Tempest but he rolls under the halberd and behind Frostbite. Tempest then twist around and stabs at his opponent's exposed back but he deflects the strike with the pole of his weapon before swinging downward at Tempest who rolled backwards to avoid the strike . Tempest then rose to his full height and drew a half circle with the blade of his sword. They continued to duel for the next few minutes but neither was able to wound his opponent. Finally they charged at each other again and once they were close they both struck at each other. Frostbite underestimated Tempest's speed and his blow missed but Tempest managed to strike him across the belly and once he rushed past Tempest twisted around and slashed him across the back, between his wings. Frostbite cried out and fell forward and hit the ground.

Tempest then slowly walked towards him then kicked him in the side to tip him over so that he faces him.

"You ... think you've won?" asked Frostbite.

"I'm still standing while you're lying in a pool of blood, so I think so." replied Tempest.

"I sent a message to the other enforcers before coming here. In less that a day the area will be swarming with enforcers and they will hunt you and your friends down like animals. I ... still ... win." said Frostbite. He then closed his eyes and breathed his last. Tempest walked back to the campfire and threw his sword down on the ground before sitting with his back against the crates.

"You did what you had to." said Lord Silvermore.

"That's eight enforcers who have died now because of my actions." said Tempest.

"No! Irzac is responsible for this, not you. Don't blame yourself for this!" said Eric.

"Frostbite is right, you know." said Tempest.

"About what?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"About dragons and dragon-kin being wiped out. You don't really see it since you spend so much time among humans but I do. Our two races can no longer endure the losses. If something doesn't change then in a few decades there might be no more dragons or dragon-kin left. I can't blame them for wanting to defend themselves. If I didn't know what Irzac really is then it might have been me lying there." replied Tempest.

"Waging war with humans isn't going to change their minds about us. We have to show them we're not the monsters they think we are." said Lord Silvermore.

"I don't think humans can change their minds. Once they have accepted something. Then nothing can change their opinions." said Tempest.

"They can. I've had success with this. You mustn't give up hope." said Lord Silvermore.

" 'sigh'. You're right. You should have a look at that list I found. Then we need to put as much distance between us and this place." said Tempest. Tempest handed the list to Lord Silvermore while Eric began to check though the supplies so that they can decide what to bring with them.

"I know most of these knights. I trained them myself. Where did they get these?" said Lord Silvermore.

"They found the shields of the knights on that list at the attacks sites." said Tempest.

"That can't be right. These people would never attack an innocent dragon. I've trusted them for many years." said Lord Silvermore.

"I think someone might be trying to make you look bad. I don't think the council will be pleased with you if they find out your knights are killing dragons." said Tempest.

"We have to prove them otherwise." said Eric.

"I agree. I suggest we start at the Order of the Sacred Guardians. Their shields were found at the latest site." said Tempest.

"What do you have in mind?" asked Eric.

"We need to prove that the knights were elsewhere when the attack took place. Each order keeps a log of what assignments their members are assigned to as well as at what time so we need that log book. We also need to look into those shields. I doubt someone stole the shields as that would attract the order's attention so we need to find out who supplies their equipment. He might be able to tell us who's been ordering those shields." explained Tempest.

"The order's chapter house is in Sanctuary. How are we going to get there? The guards will be looking for us if the enforcers were there already." said Lord Silvermore.

"Can't we use illusions to hide our appearance?" asked Eric.

"Won't work. You might be able to fool the guards but the enforcers and mages will sense you immediately." said Tempest.

"Maybe we should contact Princess Annabella. I'm sure she can help." said Eric.

"I'd prefer if we didn't involve the royal family. If the enforcers find out they helped us then it could cause trouble for the entire kingdom. I have a contact that might be able to sneak us in and out of the city but we'll have to go to the dwarven realms to meet him." said Tempest.

"It's too far. If we take too long then the evidence might be erased by the time we get too it." said Eric.

"What do you think, old friend?" asked Tempest.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: Tempest duels Frostbite

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"I'm sorry son but I agree with Tempest. It's too dangerous to involve the royal family" said Lord Silvermore.

"Fair enough. So who's this contact of yours?"

"A dwarven merchant who used to sell dwarven goods to Sanctuary back when there was still trade. He also smuggled things into the city for a fee. Sometimes goods, other times people." said Tempest.

"I thought you said that there is no more trade between dwarves and humans." said Eric.

"It recently started up again and I heard he's back in business. I just hope he reopened his 'ferrying' service as well." said Tempest.

They then gathered their things and set off. Normally it wouldn't have taken them that long to bet there, but they often had to take long detours to avoid the patrols. The patrols were led by mages and more that once they saw a large group traveling with an enforcer. Once they got close to Sanctuary they abandoned the roads completely and Tempest led them into the mountains. There were no roads to follow and the path was extremely hazardous. There were also no signs of life so Eric began to wonder if they hadn't become lost. But after a few days Tempest told them that they were close to the outpost. When Eric saw the outpost he was disappointed. It was basically just a few fields and small stone houses outside a large stone door in the side of a mountain.

"I thought it would be bigger. This is small even by village standards." said Eric.

"You're only seeing the outskirts, Eric. Most of the outpost is underground. Now that we are here we need to work on our cover. I've done some mercenary work here so the guards will know me. If anyone asks. You and Silvermore are former knights who grew displeased with your superiors and decided to make a living as sell swords. We have been working together for several years and I brought you here looking for work." said Tempest.

Eric nodded his head and they began to walk towards the gates. As they got closer Eric saw two dwarven guards in heavy plate armor standing on either side of the gate. They both wielded large battleaxes. As they approached one of the guards got a shocked look on his face.

"Tempest?! You're still alive! I thought someone killed you years ago." said the guard.

"Come on! You know I'm not that easy to kill." said Tempest.

"Fair enough! I should have known better. What brings you back here and who are your companions?" asked the guard.

"These are two are with my mercenary group. We've been working together for some time." replied Tempest.

"I thought you preferred to work alone." said the guard.

"I do, but people don't want to hire single mercenaries anymore. They prefer to hire larger groups which they can hire for less so I had to adapt." said Tempest.

"We live in dangerous times, friend and people have to cut costs where they can." said the guard.

"True, do you know if Brunor Ironhammer is here?" asked Tempest.

"Brunor? He has a store in the Merchant Quarter. Brunor's Imports, you can't miss it. You're timing is perfect. I hear he's planning a trip to Sanctuary, so he'll be hiring guards for the trip." said the guard.

"Then I'd better go see him. May we pass?" said Tempest.

"Of course. Just make sure you're companions don't start trouble." said the guard.

"They won't." said Tempest. The guard opened the doors for them and Eric was surprised how many people were inside. The streets were full of both humans and dwarves wandering from one place to another. Occasionally a merchant would call out his wares to people to try to get them to browse his stock. They arrived at the store but Brunor wasn't there. The shopkeeper said that he went to his warehouse to load the wagons for his business trip. They asked him for directions to the warehouse then traveled to the western portion of the city. The warehouse was located close to the western gate. The gate led into tunnels that traveled all the way to Sanctuary. As they entered the warehouse they saw a black bearded dwarf who was busy directing a group of other dwarves how to load the crates on the wagon.

"Brunor!! Good to see you again!" called Tempest.

"Tempest! What are you doing here? If you want to sign on as a guard then I'm afraid you're too late. I've already hired guards for the trip." said the black bearded dwarf.

"That's not necessary, I actually have a proposal for you." said Tempest.

"You don't look like the kind that wants to ship goods." said Brunor.

"That depends on the goods. We need to get into Sanctuary quietly." said Tempest.

"I have no idea what your talking about. I'm an honest business man. But favors like that would have been expensive." said Brunor.

"Would this have been enough if you did such a favor?" asked Tempest. He held out a bag of gold coins to Brunor, which he took and began to examine. Brunor considered the offer before speaking up again.

"I can get you three in and out of Sanctuary but I'm only staying for a day so you better finish your business before then or you'll have to find another way out. If you get caught then we've never met, understand?" said Brunor.

"Of course. When do you leave?" asked Tempest.

"First thing tomorrow morning." said Brunor.

"Good that will give me some time to prepare." said Tempest.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: They use Tempest's contact

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
The next morning they return to the warehouse where Brunor was already waiting. The wagon had been fully loaded with crates. Eric saw that the underpart of the wagon was thicker that the ones he had seen on human ones.

"So where do we hide? Among the crates?" asked Eric.

"No! The guards will find you immediately. hide in here." said Brunor. He pushed a piece of wood at the back of the wagon and a compartment opened under the wagon. It was very low and was barely wide enough for all three of them. They carefully crawled into the compartment and once they settled in Brunor closed the compartment and sealed them in complete darkness.

Ow! Eric get off my wing!" said Tempest.

"Sorry!" said Eric. He raised himself higher so that Tempest can pull out his wing but bumped his head on the roof of the compartment. Once Tempest pulled his wing out from under him, they settled down again.

"You'll have to keep quiet or the guards in Sanctuary will hear you." said Brunor.

"You try settling into a coffin with three people for a few hours!" yelled Tempest.

Eric soon felt the wagon beginning to move. Eric remained awake for some time but after a while he began to dose off. The constant rocking of the wagon and the pitch darkness didn't help either and soon Eric fell asleep.

Loud voices woke Eric. He briefly forgot where he was and bumped his head on the roof again.

"OW!!" said Eric.

"Quiet! or the guards will hear you." whispered Lord Silvermore. He quieted down and Eric soon heard guards talking outside.

"Brunor! What did you bring for us today?" asked a guard.

"Nothing but the finest dwarven goods and a few barrels of fine dwarven ale for the royal family." replied Brunor.

"Good! The king has been asking everyday about the shipment. He's run out of stock and your ale is very popular with the foreign dignitaries." said the guard.

"Of course! You know my people only makes the best." said Brunor.

"All right. Everything looks in order. You may proceed." said the guard. The wagon soon started moving again and Eric could hear the townspeople outside. Soon Eric heard two warehouse doors being opened and a short while later the wagon stopped. They heard people unloading the wagon and once they stopped and left Brunor opened the secret compartment for them.

"It's about time! My wings were starting to get cramps." said Tempest. He stretched out and spread his wings to work out the stiffness.

"How long have we been in there?" asked Eric.

"A few hours. Its a little after noon now." said Brunor.

"We can't risk traveling in the city during the day. We'll wait until nightfall, then go into the city." said Tempest.

"Fine, just be sure you're back here by morning. I'm not going to wait for you." said Brunor.

They sat and waited for nightfall. When it arrived they carefully left the warehouse and walked through the streets towards the order's chapter house. They avoided everyone else they saw in the streets. When they arrived at the chapter house they hid behind a corner of a house and examined it. Eric knew that every order had a chapter house where their members can rest and store their equipment away from the common soldiers. A tall stone wall surrounded the chapter house and Eric saw a reinforced wooden door where two knights were standing guard. They moved around the guards and ran to the wall. Once they reached it they climbed it and looked inside the compound. The chapter house had its own stables, armory, mess hall, chapel, healer's tent and training yards. Despite the late hours several knights were still walking around inside the compound.

"Where is the grand master's office?" asked Eric.

"Should be that one over there." replied Lord Silvermore. He pointed to a small house at the back of the compound. A staircase led up the side of the house to the second floor where Eric guessed the grand master met his guests. They carefully made their way through the camp until they reached the staircase. Tempest picked the lock and they entered the small study. A desk with writing materials was placed in front of the only window in the room. two chairs were placed opposite the desk where visitors can sit and up against the one wall was several bookshelves where several logs and journals were stored. Tempest walked to the desk and lighted a single candle.

"We made it. What now?" asked Eric.

"Look for anything that might help us. Lists of assignments, equipment logs, field reports from members, suppliers. Anything that can prove the knights on the list was elsewhere when the attacks took place and how the shields could be found at the site." replied Tempest.

Eric took a pile of documents and began to read through them. Tempest placed the list of names on the desk and Eric checked it regularly to see if any of the names matched the logs. Most of them were useless but occasionally they found something that could help them. The logs that might prove useful they placed on a pile on the desk while the others they returned to the shelves. After about a hour they went through all the shelves.

"All right. I think that is all we'll be able to use. We should leave before we're caught." said Lord Silvermore. At that moment they heard someone climbing the stairs.

"Quick! Out the window!" whispered Tempest.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: They reach Sanctuary safely

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
Lord Silvermore grabbed the logs and they all jumped out of the window. They then rushed to the nearest wall and climbed over. Eric saw a patrol of guardsmen standing in the street talking to each other. A red scaled enforcer was nearby and seemed to be leading the patrol.

"We'll go one at a time. Run for that alley over there. Silvermore, you go first." said Tempest. He waited until the guard's backs were turned, then he rushed to the alley. After he reached it, he turned around and gestured for them to follow. Eric rushed ahead and just as he reached the alley he heard someone shout.

"HEY YOU! Stop right there!" Eric stopped and turned around but he saw the guards weren't talking to him. They had Tempest surrounded and the enforcer was standing opposite Tempest. Eric was just about to draw his sword and rush to Tempest, when his father grabbed his shoulder and pulled him back.

"No! You'll get us all captured!" whispered Lord Silvermore. He leaned closer and began to listen to the conversation.

"You're making a mistake, Infernus." said Tempest.

"Save it for your trial, traitor." replied the enforcer.

"There won't be a trial. Just an execution." said Tempest.

"Everyone gets a trial. Even scum like you, now you can either surrender and go to your trial with honor or I can beat you black and blue and drag you to it." said Infernus. Tempest stared at each of the guards, then held out his sword in front of him and dropped it on the ground.

"Very wise. Sergeant! Bind his hands and take him to the dungeon. I'll call for transport so we can take this traitor to where he belongs!" The Sergeant shackled Tempest's hands and escorted him to the dungeons while Infernus walked towards the castle.

"What do we do? We can't just leave him there!" said Eric.

"Of course not! But we'll need a plan if we're to succeed." replied Lord Silvermore.

"I think I have a plan that could work. Follow me" said Eric. They left the area and collected some rope, after they found it they looked through the streets before they found two guardsmen patrolling the streets. They ran ahead and Lord Silvermore ran into an alley while Eric waited for the patrol to arrive. After a while they appeared and Eric called out to them.

"Help! There's a body in there!" yelled Eric.

"What? Where?" asked the guard.

"It's in the alley! Follow me!" yelled Eric. He turned around and ran into the alley.

"Wait!" called the guards and ran after him. Eric went around a corner where Lord Silvermore was lying on the floor. The guards carefully approached him and inspected him. Lord Silvermore quickly grabbed one of the guards and hit him in the face, which knocked him out. The other guard stepped back and was about to draw his weapon when Eric grabbed him from behind and slammed his head into the wall. They removed the guard's uniforms, then bound and gagged them. Eric altered his appearance so that it looked like he wore a simple black shirt and trousers. Then he put on one of the guard's armor over the clothing. They then used a illusion to make their faces appear differently.

"I still don't think this is going to work. Mages and enforcers will sense the illusion." said Lord Silvermore.

"I know, but the guards won't and if we go in there unaltered then they might recognize us anyway." replied Eric.

"Then we'd better hope Infernus isn't at the dungeon." said Lord Silvermore.

They then ran through the streets until they reached the dungeon. As they entered the dungeon they saw a lone guard sitting at a table. He was very young and Eric didn't think that he has served with the city guard for long. As he saw Lord Silvermore's sergeant uniform he jumped to his feet and stood at attention.

"Sergeant! Sir!" called the guard.

"At ease guardsman." said Lord Silvermore. The guardsman then began to relax.

"What can I do for you, sir?" asked the guardsman.

"We're here to check on the dragon-kin prisoner." said Lord Silvermore.

"Be careful with him, sir. He's been staring at me like I'm a piece of raw meat every time I walk past." said the guardsman.

"Then perhaps you should feed him." said Eric.

"That's what I told the warden, but he insists on keeping the prisoners half starved. He said it keeps them weak and helps during their interrogations. That might work on humans but I don't think it's wise to starve a dragon-man." said the guardsman.

"Well he won't be a problem for long." said Eric.

"I'll sleep better when he's gone. His cell is the last one on the left. Just follow the corridor." said the guardsman. Eric and Lord Silvermore started walking down the corridor. At the first door to the left Eric saw a armory where they stored the prisoner's belongings. Eric saw Tempest's sword leaning on a nearby wall. The corridor went straight for a few cells then stopped and continued to the right. Lord Silvermore approached the cell where Tempest was locked up with the keys.

"What are you doing!!" called a voice. Eric turned around and saw a man in leather armor standing behind them. He had a club in his hand and a ring of keys on his belt. Eric guessed that it must be the warden.

"Prisoner transfer. Infernus told us we must take him to a more secure location." said Lord Silvermore.

"I'm the warden! Why wasn't I told about this?!" said the warden.

"He didn't say, sir. I assumed that you were already told." said Lord Silvermore.

The warden stared at them suspiciously and Eric became concerned that he didn't believe them.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: Tempest gets captured

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Damned Lizards! Walking around thinking they own the place!" said the warden.

"Yes sir!" said Eric.

"Well, tell our new 'king' that I run this dungeon! I don't care if King Jerrod licks his boots clean! In this dungeon he answers to me!" said the warden.

"Yes Sir!" said Eric.

"Well! What are you waiting for? Get this prisoner out of my sight!" said the warden.

Eric and Lord Silvermore unlocked the cell door and took up positions behind Tempest.

"Move!" said Lord Silvermore. He gave Tempest a shove from behind and they began walking down the corridor. After a minute they reached the end of the corridor.

"Wait here." said Eric. He ran into the armory and retrieved Tempest's sword for him. They were just about to enter the main room when they heard Infernus talking to the guard at the front. Eric peeked through a gap in the door and saw Infernus standing in the room with two guards.

"Great!" said Eric.

"I hope you have a plan B." said Tempest.

"Of course!" said Eric.

"You have no plan, do you?" asked Tempest.

"I'm working on it. said Eric.

"I think I have one. Hide in the armory, quickly!" said Tempest. They ducked into the armory and waited until Infernus walked past.

"Remove my shackles and follow my lead." said Tempest. They did as he asked and Tempest altered his appearance. He remained a dragon-kin but his scales turned red and his features changed until he resembled Infernus. He then stormed into the room.

"Soldier! Raise the alarm! The prisoner has escaped!" said Tempest.

"Yes sir!" said the guardsman.

"I'll go get reinforcements. Lock this place down. No one gets in or out until I return. You two! Come with me!" said Tempest. He pointed to Eric and Silvermore. They joined him and all three of them walked out of the dungeon. Once they were far enough away they ran back to the warehouse where Brunor had his wagon.

"I wish I could see Infernus's face when he notices we escaped." said Tempest.

"If we don't hurry, then you might get your wish. It's morning already." said Lord Silvermore.

"Then we'd better hope Brunor is still there." said Eric.

Eric and Lord Silvermore took off the guard's armor that they were wearing and removed the illusions that disguised their features.

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Where have you been!! I was just about to leave without you!" yelled Brunor.

"Sorry, friend. we were delayed." said Tempest.

"Well stop delaying and get in the compartment! Time's wasting!" said Brunor. They walked to the wagon, which had been loaded with the goods Brunor had bought during the day. Then crawled into the compartment again. Brunor then sealed it and began the journey back home. As they traveled through the city. Eric heard the sounds of heavily armored men rushing past.

"I hope they don't stop us at the gates." thought Eric. After a while Eric felt the wagon stopping and he heard Brunor talking.

"What's going on, friend?!" asked Brunor.

"A prisoner escaped the dungeon. but don't worry about it. You can go." said a guard.

"Not so fast. What are you carrying there?" asked Infernus.

"Just some metalwork and some fine cloth." said Brunor.

"Is that so? Then you won't mind if we have a peek. Search the crates!" said Infernus. Eric could hear guards climbing on the wagon and opening the crates.

"How dare you!! I am a member of the dwarven merchants guild!!" said Brunor.

"I don't care! You're not leaving until we're sure your not carrying something else!" said Infernus.

"Everything looks fine, sir!" called a guardsman.

"My king will hear of this insult!! Expect a strongly worded reply back from him!" said Brunor.

"Proceed carefully!" said Infernus. Eric soon felt the wagon moving again.

"Glorified rock lizard!!" mumbled Brunor once he was out of earshot. After a few hours they were back at the dwarven outpost and Brunor let them out of the compartment.

"Do you mind telling me what that was about?!" asked Brunor.

"It's safer for you if you didn't know." said Tempest.

"Very well, but you're in bigger trouble if you have enforcers on your tail." said Brunor.

"I know. I'll be careful. Thank you for your help." said Tempest.

"No problem. Take care of yourself, friend." said Brunor.

"You too." replied Tempest. They then parted ways with Brunor and made their way to a local inn. They rented a room and had a midday meal. After they finished eating they returned to their room, where they began to go over the evidence they found.

"Let's hope it was worth it." said Eric.

"Silvermore you go first." said Tempest.

"It is as we suspected. The knights were elsewhere when the attacks took place." said Lord Silvermore.

"Do you have proof?" asked Tempest.

"I have field reports from those knights. I also have healers notes as two of the knights were off duty with injuries at the time. One also died shortly before the attack. So unless he became undead, there's no way he could be involved" said Lord Silvermore.

"Excellent! What about you, Eric?" asked Tempest.

"I wasn't as lucky. I found some inventory lists. As far as I can tell, they didn't order an abnormally large amount of shields nor did any mysteriously vanish. So those shields couldn't have come from the order. But I have no idea where any of those shield came from." said Eric.

"I found out who supplies the order with their armor and shields. It's a dwarf named Bromril Stoneheart. He has a forge here at the outpost. He might be able to tell us where those shields came from" said Tempest.

"What can you tell us about him." asked Eric.

"He's as greedy as they come. I'm not surprised that he's involved with this. He has no honor, He'd sell them out in a heartbeat if it's advantageous to him." said Tempest.

"Can we buy the information from him?" asked Eric.

"He'll tell us something for a price. But he'll keep just as much a secret from us, maybe even more. Despite the name 'Stoneheart' he is a coward. If I press on him hard enough then he'll crack." said Tempest.

"I'd prefer that we not rely on torture to get what we want." said Lord Silvermore.

"I won't do him any permanent damage. He'll crack before that." said Tempest.

"And if he doesn't?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Then I'll do what I have to. As a enforcer should do." replied Tempest

"What do you think, Eric?" asked Lord Silvermore.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: Brunor is still there

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"I don't like it any more than you do, but I agree with Tempest. This is the only way to get the whole truth." said Eric.

"Fine, then lets get this over with." said Lord Silvermore. They made their way through the streets until they reached Bromril's workshop. It was a large building, his house was attached to it but next to it was a large side building that acted as both his store and his workshop. Smoke came out of a large chimney at the back, which indicated that Bromril was in his workshop. They opened the door and walked into the shop. Several shields and armor was hanging on racks around the shop. A dwarf was standing behind a counter. a door behind the counter led into the backroom where the armor is made.

"Welcome to Bromril's Armory. It's not often we get dragon-kin customers so I have no armor for sale that can fit you. But after a few measurements my master will be able to forge you a custom suit." said the dwarf.

"I would like to have a talk with your master." said Tempest.

"I'm afraid that's not possible. He's much too busy." said the dwarf. Tempest grabbed the front of the dwarf's shirt and slammed his head into the counter.

"I wasn't asking. Eric, lock the door." said Tempest. Eric took the keys from the dwarf and locked the front door, they then locked the dwarf in a old storage room and entered the forge. They saw a dwarf standing at the forge busy banging out a new shield.

"Hello Bromril." said Tempest. The dwarf spun around with a startled look on his face.

"Who are you?! What are you doing in my workshop?!" said Bromril.

"You've been naughty and I'm here to punish you." said Tempest.

"I don't know what you mean." said Bromril.

"Ohh, then let me remind you. You've sold some order's shields to someone you're not supposed to. They caused a great deal of harm with it. The priests say that confession is the first step to forgiveness so start talking. Who did you sell those shields too?!" said Tempest.

"I ... I have no idea what you're talking about! Now leave before I call the guards!" said Bromril. He tried to walk past them towards the front of the store but as he walked past Tempest he grabbed the back of Bromril's shirt and threw him back against the forge. As Bromril got too his feet again Tempest grabbed him and held his face close to the fire.

"YOU'RE GREED HAS DRAGONS AND HUMANS ALMOST AT EACH OTHER'S THROATS AGAIN!!! TALK!! OR I"LL ROAST YOU ALIVE!!" yelled Tempest.

"Wait ... please!! I'll talk! Two dragon-kin came to my store a few months ago asking for those shields. They asked me to deliver them to a warehouse in Firamore. The details are in my sales ledger over there." said Bromril.

"WHAT WERE THEIR NAMES!!!" yelled Tempest.

"They didn't give me any names. You have to believe me!" said Bromril.

"I do. We'll be taking that ledger. Any Objections?" said Tempest. Bromril shook his head.

"Good! Now listen well! If you tell anyone about our talk or deal with these people again, then I'll come back and tear you limb from limb! Do you understand?!" said Tempest.

"You have my word. No one will hear of this discussion." said Bromril. Tempest then slammed Bromril's head into the anvil, breaking Bromril's nose.

"Ahh! What was that for!!" asked Bromril.

"To make sure you don't forget!" said Tempest. Tempest then took the ledger and walked out of the store. Eric and Lord Silvermore followed close behind. After they left the store they gathered together in the street.

"That was extreme, even for you. Was that really necessary?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Don't you dare judge me!! You have no idea what I've been through these past few weeks! I sacrificed decades of my life trying to uphold the peace and with one deal that ... scum ... undermined all my work. He deserved far more than he got." said Tempest.

"I know you're angry but you have to control it. You know dragon-rage only leads to madness and death." said Lord Silvermore. Tempest closed his eyes and took a few deep breaths to try and calm down.

"You're right. I let my temper get the best of me." said Tempest.

"For a minute I thought you were going to kill him even after he confessed." said Eric.

"The thought did cross my mind." said Tempest.

"At least we have the info." said Eric.

"Not as much as I hoped though. We can clear the order's name but we still have nothing that ties Irzac or the enforcers to the crime." said Tempest.

"So, what now?" asked Eric.

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Now we do what I hoped we didn't have to. We break into the enforcer fortress." said Tempest.

"Have you lost your mind!! You can't go there." said Eric.

"What other choice to we have?" asked Tempest.

"Surely there must be others. What about the warehouse in Firamore Bromril mentioned?" said Eric.

"That delivery was a long time ago. Any evidence that might have been there is long gone." said Tempest.

"Perhaps but going to the enforcer fortress is suicide." said Eric.

"I still know a few enforcers I can trust. Maybe one of them can help us get in." said Tempest.

"What do you hope to find there anyway?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Someone with rank is using the enforcer's resources to help Irzac. Hopefully something there can tell us who and what their next plan is." said Tempest.

"Or you might find nothing. Irzac has been careful. What makes you think anything's changed?" said Lord Silvermore.

"I don't. But what other choice to we have? We have no other leads. Besides, Irzac's agents won't expect us to do anything this risky." said Tempest.

"For good reason!" said Eric.

"You don't have to go with me if you don't want to." said Tempest.

"I'm coming with you. Someone has to save your tail when your crazy plan goes wrong." said Eric.

"Then lets get our things. We have a long journey ahead." said Tempest.

They collected their things from their room at the inn and left the dwarven outpost. after they put enough distance between them and the outpost, Eric and Lord Silvermore changed to dragon form and they all flew to the Enforcer fortress. The journey would normally take then weeks if they traveled on foot but because flying was the fastest way they managed to reach the mountains where the fortress was constructed in 3 days. When they saw the mountains Tempest told them that the enforcers have lookout towers on the mountains to watch for flying enemies so they landed and proceeded on foot. After another day of hiking through the wilderness they saw the fortress. It was built on the top of the mountain and Eric saw no path to the top. The walls were also far larger than normal.

"I hope this friend of yours can help because I don't see how we're getting in without an army." said Eric.

"Not even an army can take the fortress. How would they reach the top? This location was chosen because you need wings to reach it, Eric." said Tempest.

"Then how are we going to sneak in?" asked Eric.

"There might not be a path to the fortress over the mountains but there is a path through the mountains. The entrance can only be opened from the inside though." said Tempest.

"So in order to use the entrance to sneak into the fortress, we first need to sneak into the fortress?" said Eric.

"Normally yes. But this is where my friend comes in. He's agreed to wait for us at the entrance." said Tempest.

"Are you sure you can trust this friend?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"He and I have been through a lot. So yes, I think we can." said Tempest. They make their way to the side of the cliff. Tempest picks up a stone and walks to the cliff wall. He knocks an unknown melody against the wall with the stone and a short while later the wall begins to move. Eric moves closer to see what awaits them at the entrance.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: They break into the enforcer HQ

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
Eric breathed a sigh of relief when the wall moved away and revealed a single dragon-kin waiting for them. The dragon-kin had pitch black scales just like Eric in his dragon form. He had the same enforcer armor as Eric had seen before, but his armor was painted black. The Enforcer crest was painted purple. His pupils were purple as well. Two curved sickles were strapped to his belt. As he saw them he stepped forward and shook Tempest's hand.

"You have no idea how relieved I was when I received your message. I heard you were captured by Infernus and feared the worst." said the dragon-kin.

"I managed to escape thanks to my friends here. It good to see you again Shadow-wing." said Tempest. They entered the tunnels and Eric and Lord Silvermore follow close behind.

"What's the situation here?" asked Tempest.

"There's something going on with the grand master. There's been an abnormally large amount of kill orders of late and the ones that he sends on those missions were a step away from being declared rogues before. But now they are his inner circle, Discussions in a room ends when I enter. Whatever they're planning, its clear I'm not included." said Shadow-wing.

"Do you think Irzac got to him?" asked Tempest.

"I'm sure he did." said Shadow-wing.

"Is the grand master in the fortress?" asked Eric.

"No, he left a few days ago to oversee the security of the conclave." replied Shadow-wing.

"What conclave?" asked Eric.

"Is it that time again? I've forgotten." said Tempest.

"The conclave happens once every year. The high dragon lord calls all his councilors from around the kingdoms and listens to any advise or suggestions that they might have for the coming year. He can then set new laws for the coming year. If they are unhappy with his rule then they can also call on him to step down so a new dragon lord can be chosen." explained Lord Silvermore.

"How do you know all the grand master's comings and goings?" asked Eric.

"I'm a high ranking member so I'm familiar with the inner workings of the order." said Shadow-wing.

"We should search his office as soon as possible." said Tempest.

"I agree. I've cleared the patrols around his office so you shouldn't run into any guards. Just leave everything tidy. If the grand master hears there was a break-in while he was gone, then I'll get in trouble." said Shadow-wing.

"We'll be careful. Thank you, Shadow-wing" said Tempest.

After a few minutes of walking they reached the office. The door was left unlocked for them. They slipped in then Eric closed the door behind them.

"Are you sure you can trust him?" said Eric.

"With my life." said Tempest.

"Do you have something on your mind, son." asked Lord Silvermore.

"I just find it strange that he knows so much. Also the door's unlocked with no guards anywhere. It seems too easy." said Eric.

"We got a lucky break, that's all." said Tempest.

"We don't get lucky breaks." said Eric.

"I know, so it's about time we get one. I've known Shadow-wing for years. Trust me." said Tempest.

"If you say so." said Eric.

They began to search through the office. Eric soon found a stack of papers with names written on it. The papers were stamped with a unknown symbol with some numbers underneath it.

"What's this?" asked Eric.

"Those are kill orders. Those are the names of several of the dragons that were killed. The numbers under the stamp records the time and date that it was stamped." said Tempest.

"Here is the latest one. It was stamped two days ago." said Eric.

"Valor. That's another council member and one of the dragon lord's biggest supporters." said Tempest.

"Here's a letter and another list. I don't recognize the names on it." said Lord Silvermore.

"The names that are scratched out are the dragons that have been murdered. Valor is next and I see there are more after him. The letter says 'Kill the ones on the list. Will provide men if necessary, Irzac'. This is exactly what we need. We can nail Irzac with this." said Tempest.

"Exactly! This is too convenient, Think about it. We couldn't find anything that links him and now its suddenly handed to us on a platter." said Eric.

"Not this again! I can't say anything to make you trust Shadow-wing. But the list does say Valor is the next target. So lets go there. If nothing happens then we know its fake but if Irzac does send someone then the list and letter is real." said Tempest.

"Fine! Then that's what we'll do." said Eric. They took the orders, list and letter with them and snuck through the fortress again until they reached the exit where Shadow-wing was waiting.

"You found what you needed?" asked Shadow-wing.

"We did. Thank you for your help." said Tempest.

"I must ask. Do you still have the First Necromancer's tome?" asked Shadow-wing.

"Of course. Why?" asked Tempest.

Don't you think it's dangerous to keep it with you? If they capture you then Irzac gets the tome. Give it to me. I can hide it where no one will find it." said Shadow-wing.

"I can't do that, I'm sorry." said Tempest.

"Don't you trust me?" asked Shadow-wing.

"It's not a matter of trust. I'll only relax if I keep it. Consider it one of my flaws but I can't expect another to protect it." said Tempest.

"Very well. Take care of yourself, old friend." said Shadow-wing.

"You too." replied Tempest. They then left the area and started traveling to Valor's lair.

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
The lair was far to the south just past Firamore's borders.

Most of their trip was uneventful but after they reached the borders of Firamore. They stopped at a small town. Tempest believed that it's size would mean that there won't be many guards or enforcers. They wanted to find out the latest news of what was happening in the kingdom so they made their way to the tavern. After they entered the tavern they walked to tavern keeper.

"Excuse me, sir." asked Tempest. The tavern keeper then turned to face them.

"How can I help you?" asked the tavern keeper.

"We haven't been in the kingdom for quite sometime. Is there anything we should be aware of?" asked Tempest.

"Well, a great deal has happened lately. Firstly, a large amount of dragon-kin are wandering around the kingdoms. There focus seems to be on the knights though and they have been causing trouble for the royal family. I hope it doesn't lead to another war. It's bad for business." said the tavern keeper.

"I thought war was good for merchants." said Eric.

"For merchants, yes. but not for tavern owners. Fewer travelers on the road during wartime and although soldiers drink they also cause damage while drunk." said the tavern keeper.

"My sympathies then, Anything else?" said Tempest.

"There's been a breakout at the Sanctuary dungeons. The guards are on high alert there but there's been no news of who escaped. I hope it isn't some bandit leader. Princess Annabella also disappeared around that time." said the tavern keeper.

"What!? Was she kidnapped!?" asked Eric.

"That's what I thought at first, but then she showed up here 2 days ago traveling with an older woman. She told me her name but I can't recall what it is. It starts with an 'E'." said the tavern keeper.

"Esmerda?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Yes, That's it. How did you know?" asked the tavern keeper.

"Lucky guess. Did they say why they are here?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"Something about finding two knights. I wouldn't want to be them. She looked furious." said the tavern keeper.

"Thank you for your time." said Tempest. They turned to leave the tavern but at that moment they saw Annabella and Esmerda enter the tavern. As the inn keeper walked towards them Tempest leaned closer and whispered to them.

"We need to leave, NOW." whispered Tempest.

"How?" asked Eric.

"Through the back, quick!" said Tempest. While the inn keeper talked with Annabella. They walked through the door behind the bar and into the kitchen. They avoided the serving people and left through the backdoor that led to an alley next to the tavern. They started walking to the entrance of the alley when Annabella and Esmerda stepped in front of them, blocking their way out.

"Your high..." started Eric. Before he could finish, an strong force pulled him to a wall and pinned him against it. He saw that his companions were pinned as well. Eric tried to move but no matter how hard he struggled he couldn't pull himself away from the wall.

"Princess what are you..." started Eric.

"SILENCE!!!" yelled Annabella. Eric felt a force clamp his mouth shut, preventing him from speaking.

"Do you have any idea in how much trouble you two are in!!! My own bodyguard and my best knight turning rogue and helping a fugitive! I might have accepted that had you come to me and asked for my help! But instead you chose to embarrass me! Have I not proven to you that I can be trusted! What do you have to say for yourself!" asked Annabella.

Eric tried to speak but the magic was still holding his mouth shut.

"Do you have no excuses for yourself?! And what were you thinking breaking into a knight's chapter house and stealing evidence that could clear their names! Do you want the enforcers to declare war? Explain yourself!" yelled Annabella.

"Mmmhhhmmm." mumbled Eric.

"Ohh, sorry." said Annabella. She ended the unintentional spell that kept Eric from speaking but before he could begin, Tempest spoke up.

"Eric wanted to involve you but I told him not to. so if you must be angry then be angry with me, your highness." said Tempest.

"Why were you scared to contact me? Have I not earned your trust?" asked Annabella.

"It isn't about trust. If we told you then you would have come with us. When the enforcers find out they would try to force your father to hand you over, which he would never do. The enforcers could then declare that your kingdom have betrayed the peace treaty and order the other kingdoms to rise up against you. This is exactly what the enforcers would want you to do. I couldn't let you take such a risk. Especially since I wasn't sure if our investigation would find evidence to clear our names." said Tempest.

"I am aware of my responsibilities to the kingdom. I wouldn't endanger my people without thinking it through first." replied Annabella.

"Could you really ignore such an challenge?" asked Tempest.

"Perhaps not, but it wasn't your choice to make." said Annabella.

"Your right. I'm sorry that we kept the details of the threat from you." said Eric.

"Fair enough. We're going to help you with the investigation from now on." said Annabella.

"I still don't think its wise, princess." said Tempest.

"The way I see it, the enforcers declared war the moment they framed our knights. If I want to clear their names then I have to be out there investigating with you." said Annabella.

"You make a good point, princess. Very well, you may accompany us." said Tempest.

"Good! Now that it's settled. Tell us what you found out so far." said Esmerda.

So they told them everything that's happened to them so far. When they finished Annabella and Esmerda thought it through before they spoke up again.

"So you're planning to rescue Valor from these hunters?" asked Annabella.

"Yes. He's a well respected member of the conclave. I'll have a hard time convincing the others, but if he speaks for us then we might stand a chance." said Tempest.

"A good plan but there is great risk. If Valor is already dead then we'll not only lose his support but they can also frame us for his murder." said Esmerda.

"I am aware of the risk but we can't approach the conclave by ourselves. There is another reason I want to get to him. I'm concerned about the fact that the grand master is handling the security of the conclave. If Irzac corrupted him then who knows what he's planning." said Tempest.

"Then we'd better hope Valor is still alive when we get there." said Lord Silvermore.

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Is that the place?" asked Eric. The were on a tall hill and in front of them was a large cave cut into the mountain side. After they met up with Annabella they left the town and Eric, Esmerda and Lord Silvermore took dragon form and flew to the lair while Annabella rode on Eric's back. After a short flight they arrived at the mountains that Tempest said hid Valor's secret lair.

"Yes that's it." said Tempest.

"Strange that he would stay at a place like this. I thought that most influential dragons lived in the cities as humans." said Eric.

"They do. But most keep such hidden lairs where they can get away from pretending to be human for a time. You should know. Despite training Annabella's knights and the fact that I'm a rich and powerful lord, Your mother and I still keep a cave lair occupied. It's also a good place to retreat to if they are ever discovered." said Lord Silvermore.

"I see. Are you sure he's in there though?" asked Eric.

"The enforcers wouldn't send a force here if they weren't certain. Valor also goes on holiday around this time so I'm sure he's there." said Tempest.

At that moment Eric sees a cloud of dust in the distance. Eric tried to see what it was but it was still to far for him to make out clearly. Tempest pulled out a looking glass and looked through it.

"What do you see?" asked Eric.

"Horsemen. And some dragon-kin." replied Tempest. He handed the spyglass to Eric and he looked through it. Eric saw about 15 black armored knights riding towards the cave. 5 enforcers were running beside the horses. Despite being on foot, the enforcers easily kept up with the animals. Eric also saw far more weapons and shields strapped to the horses than needed.

"How many?" asked Annabella.

"15 men and 5 dragon-kin." said Eric.

"So many? Are you sure we can beat them?" asked Annabella.

"I'm not that worried about the knights. Especially since I'm sure Valor will be helping us. But those enforcers could be trouble. Remember, They are accustomed to fighting both knights and dragons. So watch your back in there." said Tempest.

"Let's get going then." said Eric.

They made their way to the cave and by the time they arrived, the enforcer force had already entered the cave. As Eric and the others stepped into the cave, they saw a large gold scaled dragon talking with the enforcers.

"For what reason do you disturb me at my lair and why in such numbers, enforcer?!" asked Valor.

"There's a kill order for you and we're here to make it happen." replied the enforcer.

"A kill order?! that has to be a mistake! I've never done anything to endanger our race! What crime am I being accused of?!" said Valor.

"For choosing the wrong friends." said the enforcer.

"What are you talking about?!" asked Valor.

"I'll be happy to explain it to you, Valor. but first we have to deal with these renegades." said Tempest. The kill squad turned around and the leader stepped forward.

"Ahh! it seems I'm quite lucky today! The renegade and the target all in the same place. Saves me from hunting you down later. You've made my life easier. My report to the dragon lord will say that we heard that you planned to kill Valor but that we arrived too late to save him." said the enforcer.

"Interesting story. Too bad you won't be alive to tell it." said Tempest.

"Just as overconfident as the reports say. KILL THEM!!!" yelled the enforcer.

The two groups drew their weapons and charged at each other. Eric jumped into the air and knocked one of the knights to the ground. Before he could finish him though, another knight tried to stab Eric through with a halberd. Eric dodged the blow, then stabbed the man through the chest. He left his sword in the man and grabbed the halberd. He spun around and struck another knight with the halberd. Eric then sees a enforcer charge at him and Eric lifts his weapon to defend himself. The enforcer slashed right through the shaft of the halberd though, leaving Eric with two useless pieces of wood in his hands. Eric dropped the broken weapon and rolled backwards to avoid another strike, before pulling his sword from the dead body and taking a defensive stance. Before the enforcer could reach him again though, a sword rose in the air and flew at the enforcer and struck him through the head.

Eric turned and saw Esmerda and Annabella fighting back to back against several knights. As Eric rushed towards them, Annabella dodged a sword strike before striking the man in the face with her staff, as the man struggled to regain his balance, she knocked his feet out from under him with her staff, Then stab him in the chest with a sword she picked up from the ground. Another knight charged at her but she raised her hand and the knight's sword glowed red and began to burn the knight's hands, causing him to drop his weapon. She then pointed her staff at the sword and it rose from the ground and impaled it's own wielder. Behind Annabella, Esmerda was dueling two knights at the same time but she quickly dispatched them. Another knight was charging at her but she threw a ice ball at him. As it struck his chest he began to slow down as his body started freezing. He was frozen solid by the time he reached Esmerda and she shattered him with a single blow from her staff. As Eric got closer, he saw a knight raise a crossbow and aim at Annabella. He bent down and picked up a shield from the ground and jumped in front of Annabella. As Eric blocked the bolt, he crouched and Annabella threw a fireball over Eric's shoulder. It struck the knight in the chest and sent him flying backwards into a wall.

They then looked how the others were doing. Lord Silvermore was fighting two enforcers at once. Several human knights were already dead around him. Despite his skill in battle he was struggling to keep the two enforcers at bay. At the back of the cave the remaining knights and enforcers had cornered Valor. The knights were equipped with spears and crossbows so they were able to keep Valor at a distance. Every time he tried to rush them they would force him back and his fire breath was having no effect on his attackers. He was already bleeding from several wounds. Tempest was already rushing towards him but Eric wasn't sure if he would be able to defeat the entire force by himself.
