1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Go! Help Valor! I'll help your father!" yelled Esmerda.

Eric and Annabella then began running towards Valor. As Tempest got closer, one of the soldiers turned and fired his crossbow at him. Tempest tried to dodge it but he moved too slow and the bolt hit him in the shoulder. He roared with rage then continued rushing towards them. As more soldiers turned to fire at him, he went on all fours and jumped at the nearest wall. He then jumped from the wall at one of the soldiers and tackled him. As he landed on his feet again, he grabbed the soldier and threw him at his companions. The other crossbowmen were knocked off their feet and Tempest used the opportunity to close on them. As the spear men began to turn to him, Valor used the distraction to move forward and strike at them with his claws. Eric and Annabella was about to join the fight when the enforcer leader stepped in front of them. Tempest saw the danger and tried to reach them but several knights blocked his path and kept him from coming to their aid.

Eric rushed at the enforcer and struck at him but he easily blocked the blow before counter attacking causing Eric to step back. The enforcer continued to strike at him but Eric managed to block every strike. As Eric slashed at him, the enforcer stepped past his guard and struck at Eric's left arm, causing him to drop his shield. Eric retreated backwards but the enforcer jumped after him. Eric tried to strike back but the enforcer twisted through the air, then hit Eric in the face with the pommel of his sword. As Eric struggled to recover the enforcer kicked him in the chest, knocking him over and causing Eric's sword to fly from his hand. As Eric was lying on the ground dazed the enforcer stepped forward to finish him off. Before he could do so though Annabella threw a lightning bolt at him. The enforcer saw it coming and bent backwards and the bolt flied over him and struck the wall. He then charged at Annabella. She tried to hit him with her staff but he caught it in midair, tore it from her grip and then picked her up by the throat.

As Eric got to his feet again. He grabbed his sword and rushed to the enforcer before he could kill Annabella. He struck at the enforcer's back which caused him to drop Annabella. As he turned to face Eric, Annabella picked up her staff and hit the enforcer on the head with it. While he was dazed Eric stabbed his sword under the enforcer's chin and through his head, killing him. He then took a look around the cave and saw that all the attackers had fallen.

"I have to admit. You were the last person I expected to come to my rescue. I think it's time for you to tell me what's going on." said Valor.

"It will be my pleasure." said Tempest.

Eric was sitting on a large rock while Annabella examined the wound on his arm. Close by Tempest had just finished telling Valor all that had happened. Esmerda was busy inspecting the bolt that was still in Tempest's shoulder. Valor was thinking about all that Tempest had said while Lord Silvermore was pacing around the cave.

"You're lucky it didn't go any deeper." said Annabella. She cast a spell and healed his wound. "There all done."

"Thank you." said Eric. Eric got up from the rock and walked towards Valor.

"So, Irzac is using the enforcers as his personal assassins." said Valor.

"So it would seem." said Tempest.

"This couldn't get any worse! Even if we stop Irzac. The damage is already done." said Valor.

"What do you mean?" asked Eric.

"The enforcers might be disliked but they are also respected. Many knights and dragons are hesitant to break the rules because they fear the enforcers. If news gets out that they have been tainted, then they will lose that respect. Then more dragons like Irzac will rise up and all human kind will hunt dragons, not just the few fanatics that we have now." said Valor.

"Then it's best that people don't find out. I can keep the people in my kingdom from learning of this. Can the council do the same with dragon kind?" asked Annabella.

"It's possible. I'm sure the council wouldn't want this to become common knowledge. But first we'll have to prove to them that Irzac is responsible. Tempest! You'll have to speak to the council and convince them." said Valor.

"ME! I don't think that's wise. The grand master will claim that I'm trying to point the finger at him to save my own hide. It would be .... AHH! what did you do that for?!" said Tempest. As Tempest spoke, Esmerda suddenly grabbed the bolt in his shoulder and yanked it out.

"It needed to be removed before I could heal you and if you were expecting it then it would have hurt more. Stop complaining. It's over now." said Esmerda. She cast a spell and Tempest's wound began to seal itself.

"I can't accuse Irzac since I wasn't the one who found the conspiracy. My knowledge is only second hand. I understand your concern but remember that you have evidence and he does not." said Valor.

"All right. You make a good point. What about the grand master though? He can't be left in charge of security." said Tempest.

"I'll go to the council and tell them that I have evidence of an conspiracy and that security needs to be changed. I'll recommend that they delay the conclave for two weeks. That will undermine Irzac's plans and give the grand master's replacement time to fix the security. Which reminds me. Who do you want to take the grand master's place as head of security? With corruption so high I can't make such an decision without your help." said Valor.

"Shadow-wing. He helped me find the evidence." said Tempest.

"Very well. I'll make the arrangements. In the mean time I suggest that you lay low until the conclave. I own a small wine plantation at the borders of Firamore. It's off the record so even the enforcers don't know that I own it. You'll be safe there and it's closer to the conclave as well." said Valor.

"Sounds good. But be careful! The enforcers might try to kill you again." said Tempest.

"I doubt it. If I'm suddenly murdered then everyone will begin asking questions. But I'll be careful." said Valor.

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
They spent a week at the plantation while Valor forced the council to change the conclave's date and security. He avoided sending any messages to the plantation and didn't come there himself. Valor knew that the enforcers would try to kill Eric and the others before the conclave and he didn't want to lead the enforcers to where they were hiding. Spending the time waiting was extremely boring for them so they spent the time practicing magic or swordsmanship. A later letter arrived from Valor telling them to meet him at Dragon Spire mountain for the conclave. After a day's traveling they arrived at the meeting point where Valor was already waiting.

"Finally! I thought you had forgotten about us." said Eric.

"Sorry to keep you waiting. There was a lot to do here." said Valor.

"Let's get this over with." said Annabella.

"I'm afraid you can't go with us, princess. The council would never allow a human into our secret meetings. Only Eric, Silvermore and Tempest must meet with them." said Valor.

"My kingdom is the one being framed! I have a right to be there and why can't Esmerda go?" said Annabella.

"Only council members are allowed at the conclave. Eric and the others are the ones who discovered the conspiracy so they need to be there to talk to the council. You and Esmerda only joined with them afterwards." said Valor.

"This is preposterous!!" said Annabella.

"I know you're angry, princess. But we must respect their wishes. Think of it this way. If we get in trouble then you will be in a position to come rescue us." said Tempest.

"Fine! But if you're not back in an hour then I'm going in whether the council likes it or not." said Annabella.

"Everything will be fine, princess." said Lord Silvermore.

They walked with Valor towards the mountain while Annabella and Esmerda stayed back at the camp. After a few minutes of walking they arrived at the base of the mountain. In front of them Eric saw a mine entrance. The entrance was large enough for all but the very largest of dragons to enter. Infernus and two other enforcers were standing guarding by the entrance.

"Valor! We've been expecting you did you bri..." started Infernus. The moment they saw Tempest though they fell silent and grasped their weapons. "Watch out Valor! That's a traitor to our order! He's already killed several enforcers!"

"No Infernus! He isn't the traitor. He was framed by the real traitor. The one we are going to expose today." said Valor.

"You have evidence?" asked Infernus.

"Yes, We do and they point right to the grand master." said Tempest.

"That can't be! I've know him for years! He was always an honorable leader." said Infernus.

"There is no doubt. He's the one responsible for the murders of both enforcers and dragons. Tempest stopped the attempt on my life." said Valor. Infernus was silent as he considered the information. Finally he released the grip on his weapon and gestured for the others to do the same.

"Then we will follow your lead." said Infernus. The enforcers took up positions behind them. While Eric and the others entered the tunnels. As they walked to the chambers they saw several enforcers patrolling the tunnels. There were many different paths and the tunnels kept twisting and backtracking. Eric knew that it was for defensive reasons and if he didn't have the others guiding him then he would have gotten hopelessly lost. After a long walk the tunnel finally ended at a massive chamber. Eric couldn't see a lot of the chamber but he could hear voices from inside the chamber. Valor blocked the entrance and turned to them.

"Wait here until I call for you." said Valor. He entered the chamber and Eric heard an unknown dragon call out to Valor.

"Valor! You've arrived! We've been most curious why the changes in security have been necessary. Please explain." said the dragon.

"Forgive me, Dragon-Lord, for the inconvenience it may have caused you. But our security was compromised and some very powerful traitors are about to be exposed today."

"Then speak." said the dragon-lord.

"As you all are aware. Several of our own have been murdered recently. Original reports claimed that it was humans who were hunting us but my sources revealed something far darker. That one of our own is responsible and that our own resources have been used against us. I myself was nearly a victim of this conspiracy. If my sources hadn't found me, then I would not be alive today." said Valor.

"What!? Who is responsible for this and who is your source?" said the dragon-lord.

"I will allow them to explain further, my Lord." said Valor. Eric and the others then entered the chamber and walked to where Valor was standing. Eric saw dragons all around him on both the ground and on a second level. Eric saw Irzac sitting among the other councilors. Everyone was starring at them as they approached. In front of them was a large Silver dragon standing on a raised platform. Eric assumed that he was the dragon-lord. A large dragon-kin with the same colored scales was standing beside him.

"YOU!! Dragon-Lord this dragon-kin is a murdering traitor and these two's love of humankind is well known. They make poor witnesses." said the grand master.

"I don't care about their past. Only the evidence. I will hear them." said the dragon-lord.

"I will begin with the murders. Evidence pointed to the knights but they were innocent in this. I have logs that proved that the knights who supposedly did the attacks were elsewhere when the attacks took place. I also have a logbook from the one who supplies the order's equipment which shows that a large amount of the order's equipment was forged and delivered to someone outside of the order." said Tempest. He handed the logs to a dragon-kin who brought it closer to the dragon-lord so that he can examine it himself.

"I see, so this clears the order's names. Were you able to find out who was responsible for this?" asked the dragon-lord.

"I did. It was the grand master and Irzac!" said Tempest. The entire council gasped and murmured amongst themselves until the dragon-lord was able to silence them.

"Those are very grave accusations. I hope you can back it up." said the dragon-lord.

"Of course. I would never have come before you if I couldn't prove it. I have orders written by Irzac to the grand master telling him who to murder as well as kill orders authorized by the grand master. They have been going after your supporters, my lord. For what reason I haven't been able to determine yet. Valor would have been next and several more would have been killed after him." said Tempest.

"I can confirm that. The force that tried to kill me consisted of both enforcers and the black armored knights that Irzac uses." said Valor. The dragon-lord studied the kill orders closely before speaking again.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: They are not discovered again

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"Something about this isn't right. The kill orders was authorized several months ago except for Valor's one." said the dragon lord.

"That's right. So?" said Tempest.

"Then it couldn't be the grand-master. He requested a leave of absence during that time. I approved it myself." said the dragon lord.

"He requested it but did he actually go?" asked Tempest.

"I can answer that! He was hunting a necromancer who was terrorizing his former tribe. The necromancer was raising the dead of the tribe to build a private army. The grand master hunted him down and destroyed him. I know because the grand master was staying with me and my family during the hunt." said one of the councilors.

"It appears that you are half right, Tempest. There is a traitor among the enforcers but it is not the grand master. Who was placed in charge while you were gone, Grand master?" asked the dragon lord.

"Shadow-wing, Sir!" said the grand master.

"Where is Shadow-wing now?" asked the dragon lord.

"Right here, my lord!" called Shadow-wing.

Eric turned to the direction of the voice and saw Shadow-wing standing at the doorway with several enforcers and many black armored knights. They were all armed with crossbows, which puzzled Eric. Although crossbows could hurt dragons it took several shots to kill one. Crossbow bolts were no more dangerous to Eric in dragon-form that darts were to a human. It took an extremely lucky shot or a skilled marksman to fell a dragon with a single shot. As a result very few dragon slayers used crossbows as their main weapon. Eric couldn't understand why trained professionals would make such a mistake.

"What is the meaning of this!!" asked the dragon lord.

"I can answer that. Our people are tired of having a leader who sits around while the humans are declaring war on our race." said Irzac.

"This isn't the way, Irzac. If this is true then challenge my rule in the old way. If they really have a problem with my rule then they will side with you." said the dragon lord.

"They are too cowardly to do what must be done." said Irzac.

"Or perhaps this is just that YOU want!" said the dragon lord.

"Doesn't matter. I'm leader now and I will tell them what to do." said Irzac.

"You should have given your soldiers better equipment. Crossbows don't frighten me." said the dragon lord.

"These ones will." said Irzac. He signaled Shadow-wing who raised his crossbow to his shoulder and fired a bolt at the dragon lord. The bolt struck his chest, which penetrated his scales but didn't go deep enough to cause serious damage.

"You'll have to do bet..." said the dragon lord. Before he could finish his sentence, he shrieked in pain and fell on his side. Eric saw the dragon-lord's veins begin to expand and turn black. "What ... have you done to me?!" asked the dragon lord.

"Dragon's bane is quite a useful little plant, don't you think? Don't worry. The poison will cause your heart to explode in a minute, so your suffering won't be for much longer." said Irzac. The dragon lord tried to get up but his strength gave out and he fell again and died.

"The dragon lord is dead! Long live Lord Irzac!" called Shadow-wing. Eric took a step towards Shadow-wing but he aimed his crossbow at him.

"Don't think your human form will save you. The poison will still kill you." said Shadow-wing. The enforcers and soldiers surrounded their group and aimed their weapons at them.

"I must thank you, Tempest. This wouldn't have been possible without you. I tried to convince the grand master but he was too stubborn so I found someone more sympathetic." said Irzac.

"How did he get to you, Shadow-wing? Did he tell you honeyed lies about our race's future?" asked Tempest.

"No! nothing so noble. He promised that I would be the leader of the new enforcers. First things first. I think it's time you returned what you stole." said Shadow-wing. He stepped forward and dug through Tempest's bags until he uncovered the tome of the first necromancer. He then walked back towards Irzac's side.

"My plan was to slowly weaken the dragon lord's influence but then you came to Shadow-wing to target the grand master. I couldn't let such an opportunity go too waste." said Irzac.

"Our people will not stand for this, Irzac! They will resist you!" said Lord Silvermore.

"With what leader? The dragon lord is dead and you and the council is at my mercy. It's a pity Annabella isn't here but I'll find her soon enough. You three have been a thorn in my side for sometime. Luckily that thorn will be removed today. Kill Them!!" said Irzac. Shadow-wing and the others raised their crossbows and prepared to fire when Irzac stopped them.

"No! They don't deserve a quick death. Kill them slowly." said Irzac. Shadow-wing smiled and put his crossbow down, then drew his weapons. Irzac's soldiers drew their blades and advanced on them from all sides. Eric, Silvermore and Tempest drew their weapons and stood back to back and prepared to fight. Eric knew that there was no hope of escape or victory but he planned to kill as many as he could before he fell. Before Irzac's men could reach them. Infernus rushed into the chamber with a few enforcers and attacked Irzac's men from behind.

"GO!! We'll cover your escape!" yelled Infernus. Eric and the others ran past towards the tunnels.

"Thank you, Infernus!" said Tempest.

"Just make this right!" yelled Infernus.

"After them! Don't let them escape" yelled Irzac. Eric and the others found complete chaos in the tunnels as enforcer was fighting enforcer. A few times the enforcers would turn and fight them which forced them to fight them off first, which delayed their escape. Without Valor guiding them they also took several wrong turns in the maze like tunnels. They just reached a fork in the tunnels when they heard Irzac's men getting closer to them.

"We can't outrun them!" said Eric.

"Take the path to the left! It leads to the exit. I'll hold them off!" said Tempest.

"You can't defeat them all." said Eric.

"No I can't. But I can hold them back long enough for you to escape and it would only be fair. I caused all this. My fate is here and I will not flee from it." said Tempest.

"Tempest! You can't blame ..." said Lord Silvermore.

"You don't have to say anything. Just promise me you'll make this right. Don't let him destroy our kind." said Tempest.

"I promise." said Lord Silvermore.

"Then go!! RUN!! and don't look back!" said Tempest. He turned around and transferred his sword to his left hand. Once his right hand was clear, he closed his fist and the blade called 'The Eye of the Hurricane" appeared in his hand. He then took a defensive stance and prepared for the enemy attack. Eric didn't want to leave him but he knew that if he stayed then they would all die. So Eric reluctantly ran to the tunnel Tempest had pointed out with Lord Silvermore. After a moment Eric heard the sound of battle echoing behind them. A short while later Eric sees a bright light shining ahead of them.

"Finally! I thought we'd never get out!" thought Eric. Just as he reached the exit he heard a load crash behind him. Eric twisted around and saw that the tunnel had collapsed behind him. Lord Silvermore was staring at the rubble. "The fighting must have weakened the supports." thought Eric. He ran to his father's side and put a hand on his shoulder which drew Lord Silvermore's attention.

"I'm sorry about Tempest but we have to go. We don't know how long it will take Irzac's people to find an way out and if they catch us then Tempest would have died for nothing." said Eric.

"I know." He took one last look at the rubble. "Goodbye, old friend." said Lord Silvermore. They both then turned around and ran back to their camp where Princess Annabella was waiting.
1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.title: the grand master isn't the traitor

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
Eric woke just as the sun began to rise. He sat up straight in the bed he was resting in and thought about what had happened over the last 6 months. After he and Lord Silvermore had returned to their camp and informed Annabella what had happened. They traveled as fast as they could back to Firamore and warned Annabella's father of the danger. He wasn't happy that they went behind his back but accepted that nothing could be done about it now. He then called upon his allies and readied them for war. He placed Lord Silvermore in charge of the resistance forces and ordered him to rally as many as he could to his banner. Dragon Lord Irzac wasn't idle either, after freeing himself from the tunnels at the conclave. He sent enforcers to Arcania and the Enforcer Headquarters. Once they arrived they quickly forced them to swear allegiance to Irzac. Those who refused were executed and soon Irzac had almost the entire dragon-kin race on his side. Next he sent a agent to the necromancers and gave them the tome as promised. The necromancers provided Irzac with some of their spell casters which increased Irzac's forces greatly. Lastly Irzac had his loyalist force the dragons into supporting his war, either with coin or by joining his armies directly.

Silvermore's forces consisted of the knights in Sanctuary and Firamore as well as the elves from the Forest of the Fey. The few enforcers and dragons that managed to avoid Irzac's loyalists also joined them but they were few in number when compared to Irzac's forces. So far neither side had the forces to take out the other side without heavy losses, so they spent most of their time trying to sabotage the relations of their enemy's alliances, while trying to keep a hold of their own allies. Eric went on several such missions. Sometimes alone, other times with other agents like Annabella. It was during one such mission that Eric encountered Shadow-wing again. The mission was a success but Eric failed to kill Shadow-wing and was badly wounded in the fight. The healers tended to his wounds after he returned but they still said that he would need time to recover. They recommended that he stay in bed for several weeks. Eric meanwhile wanted to return to duty immediately. In the end his father supported the healers and confined Eric to bed for the last few weeks, but now the healers finally declared that Eric was fit to return to duty. Eric left the warehouse that served as the improvised healers tent. There were too many wounded for the usual place the healers worked so Annabella's father gave them the warehouse to serve as a unofficial healer's tent. He made his way to the castle, then walked through the halls towards the meeting chambers where the allies met to discuss the war. As Eric entered he saw Lord Silvermore and Annabella's father arguing. Eric kept his distance until they finished but they were talking so loudly Eric was able to hear the conversation.

"You can't treat her like any other agent we have! If anything happens to her then it would affect my entire kingdom!" said Annabella's father.

"It would also affect your kingdom if we lost this war! You know how dire the situation is! We need all the help we can get to win. She's powerful and eager to help. It would be a waste to coddle her." said Lord Silvermore.

"She's a princess! Not a common foot soldier! She has other responsibilities!" said Annabella's father.

"I'm aware of that. But she's also a powerful mage. We have few enough spell casters in our forces. I understand your concern though. I'll try to keep her out of the more risky assignment. Will that satisfy you?" said Lord Silvermore.

"NO!! But it will have to do." said Annabella's father. He then looked up and saw Eric waiting. "We'll continue this discussion later." He then turned around and stormed out of the room.

"Trouble?" asked Eric.

"The king doesn't approve of me using Annabella for missions. I need everyone if we're going to win this war. Are you ready to return to duty?" asked Lord Silvermore.

"I've been ready weeks ago." said Eric.

"I'm sorry,son. But I couldn't risk one of my finest because he wasn't at his best. I needed you fully healed. We could use your help now." said Lord Silvermore. They looked at the map of the land. The territories loyal to them had blue flags pinned to them while enemy territories had red flags. The contested territories had both a blue and a red flag pinned to them. Eric saw that 2 new contested territories had come up since the last time he checked the map. Arcania, which was once Irzac's territory and The Forest of the Fay, which was once loyal to them.

"Arcania is contested? Have the Arcanians finally joined us?" asked Eric.

"No. They're as stubborn as ever. But there is a opportunity there. The dragon-kin was once almost completely united under Irzac but my spies report that a new dragon-kin Chief have begun gathering tribes against Irzac's loyalists." said Lord Silvermore.

"How would I be able to help? Diplomacy isn't my strong suit." asked Eric.

"The dragon-kin mistrust humans more than ever now So I need a dragon or dragon-kin to go to them and you're the only one that isn't already on a mission." replied Lord Silvermore.

"What do we know of this chief?" asked Eric.

"Just about nothing. No name, No description. I don't even know what tribe he's from. Only thing I know is that he's charismatic and that his members follow him with a almost fanatical zeal." said Lord Silvermore.

"If we can tear the dragon-kin tribes away from Irzac, then it would be a big win for us. They make up a large number of Irzac's forces." said Eric.

"Won't be easy. Dragon-kin have always disliked humans. The Arcanians aren't helping. They've attacked both Irzac's loyalists and the rebels. They're trying to stop a single dragon-kin from uniting the tribes. We would be asking them to help their enemies to overthrow their dragon creators. I also don't know the motives of this mysterious leader. Does he have a grudge against Irzac or is he just doing this to amass power for himself?" said Lord Silvermore.

"What of the elves?" asked Eric.

"As you know. There was unrest among the elves before. The elven king has tried to calm things down but it only got worse after he rejoined us in fighting Irzac. The elven king has had to recall a large number of his forces to keep the peace. I suspect a elven lord who's sympathetic with Irzac has been stirring up the elves. Even the elven capital has begun to slip out of the king's grasp. We need to find out who's responsible or we'll lose the elves." said Lord Silvermore.

"Anything else?" asked Eric.

"These are the most important. I'll let you choose which one you want to do." said Lord Silvermore.

1143112112121111111111111111112111111111.content:
"I'll meet with this dragon-kin chief. Getting them to help us would be a big win." said Eric.

"Very well. I'll send someone else to the elves. Maybe Annabella? That would please her father. A diplomatic mission to a troubled territory is much safer that the other missions I have. She's good with diplomacy too so I'm hopeful that she'll be able to solve the situation." said Lord Silvermore.

"How am I going to meet with this chief if we don't know anything about him?" said Eric.

"You won't go directly to him. Instead I'll send you to a tribe that's loyal to him. You'll have to convince that chief to trust you and take you to meet this dragon-kin leader." said Lord Silvermore. They then spent the next hour talking about the different tribes, the personalities of the tribal chiefs, who was on which side as well as the many dragon-kin customs. "This is a recon mission as well, Eric. I need to know if there is a chance that we can gain the dragon-kin as a ally. If there isn't any hope then it might still be advantageous to kick out Irzac's loyalists."

"I'll do my best." said Eric.

"One last thing. Even though you are a dragon, I doubt the chief I'm sending you to will trust you immediately. He'll probably send you to attack his enemies to prove that you can be trusted. If you have to fight the Arcanians, please use your dragon form. If a dragon attacks their forces they'll just assume it's another rogue dragon but they'll recognize you if you attack in human form. If they find out our forces are attacking them then they'll declare war and we already have enough enemies." said Lord Silvermore.

"I'll do as you ask but I don't like it. The Arcanians aren't on Irzac's side. They're just trying to protect themselves." said Eric.

"I don't like it either but the Arcanians made their choice. Their greed, fear and stubbornness is putting us in danger now. Before you go. Can you please send Princess Annabella to me. I need to discuss her assignment with her." said Lord Silvermore. Eric left the room and went to where Annabella was waiting. After passing the message and saying his goodbyes, he left the city. Once he was a reasonable distance away, he took his dragon form and began to fly to Arcania. Eric heard about the hate and mistrust that most humans had for dragon kind now. So Eric, Silvermore and Esmerda continued to keep their dragon origins a secret from most. They were worried that if the people heard that their greatest champions were actually dragons, then the people would begin to lose faith in them.

"If it isn't my little brother. Why do you insist on living with inferior humans? Is it because you were once one yourself or was it because you found love? Maybe it could be both." teased Vanity who was hoping to provoke Eric to anger.

11431122.content:
Erik realized that he couldn't tell the woman that he was under a curse, so he thought up an excuse that wasn't too far from the truth. "Mother told me that a dragon doesn't eat humans, unless the human posses a significant threat to the dragon, or those they care about."

"Then what about those stories where dragons attack villages and towns?" the woman asked.

"Well, that would depend on the dragon," Erik said. "Most of the time, they try to scare people away, so that they can have a meal of sheep and cattle in peace. Other times, someone stole something from them, and they are trying to track the thief down. Other times though, you're dealing with a rogue, one who has broken the laws of dragon society, and is at risk of being killed by them anyways."

"What would put them at risk of that?" the woman asked.

"Eating humans," said Erik. "The problem is that those rogues give other dragons a bad name, and cause knights to come and hunt them down. My mother has had to deal with people like that, including my namesake."

"Your namesake?"

"Among dragon society, there's no better way to honor an enemy than to name one of your offspring after them," Erik said. "My mother named me Erikzon, which means 'of Erik'. He was a knight that she'd fought, shortly before I was born."

"I've heard of him," the woman said. "It's said that he killed a hundred dragons. Do you mean that your mother killed him?"

"She was defending her nest," Erik said, thinking quickly. "She wasn't going to leave my egg, or the others, to be smashed. She did what she had to do. I guess it was a fight to remember, because when I emerged from my egg, she named me Erikzon."

"But why would a dragon name their children after their enemy?" the woman asked.

"Like I said, it's out of respect," said Erik. "That and it keeps angry spirits from coming after those who killed them. By naming one of your offspring after them, it puts the spirit to rest, and they won't bother you, especially in the Afterlife."

"I guess that makes sense."

Erik smiled. For once, those lessons that Esmerda had given him on dragon lore were proving valuable. What he'd told the woman was indeed part of most dragons' beliefs, that naming a son or daughter after a fallen enemy kept their spirit from tormenting you, especially in the Afterlife.

"Do you think that you can get home alright?" Erik asked.

114311222.content:
"No, my village was burned down." the woman said in a downcast tone. "Those bandits were hired to put me to death because the church thought I was a witch."

"You don't look like a witch and why did they burn the village?"

"Like I said before the church convinced the villagers to burn the village in order to purify it from evil. Yet there not completely wrong though. Ever since I was a child I had unusual powers. Yet I can never use them at will for I don't know their origin. I grew up with my father but I never knew my mother. My father said that she died right after I was born having sustained serious injuries from a witch hunter. All of my life I've been running from village to village and town to town hoping to seek someone who could help me. I was finally lucky to find the village of Dracoson. There a noble and his wife took me in and taught me who to use my powers somewhat. Before the village was burned down the noble and his wife gave me this book. The only problem though is that I can't figure out what language that it is in."

"Let me take a look." Eric said.

The woman hands him the book.

"I see... No wonder why you're not able to read it. It's written in the Draconian tongue. Only a dragon or someone who knows how to speak the language can understand it."

"Draconian? I've read Elvish and Orcish along with many other human languages, but never Draconian. Yet I think the noble was well versed in just about every language and his wife as well. Yet when it comes to spell's I know several, but what use are they if I can't tap into my gift."

"If you'd like I could teach you how to read Draconian."

"At what price? If I remember correctly that if a human makes a deal with a dragon they must offer something in return" The woman says raising her hands in the air only for Eric to notice her birthmark on her shoulder.

"Tell me your name and how you acquired such a birthmark."

"The name's Esmerelda Starling. According to my father both he and mother had it. My father dared not to let me know anything about my family history for he died six years ago on my 14th birthday. He died of natural causes from a terrible case of the flu. He was skilled at magic like my mother was but claimed that he couldn't use his powers or else risk being exposed."

Eric then realize that woman was a Dracomancer, a magic user who is able to wield both sword and magic but usually preferring one over the other sometimes trained in both. Eric even remembers hearing legends that they have the ability to summon dragons and sometimes through the use of magic turn into dragons with free reign between both forms. Of course normal dragons could learn dracomancy in order to blend in with the human populace but it takes a long time to perfect while Dracomancers learn their craft faster. This is due to an ancient tale of dragons once breeding with humans in order to bring peace, a peace broken due to a rogue dragon and a wicked Dracomancer. Since then dragons and anyone who practices the magical arts have been hunted down either by the church, state, or sometimes both.

"Why don't you come with me and I'll find you a safe spot where no one will look."

Esmerelda then nods feeling faint from her injuries. Eric puts Esmerelda on his back and he finds an abandoned fortress that hasn't been used in years. Which is just a minute away from the cave if flying however twenty minutes by foot.

"Stay here and I'll bring you something in the morning."

With that Eric takes off heading back to the cave so Esmerda doesn't decided to roast his human body if he doesn't return. Esmerelda then sighs wishing to thank her unlikely hero in some form. When Sir Eric did not return to the village from his hunt, the villagers quite logically concluded that he had been slain by the dragon. He felt difficulty breathing, and it started to choke him, no air, no air, no...
